  • qa.com/QADEVSECOPS

DevSecOps Hands-on

Page Sections

Page Sections

  • Course Details
  • blog
  • Delivery Methods
  • Related Learning
  • More
    • Course Details
    • blog
    • Delivery Methods
    • Related Learning
Find dates and prices

About this Course

Tech Type Performance Plus
Code QADEVSECOPS
Duration 3 Days

DevSecOps has been described as 'security as code', 'a marriage of DevOps and Security' and 'Shifting security to the left'. Traditional security approaches are inefficient and largely ineffective for organisations using Agile, DevOps and Cloud - as illustrated by the massive amount of recent data breaches. DevSecOps is a new approach which embeds security to each DevOps team, with automated security testing at all stages of the software development lifecycle. Security infrastructure, policies, controls, compliance, audit and even secure operations are all coded and automated, with almost no manual processes.

This three day hands-on course begins with an overview of the DevSecOps approach, framework and DevSecOps toolkit, then looks at application security, the elements of a secure software development lifecycle, and the use of automated application security tests as part of the continuous integration / continuous deployment pipeline. Next we move on to cloud security, infrastructure as code, and potential security issues which can arise from the agile DevOps process. We cover the implementation of security controls as code, ranging from security policies, secrets management, encryption, identity and access management, to logging, monitoring and alerting. Containers and serverless architectures are introduced and potential security issues highlighted, with a review of container security technologies. A DevSecOps approach is used to integrate automated security tests and mitigate security risks. Continuous compliance as code is covered, using different approaches and appropriate DevSecOps tools for prevention, detection and remediation, leading to the concept of audit as code.

A new model for Security Operations is presented with security incident identification, management and response as code, making use of big data analysis, artificial intelligence and machine learning, alongside more traditional techniques such as signature detection and threat intelligence feeds. Finally, we look at the people aspect of DevSecOps, moving away from technology and code, to organisational and cultural aspects, skills development, team effectiveness and recruitment approaches.

The course is delivered through presentations, practical demonstrations and labs. You will gain practical hands-on experience of DevSecOps tools, automated security tests and serverless applications. You will implement security improvements to infrastructure as code, and deploy continuous compliance tools to provide ongoing security assurance for a cloud environment.

Due to the interactive nature of the course and labs, it will be delivered on site at QA training centres and is not suitable for online learning.

Show more Show less

Prerequisites

This course is primarily aimed at:

  • Application developers, DevOps engineers, team leaders and managers wishing to improve their knowledge of security and DevSecOps
  • Security and information risk professionals looking to develop their understanding of DevSecOps framework and tools, coding, automation and the changes needed to ensure effective security in a DevOps culture

There are no particular pre-requisites, however delegates will benefit from any knowledge and experience of DevOps, application and infrastructure security.

Show more Show less

Learning Outcomes

Delegates will learn about the following topics:

  • DevSecOps approach, framework and toolkit
  • Automated application security testing integrated to CI/CD pipeline
  • Cloud security, infrastructure as code, unit and integration tests
  • Containers, security issues and container security solutions
  • Continuous compliance as code
  • Serverless functions, architectures, automated remediation
  • A DevSecOps model for security operations
  • People aspects of DevSecOps
Show more Show less

Course Outline

DAY ONE

Introduction

  • Introductions
  • Objectives of course
  • Agenda

DevSecOps Approach, Framework and Toolkit

  • DevOps fundamentals
  • Lab: Application Development Pipeline
  • Why a traditional security approach doesn't work
  • What is DevSecOps?
  • DevSecOps approach
  • DevSecOps framework
  • DevSecOps toolkit

Automated Application Security Testing

  • OWASP Top 10
  • Secure Software Development Lifecycle
  • Application Security Testing Tools
  • Lab: Integrate Application Security Test to Pipeline

Infrastructure as Code and Unit Tests

  • Infrastructure as Code
  • Unit Tests
  • Lab: InSpec

DAY TWO

Cloud Security

  • AWS EC2
  • Lab: Infrastructure as Code
  • AWS Security
  • Cloud automation
  • Secrets management

Continuous Compliance

  • Continuous Compliance Framework
  • Policy as code
  • Audit as code
  • Lab: Cloud Compliance
  • Lab: Discover Secrets
  • Demo: Policy as code in Azure

DAY THREE

Containers

  • Concept of containers
  • Docker
  • Security Issues of containers
  • Orchestration
  • Container security solutions
  • Integration to CI / CD pipeline
  • Lab: Container security

Serverless

  • Concept of serverless
  • AWS Lambda, Azure Cloud Functions, Google Cloud Functions
  • Serverless application architecture
  • Security implications
  • Lab: Deploy serverless application to cloud using CI / CD pipeline

A DevSecOps model for Security Operations

  • Why the traditional Security Operations Center is no longer effective
  • A DevSecOps model for Security Operations
  • Data analysis, security incident identification and analysis as code
  • Elastic stack (formerly ELK stack)
  • Artificial Intelligence, machine learning and data discovery tools
  • Security Incident Response as code
  • Red Teams and Blue Teams
  • Real-life Cloud Security Issues
  • Demonstrations of real-life cloud security issues

People aspects of DevSecOps

  • Culture
  • Organisation
  • Skills and training
  • Security champions
  • Recruitment
  • Team effectiveness

Show more Show less

Read more in our expert blog.

DevSecOps Hands-On

by Paul Schwarzenberger | 4 September 2018

As a national training company we offer a range of job roles, across multiple locations, all over the UK. So whatever your experience and wherever you're based, we're likely to have something to suit you.

Our registered office and postal address is Rath House, 55-65 Uxbridge Road, Slough, Berkshire, SL1 1SG
QA is registered in England No. 2413137

View Detail

Customer Service Administrator

Focus on training

Peterborough

Customer Service Administrator – Based in Peterborough

What is the role?

To process customer’s orders and handle customer queries both via telephone and email. To carry out schedule updates on Focus website and liaise with suppliers. To invoice customer orders and solve any customer or supplier queries.

  • Provide advice and assistance to customers
  • Manage invoicing process and payment
  • Liaise with customers in regards to their orders and record details of enquiries, comments and complaints within the CRM system
  • Take payments by credit card over the phone
  • Process bookings with all Training Providers including setting up bookings on providers systems where necessary
  • Liaise with suppliers for schedule updates and process orders and maintain excellent relationships with them
  • Liaise with wider company accounting teams
  • Support the Sales Executive(s) in the achievement of monthly sales targets
  • Assist in the arrangement of in-house courses
  • Assist in maintaining accurate and complete course data on company website including editing products descriptions
  • Adhere to all Company policies, including, but not limited to Health and Safety policy, IT User policy and Anti–Bribery policy.
  • Any additional tasks that you are assigned by your line manager or a senior member of staff

Financial package and benefits

A competitive base salary (dependent on experience), pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

We offer 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan,  and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

Skills & Experience Required

  • Highly organised and reliable
  • Positive personality
  • Driven to succeed
  • Ability to prioritise and work independently as well as under pressure
  • Good IT skills, especially MS Excel and Word
  • Accurate accounting ability essential
  • Strong English written and verbal skills will be an advantage
  • Ability to learn a new area and systems quickly
  • Previous experience working in a small and successful office serving customer bookings will be an advantage

About US

FOCUS is part of QA Ltd. Focus on Training is a leading provider of training courses and best practice skills development in the UK and internationally.

 View Detail

Account Manager

Apprenticeships

Glasgow

The Role?

Recruiters, Account Managers, BD Managers, Sales Executives... we want YOU! If you're based IN GLASGOW and are looking for the next step in your career PLEASE RESPOND TODAY.

Based in the Glasgow office, you will play a key role in the whole sales cycle for apprentices, from bringing on new clients, building lasting relationships and account managing, to sourcing and placing apprentices within the workplace, you will play a crucial role within the team.

Using a consultative sales approach (which we will train you on), you will contact UK business leaders about taking on apprentices, something which is a valuable sell into a company adding benefits to both employers and candidates alike. You will be helping an apprentice get into the workplace and better their future prospects, whilst giving the client an individual who they can develop, mould and grow into their business.

You will have your own individual target which you will be rewarded against. You will be targeted on hitting/over-achieving monthly margin targets, increasing the number of buying customers in the account base, and continuously improving NPI (customer service) ratings.

The ideal candidate will have entrepreneurial spirit and determination, confidence and a proven track record in account management.

Financial Package and Benefits?

We understand that as an experienced sales professional you are not easy to prise away from the success you have built, therefore we are offering a competitive opportunity including a competitive commission package. Other benefits include Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

If you are interested in moving your career forward, please click apply

 View Detail

Account Manager x3

Learning, Government & Defence

Cheltenham

A truly exciting opportunity based in Cheltenham.

 

You will be part of a successful, highly driven and professional learning organisation. Based on site within one of QA’s largest managed learning services customers, you will perform a high quality business development role where you will maintain and develop relationships by building on the existing relationships and by exposing new business opportunities. You will be focused on a key customer for QA and in addition to supporting with their learning requirements you will also have a strong emphasis on relationship building, customer service and revenue generation.

Key Responsibilites

• Creating sustainable business relationships
• Identifying business opportunities and provide accurate forecasting of sales pipeline
• Preparing high quality quotes and proposals for customers
• Proactive follow up on new business opportunities with client’s with a consultative and informative approach
• Effective Customer service management
• Maintaining all relevant management information systems
• Prospecting for new customers and stakeholders
• Proactively seeks ways to engage with clients such as informal catch ups, polling interest on new products, attending exhibitions and seminars
• Proactively promotes the QA service and products within the client using forums such as in-house social media tools
• Support Marketing activity as required such as attendance at exhibitions, manning stands, creating product information handouts.
• Offer guidance to the QA Account management team on dealing with customer queries, where required.
• Ensures delivery of excellent customer service through fast and accurate processing of requirements, communication and coordinating with other departments to resolve enquiries.
• Maintains excellent knowledge of QA learning products and provides professional advice on suitable training courses to meet delegate requirements.
• Supports Learning Consultants with attending client meetings, preparing quotes and advising clients on larger scale projects.
• Proactively seek opportunity to advise customers in a face to face environment and maintaining excellent relationships.
• Providing support to the Customer Engagement Manager
• Research, Liaise and negotiate with key third party providers

Skills & Abilities

 • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Outlook)
• An entrepreneurial spirit and determination
• Confidence and a strong sense of direction
• Excellent communication skills and telephone manner
• The ability to operate well and contribute to a strong team environment
• Strong understanding of sales processes
• Methodical and accurate with a proven ability to focus on detail
• Highly Self-motivated with initiative and drive.
• Proven organisational & planning skills.
• Clear and effective communication and negotiation skills are a must.
• Uses initiative in identifying and resolving complex problems and assignments.
• Determines when problems should be escalated to a senior member of the team
• Able to act promptly to make relevant parties aware of issues
• Displays a flare for seeking out new opportunities to improve the service and increase revenues/margins

Benefits

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, and we try to ensure that everyone has the opportunity to take advantage of our huge and varied range of learning and development options, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.
We also know that many people like to “give back” and so we offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose.  And if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250.  This is over and above the charitable activities that we encourage through our annual QA fundraising drives – you can get involved with this as much or as little as you like.  We see it as a great way to foster team building too.
We all need to take time out to recharge our batteries from time to time and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.
It’s important, too, to plan for the future and ensure we are able to maintain the lifestyle we have worked so hard to achieve, once we retire from the hurly burly and slow down to enjoy our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 5% of your basic salary.
Then there are two of our core benefit offerings, not the most exciting, but we consider it important to ensure everyone has the peace of mind provided by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.
And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices:
• Season ticket loan
• Discounted gym membership
• Cycle to work scheme
 
An attracticve salary and bonus is on offer for this very exciting role
 
QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.
At QA, we are proud to help people and businesses transform their performance through learning; we offer a complete range of business and IT training. With training centres throughout the UK, QA delivers an exceptionally broad training curriculum to meet the needs of individuals and corporate businesses. Our award-winning teams of learning professionals are amongst the best in the world, each with extensive experience and a proven track record of delivering the skills that transform performance and ensure lasting benefits.
 View Detail

Account Manager, Government Services

Learning

London

A truly exciting opportunity based in London.

You will be part of a successful, highly driven and professional learning organisation. Based in London working within Government services, you will perform a high quality business development role where you will maintain and develop relationships by building on the existing relationships and by exposing new business opportunities. You will be focused on a key customer for QA and in addition to supporting with their learning requirements you will also have a strong emphasis on relationship building, customer service and revenue generation.

Key Responsibilites

• Creating sustainable business relationships
• Identifying business opportunities and provide accurate forecasting of sales pipeline
• Preparing high quality quotes and proposals for customers
• Proactive follow up on new business opportunities with client’s with a consultative and informative approach
• Effective Customer service management
• Maintaining all relevant management information systems
• Prospecting for new customers and stakeholders
• Proactively seeks ways to engage with clients such as informal catch ups, polling interest on new products, attending exhibitions and seminars
• Proactively promotes the QA service and products within the client using forums such as in-house social media tools
• Support Marketing activity as required such as attendance at exhibitions, manning stands, creating product information handouts.
•• Ensures delivery of excellent customer service through fast and accurate processing of requirements, communication and coordinating with other departments to resolve enquiries.
• Maintains excellent knowledge of QA learning products and provides professional advice on suitable training courses to meet delegate requirements.
• Proactively seek opportunity to advise customers in a face to face environment and maintaining excellent relationships.
• Providing support to the Client Director


• Skills & Abilities

  An entrepreneurial spirit and determination
• Confidence and a strong sense of direction
• Excellent communication skills and telephone manner
• The ability to operate well and contribute to a strong team environment
• Strong understanding of sales processes
• Methodical and accurate with a proven ability to focus on detail
• Highly Self-motivated with initiative and drive.
• Proven organisational & planning skills.
• Clear and effective communication and negotiation skills are a must.
• Uses initiative in identifying and resolving complex problems and assignments.
• Experience in working in Government services a real advantage
• Able to act promptly to make relevant parties aware of issues
• Displays a flare for seeking out new opportunities to improve the service and increase revenues/margins

 

Benefits

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, and we try to ensure that everyone has the opportunity to take advantage of our huge and varied range of learning and development options, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.
We also know that many people like to “give back” and so we offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose.  And if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250.  This is over and above the charitable activities that we encourage through our annual QA fundraising drives – you can get involved with this as much or as little as you like.  We see it as a great way to foster team building too.
We all need to take time out to recharge our batteries from time to time and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.
It’s important, too, to plan for the future and ensure we are able to maintain the lifestyle we have worked so hard to achieve, once we retire from the hurly burly and slow down to enjoy our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 5% of your basic salary.
Then there are two of our core benefit offerings, not the most exciting, but we consider it important to ensure everyone has the peace of mind provided by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.
And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices:
• Season ticket loan
• Discounted gym membership
• Cycle to work scheme
 
An attracticve salary and bonus is on offer for this very exciting role
 
QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.
At QA, we are proud to help people and businesses transform their performance through learning; we offer a complete range of business and IT training. With training centres throughout the UK, QA delivers an exceptionally broad training curriculum to meet the needs of individuals and corporate businesses. Our award-winning teams of learning professionals are amongst the best in the world, each with extensive experience and a proven track record of delivering the skills that transform performance and ensure lasting benefits.
 View Detail

Administrator

Learning

Swindon

Partner Solutions Administrator

Join the QA Team in Swindon as a Partner Solutions Coordinator

What is the role?

To provide high quality, administration and logistical support within the Partner Solutions team. The primary function of the Partner Solutions Coordinator is to be a first point of contact for our customer first stage queries, dealing with those queries and escalating where necessary.

  • Obtain and provide quotes for various training needs in accordance with client specific rates and standard QA rates
  • Research, respond and advise on queries for suppliers courses
  • Establish and manage relationships with all suppliers and ensure that the relevant systems are kept up to date
  • Confirm bookings on booking system (including raising and issuing Purchase orders) and process via agreed timescales
  • Confirm with suppliers bookings received
  • Ensure Suppliers are aware of QA standard payment terms and work with our Finance team to ensure that courses requiring prepayment are managed effectively
  • Work with sales team to confirm bookings in a timely manner
  • Follow up with suppliers for delegate joining instructions
  • Process all cancellations and transfers
  • Logistical arrangements for onsite training (co-ordinating between booker and supplier)
  • Escalate matters where appropriate but aim to develop sufficient awareness of QA and the client in order to work

What we offer?

No one wants to work for free so here’s what we give you:

A highly competitive base salary dependent on experience, pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

We offer 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan, and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

What do we do?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Must haves (We do need the following):

  • High standard of numeracy and literacy
  • Ability to work alone or part of a team
  • Methodical and accurate approach to tasks
  • Customer focused
  • Good communication skills written, face to face and written
  • Ability to multi - task and prioritise workload

If you’ve read the above, feel we are the company for you. Then apply to us today. Speak soon…

Administrator

Learning

Swindon

Join the QA Team in Swindon as a Partner Solutions Coordinator

What is the role?

To provide high quality, administration and logistical support within the Partner Solutions team. The primary function of the Partner Solutions Coordinator is to be a first point of contact for our customer first stage queries, dealing with those queries and escalating where necessary.

  • Obtain and provide quotes for various training needs in accordance with client specific rates and standard QA rates
  • Research, respond and advise on queries for suppliers courses
  • Establish and manage relationships with all suppliers and ensure that the relevant systems are kept up to date
  • Confirm bookings on booking system (including raising and issuing Purchase orders) and process via agreed timescales
  • Confirm with suppliers bookings received
  • Ensure Suppliers are aware of QA standard payment terms and work with our Finance team to ensure that courses requiring prepayment are managed effectively

 View Detail

Admissions and Assessments Officer

Higher Education

London

QA Higher Education offers a range of courses through our partnership with various universities across the country. We offer globally recognised, fully accredited British degrees at Bachelor’s and Master’s levels, as well as a range of other courses and qualifications and over 90% of graduates are in employment or pursuing further studies within six months of graduating. This is one of the highest employment / further study rates in the UK.

You will work as a member of the Admissions Team taking responsibility for:

  • Processing applications of within a defined entry criteria
  • Assessing all applications and recommending the next steps required
  • Achieving a positive applicant experience
  • Ensuring all applications are processed within the agreed KPI’s and to the highest standard
  • Taking ownership and responsibility for processes and outcomes

As the Admission Officer, you will:

  • Review incoming applications, validate applicants’ academic records and/or professional experience
  • Ensure admissions procedures are in place and maintained in accordance with the QA and partner Universities' guidelines and procedures and in compliance with partner Universities’ Accreditation and UKVI regulations
  • Conduct admissions interviews where required
  • Ensure the CRM system is consistently updated and information is detailed and accurate and that appropriate student data is recorded and maintained in compliance with partner Universities’ accrediting bodies and UKVI regulations.
  • Provide clarifications to student’s queries in a professional manner.
  • Work closely with enrolment team to ensure required documentation is received in order to process applications within set deadlines.
  • Communicate admissions decisions to applicants
  • Provide statistical data on incoming students to the leadership team
  • Manage, monitor and ensure accurate and up to date audit trails for all CAS applications
  • Develop and maintain up to date knowledge of all programmes available
  • Keep up to date with UKVI Tier 4 policy

As the Admission Officer, you will have:

  • Education to Degree Level
  • Ability to speak a foreign language would be an advantage
  • Proven track record of successfully operating in the education sector in a similar role
  • Experience of working with International Students
  • Experience of working in a customer-focused environment
  • Understanding of the application process and higher education admission

Sounds interesting? Please apply with your CV, we look forward to talking to you.

 View Detail

Agile & Scrum Trainer - Scotland

Learning

Glasgow

 

QA delivers market-leading learning services through four distinct business units, providing professional and IT training to private and public sector organisations, apprenticeships and higher education.  We have won numerous awards for excellence, customer service and innovation.  We are set apart by our scale, capability and customer-centric approach that delivers real business return to our customers.

 

OUR Role

As Agile & Scrum Trainer, you will be ideally be based around Glasgow Area and be qualified to deliver our Agile and Scrum curriculum. With excellent working knowledge of Agile and Scrum in an IT and/or business environments you will have a passion, hunger and thirst to deliver quality training to the market. The successful candidate will also have strong software development skills. Ideally, they would involve the Microsoft toolset including C#, .NET and Visual Studio. As an Agile and Scrum Trainer, you will also be responsible for the development and management of courseware. You will have proven customer facing, interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to work independently.

We are offering a competitive financial package + our leading company benefits. 

YOUR Experience

The successful candidate for this role will need to be an expert in Agile and Scrum software development with the skills and aptitude to continue to develop these skills as part of a continuous and development lifecycle.

The candidate will also have strong software development skills. Ideally, they would involve the Microsoft toolset including C#, .NET and Visual Studio.

Excellent customer facing, presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to share expertise with others

Team player who can also adapt to working solo for long periods

A passion for Agile and Scrum and the acquiring of new skills and experience

Be prepared to travel to different locations in the UK (and sometimes abroad) with occasional stays away from home

 

In return we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential. 

 

 View Detail

Agile Project Management Trainer

Learning

London

 

As an Agile Trainer, you will be ideally be based around the London Area and be qualified to deliver our Agile and Scrum curriculum. With excellent working knowledge of Agile and Scrum in an IT and/or business environments, you will have a passion, hunger and thirst to deliver quality training to the market.

The successful candidate will also have strong software development skills. Ideally, they would involve the Microsoft toolset including C#, .NET and Visual Studio. 

As Agile Trainer, you will also be responsible for the development and management of courseware. You will have proven customer facing, interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to work independently.

YOUR Experience

You will need to be an expert in Agile and Scrum software development with the skills and aptitude to continue to develop these skills as part of a continuous and development lifecycle.

You will also have strong software development skills. Ideally, they would involve the Microsoft toolset including C#, .NET and Visual Studio.

Excellent customer facing, presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to share expertise with others

Team player who can also adapt to working solo for long periods

A passion for Agile and Scrum and the acquiring of new skills and experience

Be prepared to travel to different locations in the UK (and sometimes abroad) with occasional stays away from home

 

In return, we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential.

Agile trainer Flexible working considered - T/B

Learning

London, Glasgow

Agile trainer – Flexible working considered

Teaching learners hireable skills to transform their lives and careers. Top-notch, in-demand Agile course content. Flexibility, fulfilment and a great salary. Sound appealing? Then we’ve got the role for you.

We’re seeking Agile trainers based in London, Glasgow, Leeds and Birmingham who love helping others learn and accomplish their goals. This is an exciting, fulfilling role helping learners to grow their skills and achieve their potential.

This could be a perfect career if you are a current Agile trainer or an Agile pro working in HR, project management, software development, software testing, business analysis or service delivery management and looking to upskill. We’ll provide thorough delivery training to get you ready to share your expertise with others.

About the role

At QA, we know that real life doesn’t happen in a textbook, so we deliver our courses in a modern, hands-on format. With our support, you’ll deliver exciting Agile course content face-to-face in the classroom and through e-Learning or digital formats. You’ll teach both scheduled public and customised Agile courses from QA’s famous tech course portfolio.

This role is about teaching and supporting learners to help them succeed – whether they’re qualified professionals looking to take their skills to the next level or beginners making the leap into tech careers.

You are…

  • Experienced in Agile in one or more of these environments: human resources, project management, software development, software testing, business analysis or service delivery management (mandatory)
  • Experienced in training or tutoring with an interest in career development (delivery training provided if needed)
  • Passionate about supporting/teaching others and sharing your expertise
  • Confident in customer-facing roles with strong presentation, interpersonal and communication skills
  • Eligible to live and work in the UK and able to travel to different locations (?)
  • Able to plan and deliver against set learning and achievement targets

What we offer

  • Generous base salary (dependent on experience)
  • Private pension
  • 25 days holiday
  • Two days paid charity work for a charity of your choice
  • Three days of paid training from your choice of 1,200+ diverse QA courses
  • Subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme

Who are we?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We help develop skills and capabilities for everyone, from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London with 20 more training centres nationwide, QA Group comprises four fast-growing divisions – QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education – all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) and ever-evolving skills solutions.

 

 

 View Detail

Amazon Web Services (AWS) Trainer x 2 roles

Learning

London

Do you want to put your AWS experience to greater use?

Are you currently an Amazon Web Services qualified professional who enjoys coaching in your current role but feel your experience could be used to teach?

Then why not become an AWS Trainer!

Why apply?

If you’re based in (or near) London, had enough of contracting or your permanent role is no longer challenging you. How about doing something different and working for one of the UK’s largest Education providers, where you help others understand the world of Amazon Web Services …then this role is perfect for you.

What is the role?

Based in London (near Tower Hill tube station), you will be delivering both public scheduled and bespoke courses for all appropriate areas of QA’s AWS  Portfolio.

With our support, you will deliver/coach using face to face, e-Learning or digital AWS courses and content to all appropriate areas within QA to likeminded people. Whether they are a highly qualified professional or a beginner looking to get into the world of AWS. 

How will we support you?

Using your AWS experience, we will help you achieve your Trainer/Coaching accreditation/qualification which gives you the confidence and knowledge to teach/coach.

You will also be assigned a co-pilot/buddy to help get you up to speed throughout your training period and beyond.

Financial package and benefits 

We are offering a competitive base salary (dependant on experience), private pension as well as 25 days holiday. 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Must have's:

  • Recent hands-on experience with AWS infrastructure services.
  • AWS certification
  • Experience architecting, deploying and operating Internet-scale operations
  • Experience with virtualization technologies or cloud services

Nice to have’s:

  • Linux or Windows command line skills.
  • Coding experience in one or more of Java, .NET, Perl, PHP, Ruby or Python.
  • Experience in the delivery of AWS or relevant course

Who are we?

As one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We like to help develop skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  With our HQ in London and 20 training centres nationwide, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) & ever-evolving skills solutions.

So interested? If so please apply today…

 

 

 

 

 View Detail

Recruitment Advisor

Apprenticeships

Slough

Passionate about helping others launch successful careers? Are you caring and customer-oriented, committed to making a real difference by supporting learners and keen to join a growing team in a role with OTE earning potential?

What is the role?

We’re looking for an Advisor, based in our Slough office, to help manage our pool of candidates and get them placed into exciting, career-changing apprenticeship programmes. Reporting into the Engagement Manager, you’ll be the first point of contact for candidates and parents and will provide support with engagement, events, marketing efforts, administration and data reporting as our strategies and processes constantly streamline and evolve.

You will play a key role in engaging potential apprenticeship learners, screening the candidate, informing them about QA as a business and getting them apprenticeship ready! You will work closely with the Engagement Manager to deliver a smooth pre-apprenticeship process and deliver a great level of customer service. You will be the first point of contact an apprentice will have with the business, so your role is essential in the candidate experience!

This is an ideal position for someone with previous experience in early recruitment or an HR role, and would suit someone looking to re-launch their career after a break.

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive salary (dependant on experience), Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme, to name but a few of the benefits!

About QA Apprenticeships

QA Apprenticeships - As the fastest growing division of QA, we are now the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services apprenticeships. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with an amazing 'outstanding’ in all areas.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

 View Detail

Resourcer - Apprenticeships

Apprenticeships

Manchester

Are you an experienced Resourcer looking for a new challenge?

Do you have a passion for customer service and high-level administration/coordination?

If so, this could be the perfect opportunity for you...

What you will be doing?

This role will be dedicated to identifying and securing the best future talent for QA Apprenticeships’ larger corporate clients. With candidate experience and fit for the apprenticeship being your priority, you will provide the best possible resourcing service for our corporate clients. Working with various internal and external stakeholders, you will report into the Corporate Resourcing Team Leader.

What you need?

You will need to have a methodical approach and be able to prioritise your workload as it changes. You will be a great communicator who will be interacting with both internal and external stakeholders. You will have good problem solving skills and experience in working in a similar environment.

What you receive?

Competitive package  including bonus and company benefits, pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

You will get 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan, and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

About Us

Formed in 2009, QA Apprenticeships is the first IT apprenticeships business rated Ofsted Outstanding. We are an award-winning provider, offering IT, developer, digital marketing, project management and business apprenticeships throughout England and Scotland. Our apprentices work with industry leaders including Atos, British Gas, BskyB and Cisco. We have won the coveted Apprenticeship Programme of the Year award for three consecutive years at The Learning Awards 2012, 2013 & 2014, and we are the leading apprenticeship partner for Microsoft, Oracle, HPE, Cisco and Association of Project Management.

 View Detail

Assistant Lecturer

Apprenticeships

Leeds, Bristol, Newcastle, London, Birmingham, Manchester

Assistant Lecturer DEGREE Apprenticeships – Data Science

Flexible location E.G. London OR Birmingham OR Leeds OR Bristol OR Manchester OR Newcastle

About our role: 

Are you a current academic OR working in industry with a passion for teaching, imparting knowledge, engendering new skills and behaviours, and keeping up-to-date in an ever-changing world? Do you want to deliver outstanding industry informed teaching on our fully blended and innovative BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships?

At QA we are passionate about the positive impact of degree apprenticeships as a means of enabling engagement with Higher Education for the wider social spectrum.  We are committed to developing innovative means of teaching that support the new modes of study required by modern students. 

You will be working within a growing team where we all work, support and learn from each other in order to provide our Learners with a dedicated, exceptional level of service that we are extremely proud to be part of.    

As Assistant Lecturer you will be expected to teach on modules in areas related to Data Science, but also bringing your wider expertise in related areas (e.g. Mathematics for Computing, Big Data, AI, Cloud Computing, Enterprise Architectures, etc.).

We recognise the value of having a range of skillsets within our academic team, so whether you are an industry professional with acknowledgeable skills in teaching and learning, or an academic with close ties to industry, this role could suit you.

About the programmes:

The BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships involve the delivery of a number of computing streams which incorporate Software Engineering, Computer Networking, Cyber Security, Big Data, Analytics and Maths, and broader areas of Computer Science.

Our programmes use a mixture of distance and face-to-face teaching and facilitation across the country using experiential and spiral methods to develop theories-in-action in a work-based learning approach that is both scholarly and professional.

Our use of skills coaches (who visit the learners in the workplace) and their liaison with you is designed to create a progressive and valuable experience for every student and their employer.

Our learners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and work for an equally wide variety of companies including some of the biggest technology companies in Europe.

Your focus: 

You will be expected to teach across a number of modules on our degree apprenticeship programmes and be able to accommodate learners integrating material from any module, into any role, in any sector.

As important is role-modelling your interest in inquiry and focussing into organisations to promote the professional development of our learners (their employees).  

We work as a geographically dispersed but close-knit team, sharing teaching experiences and new ideas. We challenge each other and work determinedly and efficiently, to reach ever improving teaching and learning standards and outcomes.

You will be required to teach and facilitate in face-to-face sessions across the breadth of QA sites as the teaching schedule requires.  This may require overnight stays.

Bring your experience: 

Please see the attached Job descriptions for Assistant Lecturer.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you?

Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

Our benefits and values:

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. 

We look forward to hearing from you!  

 View Detail

Associate Dean (NUL) / Head of Department

Higher Education

London

Associate Dean and Head of Department (NUL)

London   

About our role: As Associate Dean and Head of Department your prime role is to provide strong academic leadership. The role requires that as Associate Dean, the role holder will have significant responsibility and accountability for the management of the academic partnership with our partner university. This includes working closely with the Dean of Faculty, maintaining a constructive and positive relationship with the university, building strong external communication lines, resolving academic related issues that may arise in conjunction with the partner and ensuring adherence to the regulations and procedures of the relevant partner university along with QAHE faculty and boards. As head of a department, you will lead, manage and develop a department of staff to ensure it achieves the highest possible standards of excellence in all its activities, supported by the Dean of Faculty, and by colleagues from within the department, faculty, and central services.

Your focus:  You will be able to demonstrate excellent student outcomes, retention and achievement and have the ability to set best practice.

Bring your experience:

  •  Doctorate (or close to completion) as role includes teaching on AACSB approved Northumbria University programmes for which this requirement is essential
  • Postgraduate qualification, preferably in subjects to be taught, is essential
  • Expertise in subject area in one or more of the following areas Business and Management / Finance / IT is essential
  • Successful record of leadership and programme management in at least one of the academic areas within the Faculty is essential
  • Experience of effective people management including the management of diverse groups of professional staff is essential
  • Experience of improving and developing learning and teaching practice is essential
  • Successful track record of developing and sustaining a high quality student experience is essential
  • Successful track record of improving and sustaining student outcomes is essential
  • Track record of programme development and validation is desirable
  • Relevant teaching qualification, HEA fellowship or significant teaching experience with a commitment to achieving the required Professional Standards for teaching is essential
  • Experience of working as a member of a senior team in a large and complex organisation is desirable
  • Experience of managing strategic planning issues in HE is desirable
  • Experience of building close relationships with key internal and external parties, particularly with university partners is desirable

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations. Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they are interested in.

QAHE benefits and values:

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time with 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 4% of your basic salary.

To give peace of mind, we provide Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Working at QAHE: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team. Perhaps the most significant difference visible on campus is that traditional universities tend to be quite empty (of academic staff) as lecturers spend much less time in the office. There is a friendly and supportive atmosphere here at QAHE with typically far more team-working, promoted in part by more regular staff attendance on campus and in the staff offices. Some potential candidates will find this, and the emphasis on teaching rather than research, very attractive. Academic staff in traditional universities of all ranks are placed under significant demand for research outputs and so have to balance a teaching load and the associated administration with their research obligations. To some this feels like a burden (particularly when expectations around consultancy are added) and QAHE are keen to ensure a far more balanced workload approach across the team.

Closing Date: No closing date set, open until role filled

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link (where you will find the full role profile), please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly.

 

We look forward to hearing from you! 

 View Detail

Business Analyst ASSESSOR

Apprenticeships

London

IT Business Analyst Assessor / Coach

Fulltime & Permanent Role (Industry candidates very welcome to apply)  

About our role: Are you a current Business Analyst who enjoys coaching, and facilitating learning in the workplace? Or are you a current Business Analyst Assessor looking for a new opportunity to coach, mentor and guide our workplace experienced apprentices who are hungry to grow their skills to gain our L4 Qualification giving them career progression and further development. A rewarding role as you watch your learners grow.      

Your focus:  Having an average caseload of around 45, you will engage with our learners to complete planned assessments in various Business Analyst subjects (Requirements Engineering, Business Process Modelling, Systems Modelling etc.) as per the qualification standard. You will also have the skills to carry out some training of the above subjects to your active learners.

Your approach, organisation, proactivity and coaching skills will help retain learners and ensure each student achieves their assigned projects and qualification in line with the targets and objectives you have agreed in the Individual Learning Plan.

Bring your experience:

Experience working as a Business Analyst delivering IT change projects.

Recognised Business Analysis qualifications such as: BCS Diploma in Business Analysis or individual certificates such as Requirements Engineering, Business Process Modelling, Systems Modelling, Commercial Awareness, UAT etc.   

Excellent communication skills

A logical thinker and a passion to achieve

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.       

More about the Team you will be working with: Working with our delivery teams you will enhance the quality and development of our learners, providing a first class and exceptional level of service.    

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Business Development Executive QA Consulting x2

Consulting

Brighton

Business Development Executive – QA Consulting

Are you a driven sales person, ready for a new challenge in a consultative new business role where you own your relationships and clients, building excellent long term relationships in a rewarding and technical sales environment.   

About our role?

As new business professional you will advise/consult across multiple divisions to offer large scale solutions using QAC’s very own Academy and experienced consultants.

You will be responsible for managing the end to end sales cycle, from lead generation, client meetings, proposal writing, commercial negotiation and onboarding of new business. This may also include defining go to market strategy for a new vertical market. Once the client has been on boarded and consultant’s deployed, you will manage the ongoing relationship, and grow the account accordingly. You will be measured against achievement of targets based on gross profit generated by billing consultants.

Team & Office

If that wasn’t enough, this brand new office has a pool table, table tennis and meetings rooms for you to conduct meetings with potential clients.

About us - QA Consulting?

As the fastest growing division of QA, (three times the size they were at the start of the year to be precise) QAC provides Consulting Services to a range of commercial, financial and Government organisations across the UK. With capabilities ranging from core programming to configuration, DevOps to Data, integration to implementation QAC support a wide range of customer business transformation initiatives.

Financial package and benefits 

We understand that as an experienced sales professional you are not easy to prise away from the success you have built, therefore we are offering a competitive salary + excellent commission, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

Sounds interesting? 

I look forward to hearing from you.

Business Development Manager

Apprenticeships

London

The Role?

Recruiters, Account Managers, BD Managers, Sales Executives... we want YOU! If you're based IN LONDON and are looking for the next step in your career PLEASE RESPOND TODAY.

Based in the London office, you will play a key role in the whole sales cycle for apprentices, from bringing on new clients, building lasting relationships and account managing, to sourcing and placing apprentices within the workplace, you will play a crucial role within the team.

Using a consultative sales approach (which we will train you on), you will contact UK business leaders about taking on apprentices, something which is a valuable sell into a company adding benefits to both employers and candidates alike. You will be helping an apprentice get into the workplace and better their future prospects, whilst giving the client an individual who they can develop, mould and grow into their business.

You will have your own individual target which you will be rewarded against. You will be targeted on hitting/over-achieving monthly margin targets, increasing the number of buying customers in the account base, and continuously improving NPI (customer service) ratings.

The ideal candidate will have entrepreneurial spirit and determination, confidence and a proven track record in account management.

Financial Package and Benefits?

We understand that as an experienced sales professional you are not easy to prise away from the success you have built, therefore we are offering a competitive opportunity including a competitive commission package. Other benefits include Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

If you are interested in moving your career forward, please click apply

Careers and Employability Officer

Higher Education

London

Careers & Employability Officer    

London - QA Higher Education

Are you a highly organised administrator working within an educational careers service OR working within graduate recruitment? Do you fancy a new challenge in a fast paced, evolving Higher Education Business School where you can make a difference to our undergraduate and postgraduate students - helping them shape their future career?   

About the role:  As our Careers & Employability Officer you will be the first point of contact for our student enquiries to the Careers Service signposting students to suitable information resources and to ensure that the Service and employability activities are resourced effectively.  You will also be responsible for developing links between external organisations and QAHE, in order to promote and support the Careers Service, Advance Practice Internship Programme and the planning and delivery of alumni activities.

Day to day:  

Act as an initial point of contact and provide first line support for all enquiries to the Careers Service - whether in person, by telephone or email - from students, alumni, employers and faculty

Help students to access and make the best use of careers resources, using effective listening and questioning skills in order to accurately diagnose each student’s need

Analyse and interpret student data, producing monthly reports for the Head of Careers

Where appropriate, encourage students to attend specific workshops or a 1:1 appointment with a Careers Advisor based on their careers/employability requirement, managing the booking system to ensure workshops and appointments are resourced effectively

Actively develop knowledge of current careers and employability information and contribute to the updating and production of printed and online resources, under the guidance of the Head of Careers and Employability

Participate in and deliver student activities the Service offers such as workshops and induction events that are relevant to the scope of this role and the promotion of the Service to the student population and faculty members

Develop links with external employers and extend the numbers of employers who have active relationships with QAHE in order to support and develop work related opportunities for students

Publicise and promote the opportunities available to students and staff in relation to employers and employability inc voluntary, work experience, graduate jobs etc.

Work alongside the Internship and Placement Manager to support the provision of internships by undertaking student-facing tasks and other research activities to develop the internship offering

Bring your experience:

Candidates will be highly organised with strong administration skills and ideally have experience of working in a higher education setting in a Careers and Employability Service or within graduate recruitment.

Your Learning & Development with QA: how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations. Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they are interested in.

QAHE benefits and values:  We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time with 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan.

To give peace of mind, we provide Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Working at QAHE: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team.

 View Detail

Cisco Certified CCSI Trainer (We Sponsor Your Qualification)

Learning

London

Fed up with your hands on technical role? How about teaching others for a living?

Why apply?

If you've had enough of contracting or your permanent role is no longer challenging you. How about doing something different and helping others understand the technical world of Cisco CCNA/CCNP. Then this role is perfect for you.

Who are we?

As one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We like to help develop skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. With our HQ in London and 20 training centres nationwide, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) & ever-evolving skills solutions.

What is the role?

With our support and training, you will deliver face to face / e-Learning / digital training and content development for all appropriate areas within the QA family to likeminded people. Whether this is a highly qualified professional or young learners looking to get into the world of Technology.

You will be delivering both public scheduled and bespoke courses for all appropriate areas of QA’s Cisco portfolio, particularly ICND 1 &2.

How will we support you?

Experienced or not experienced, you will be assigned a co-pilot (friendly buddy but cool sounding name) to help get you up to speed. For those who are not qualified, we will help you achieve your Instructor Candidate Trainer accreditation which gives you the confidence and knowledge to teach.

Money

It is unlikely you’ll want or be able to work for free. So with that in mind, we offer a competitive financial package with benefits.

Other benefits

 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,500 to be precise), Life Assurance and cycle to work scheme.

Must have’s:

  • CCNA Qualified
  • ICND 1&2 certifications
  • Experience and knowledge equivalent to CCNP level
  • Real-world technical experience of Cisco products

Nice to have’s:

  • ICND 1 and ICND 2 version 3.0 (current certification version) 

 So interested? If so please apply.

 

 

 

 View Detail

Citrix Trainer

Learning

London

Do you want to put your CITRIX experience to greater use?

Are you currently a Citrix qualified professional who enjoys coaching in your current role but feel your experience could be used to teach?

Then why not become a Citrix Trainer!

Why apply?

If you’re based in (or near) London, had enough of contracting or your permanent role is no longer challenging you. How about doing something different and working for one of the UK’s largest Education providers, where you help others understand the world of Citrix …then this role is perfect for you.

What is the role?

Based in London (near Tower Hill tube station), you will be delivering both public scheduled and bespoke courses for all appropriate areas of QA’s CITRIX Portfolio. Netscaler products will play a prominent part in your Citrix course deliveries.

With our support, you will deliver/coach using face to face, e-Learning or digital Citrix courses and content to all appropriate areas within QA to likeminded people. Whether they are a highly qualified professional or a beginner looking to get into the world of Citrix. 

Travelling will be likely to up to 30% of your time, UK wide.

How will we support you?

Using your Citrix experience, we will help you achieve your Trainer/Coaching accreditation/qualification which gives you the confidence and knowledge to teach/coach.

You will also be assigned a co-pilot/buddy to help get you up to speed throughout your training period and beyond.

Financial package and benefits 

We are offering a competitive base salary (dependant on experience), private pension as well as 25 days holiday. 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,500 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Must haves:

  • Recent hands-on experience with CITRIX:
    • Citrix Application Delivery Controllers.
    • Citrix Virtual Applications and Virtual Desktops.
    • Citrix Hypervisor.
    • Citrix Cloud.
  • Readiness to pick up Netscaler products range

Nice to have’s:

  • CITRIX CCI certification
  • Experience in the delivery of Citrix or relevant course
  • Experience with Netscaler products line

Who are we?

As one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We like to help develop skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  With our HQ in London and 20 training centres nationwide, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) & ever-evolving skills solutions.

So interested? If so please apply today…

Client Delivery Manager

Apprenticeships

London

Apprenticeship Client Delivery Manager   

London (with travel)   

Do you have operational management experience within the apprenticeship sector ideally? Are you client focused and able to inspire and lead a remote team of assessors to deliver excellent coaching to our apprenticeship learners and ensure achievement rates are inline?  

About our role:  As Client Delivery Manager you will have the experience and leadership skills to develop the capability and capacity of a Major Programme delivery team, plan resourcing and effectively manage the teaching, coaching and mentoring function within work based learning of the clients allocated, to achieve agreed KPIs.

Your focus:  You will be client focused, liaising and building strong relationships and have the ability to own and implement the delivery quality improvement plan, including conducting observations, implementation of best practice process and ensuring conformity to external body standards. Your knowledge and experience will lead the delivery of all services related to Ofsted, including Safeguarding, Prevent and IAG not forgetting our own standards around policy and procedure to ensure business compliance and excellence. Ideally our role will suit an Apprenticeship Regional Delivery Manager OR Regional Manager where you have been leading a successful team of Assessors within Work Based Learning Programmes                          

Our Role - Operational management

As an experienced operational manager you will be comfortable being demanding but supportive and have experience in managing performance; both top end performers and where the team need to improve. You are comfortable managing a large operation and take challenges in bite-sized chunks.  We expect our teams to have really high professional standards.

Managing people Experience in managing geographically-spread teams is essential as a Client Delivery Manager, where your team are nationwide and facing the challenges this brings. 

Managing Change Our culture is one of regular change to maintain our competitive edge.  As our team grows and changes, you will be comfortable dealing with ambiguous situations, difficult choices and leading your team through change programmes that continuously improve our operation.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

More about the Team you will be working with: With a team of approximately 12 skills coaches (assessors) not all within London, you will remotely manage to deliver excellent and outstanding results for our learners and national client.   

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: season ticket loan, cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Salary range: In return we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!
