Compliance Administrator

Apprenticeships

Slough

Compliance Officer – Based in Slough -

Do you have good attention to detail?

Do you have previous administration experience?

Well this could be the ideal role for you

What is the role?

Working in the compliance team, you will be responsible for the below

  • Review learner paperwork and ensuring it is compliant using our internal validation check lists
  • Accurately record any issues and communicate these to our internal customers for correction
  • Input data onto our internal system to ensure our learner records are accurately recorded
  • Managing your own time to achieve and exceed daily targets
  • Work as part of a team to achieve team targets which will support the business goal of processing all learner paperwork within our internal SLAs
  • Liaise with our internal customers to offer excellent customer service
  • Use the internal training provided to build a strong knowledge base that you can share with colleagues and internal customers
  • Report issues and themes to your line manager to help improve the feedback we give to our internal customers
  • Contribute to improving internal processes and protocols through monthly one2ones and ad hoc team meetings
  • Support with ad hoc administration requirements including data cleanse; file creation; archiving; etc.

What YOU get?

We are offering a competitive base salary (dependant on experience), Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

You will receive specific industry training which will help you to build a strong understanding of the FE Sector, specifically Apprenticeships and the eligibility requirements that are required.

What YOU need?

You need to be driven and self-motivated. You must be able to accurately follow clear instructions and have excellent communication skills both verbally and orally. Good organisation and attention to detail is a must. If you feel like you have all these qualities then make sure you apply today!!

About QA

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting-edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Computing Skills Tutor (Academic Community of Excellence Team)

Higher Education

London

Computing Skills Tutor (Academic Community of Excellence Team)

London

About our role: Due to planned growth within our HE Business School, we are seeking to enhance our faculty with experienced Computing Tutors within our Academic Community of Excellence Team (ACE) for our undergraduate and potentially post-graduate students.

Your focus:  

Plan, prepare, teach/deliver computing skills support sessions for small groups and on a one-to-one basis to guide student’s learning on a range of programmes and related computing areas

Develop and deliver computing-related workshops

Guide students in computer labs to demonstrate the working of software programmes

Support students in running computer network simulators

Support students in using MS Office tools, such as word, ppt, excel, etc.

Support students with problem-solving/algorithm design

Create and develop learner (self-study) materials to enhance student understanding and success

Provide pastoral care and support (as a Personal Tutor)

Provide and deliver a student-centred approach

Provide guidance, support and tutorship for student groups and individuals as appropriate.

Maintain personal and professional development in line with agreed appraisal and development programme in order to enhance personal knowledge and contribution to relevant activities. 

Bring your experience:

MSc Computer Science or related degree in computing and software engineering

  • Practical Knowledge of programming languages (at least two or more of the following programming languages: Java, C++, Visual Basic, HTML5, CSS, Java script, PHP, SQL, Mobile Development using Android studio);
  • Knowledge of computer networks and network security (use of simulators, for example, GNS3, Wireshark, Packet tracer);
  • Knowledge of algorithm design and pseudo code;
  • Lab-demonstrator experience would be preferred
  • HEA status or demonstrate teaching experience with a commitment to achieving the required Professional Standards for teaching.
  • Flexibility and willingness to work under pressure and excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

More about the Team you will be working with:  The ACE team supports learners with their academic writing, presentation and study skills.  With the new team member on board who specialises in computing, the team aims to expand and provide computing skills support. The current team are TEFL Q professionals who, under the guidance of Head of ACE, work closely with both academic and support teams, establishing the most effective ways of providing student support mechanisms. The ACE team works with learners across four current locations (London Rosebery Avenue and Middlesex Street, Birmingham and Manchester) and four current university partners (Roehampton, Ulster, Northumbria and Middlesex).

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team.

Perhaps the most significant difference visible on campus is that traditional universities tend to be quite empty (of academic staff) as lecturers spend much less time in the office. There is a friendly and supportive atmosphere here at QAHE with typically far more team-working, promoted in part by more regular staff attendance on campus and in the staff offices.

Some potential candidates will find this, and the emphasis on teaching rather than research, very attractive. Academic staff in traditional universities of all ranks are placed under significant demand for research outputs and so have to balance a teaching load and the associated administration with their research obligations. To some this feels like an impossible burden (particularly when expectations around consultancy are added).

The management hierarchy at QAHE (year heads, deputy course managers and so on) creates opportunities for course management and career progression at QAHE and these types of responsibilities are genuinely devolved in a way that is typically uncommon in other HEIs.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898675.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Conversion Officer - South East Asia

Higher Education

London

Conversion Officer – London

What YOU will do?

The role will be primarily working with warm leads; enquiries received online, at events, or walk-ins in at one of our campuses. Using your sales and customer relationship skills, your role is vital in helping students pick the right course, assisting them through the application process and ultimately ensuring they successfully enrol on their chosen course.

  • To support International Assistant, International Officer (s) and Regional Manager in exceeding sales targets
  • Maintain and manage effective business pipeline ensuring daily KPI’s are delivered effectively
  • To provide first class customer service to our students, agents/representative and partners
  • Use honest and truthful promotion and advertising when recruiting for QA Higher Education and its partner institutions
  • Engage with offer holders through multiple communication channels; actively guide applicants through the entire application cycle; consult students on how to meet outstanding conditions, i.e. interviews, outstanding docs, English tests
  • Maintain accurate and up to date data on Management of Students Administration (MOSA)
  • Run and maintain weekly/monthly Management Information pipeline reports
  • Advising on payment methods (by card, BACS, on campus or loan letters) chasing and taking outstanding payments; responding to student’s concerns and understanding competition from other institutions
  • Looking after Confirmation of Acceptance to Study (CAS) requests, chasing documents outstanding in a timely manner, arranging visa appointments
  • Checking compliance of bank statements, loan letters and other financial evidences for visa application purposes
  • Provide individual guidance to students on credibility interviews and visa applications via Skype, telephone and email correspondence
  • Conduct credibility interviews ensuring student is adequately able to answer common questions asked by Entry Clearance Officer (ECO).

What YOU get?

A competitive base salary, pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

We offer 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan, discounted gym membership and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

What YOU need?

You need to be driven and self-motivated. Excellent communication skills both verbally and orally are required. You must have experience in a sales role. Good organisation and attention to detail is a must. A degree is a must. If you feel like you have all these qualities then make sure you apply today!!

About QA Higher Education

QA Higher Education is a private UK Higher Education provider, currently partnering with universities, colleges and education specialists across the UK to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate level.

Conversion Officer - UK International and South Asia

Higher Education

London

Conversion Officer - UK International and South Asia

Are you looking for a career where building relationships and good customer service are key?

Would you enjoy a role where you are engaging with students worldwide?

Do you want to work for an Education Provider which helps thousands of students all over the world to study and learn in the UK?

If so, this could be the ideal career opportunity for you!

What is the role?

As a Conversion Officer for UK International and South Asia, you will proactively engage with students and promote QA Higher Education and our range of degree programmes.

Using your sales and customer relationship skills, your role is vital in helping prospective students with choosing the right course, assisting them throughout the application process and ultimately ensuring they enrol on their chosen course.

You will also be working with warm leads received online, at events or walk-ins at one of our campuses. Converting inbound leads from marketing activity and reporting sales data, whilst managing and monitoring student application pipeline within established.

Conversing with existing and prospective applicants via multiple communication channels and assisting through the entire application cycle

Your skills and experience

You do not need to have previous education experience, although this is desirable, we are looking for a positive and driven personality with the desire to learn and succeed.

What do we offer you?

  • Competitive financial package
  • In-depth coaching and mentoring
  • 25 days holiday
  • 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice
  • 3 days of additional training relevant to your role and responsibilities

What skills/experience is required?

  • Educated to a degree level - we welcome any discipline
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong customer focus with proven problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to co-operate at all levels of the organisation and work with tight deadlines

Desirable:

  • SEO or marketing or recruitment experience

Who are QA Higher Education?

QA Higher Education is a private UK Higher Education provider, currently partnering with universities, colleges and education specialists across the UK to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate level.

Customer Coordinator

Learning

Swindon

What is the Role?

To provide high quality, dedicated, administration and logistical support for our managed learning service clients. The primary function of the Learning Coordinator is to be the first point of contact for all external learning requests, as well as provide local administrative activity for the client’s specific learning programmes and training events.

  • Provide professional advice on training courses to meet customer requirements
  • Research, respond to and advise on queries for all bookings
  • Follow up on all client requests while keeping the client informed of progress
  • Communicate and coordinate with other departments to resolve enquires
  • Build and maintain internal QA relationships
  • Build and maintain business relationships with clients by providing prompt and accurate service
  • Carry out tasks within the agreed time-frame
  • Foresee possible delays or complications and plan strategies to avoid or minimise them
  • Escalate matters where appropriate but aim to develop sufficient awareness of QA , the client and the MLS role in order to work independently

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive base salary (dependant on experience), Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

What do we do?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting, and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Must haves (We do need the following):

  • Previous experience in a customer service role – dealing with clients via email, telephone and face to face (if possible) – preferably Business to Business
  • Experience using internal CRM’s and IT systems
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office – Word/Excel etc. at beginner level or above
  • Great people skills (sounds cliché but building relationships is a key part of this role)
  • Competent in writing emails/correspondence

If you’ve read the above, feel we are the company for you. Then apply to us today. Speak soon…

London

Coordinator – Virtual Learning

Are you fed up with your current role? Want to get more involved with customers? Great, then this role is for you…

What is the role?

As part of our Virtual Learning Team, you will be responsible for supporting our wide-ranging client base, managing our ‘Attend from Anywhere’ and Virtual on-line courses.

Dealing with our delegates/learners via email, telephone and WebEx, you will help support customers who cannot physically attend our courses but can virtually.

In this role, you will not only need good people skills but the ability to help from technical perspective running connectivity tests to ensure our customers have the right setup to attend our live online training (don’t worry we will give you the tools and know-how).

As part of the job, you will need to be able to work shifts when required to help support clients which can be 7:30am to 4 pm or 10 am to 7 pm. So if finishing early or later to beat the mad commuter rush interests you, then please read on...

How will we support you?

It’s really important to make sure you have the support required to do this role, which is why you will have a dedicated experienced team member train you on a daily basis until you are comfortable as well as your manager – Natalie. Natalie has been with QA for 2.5 years so has a wealth of experience to help guide you.

You will be joining a team of three in an environment that is relaxed, sociable and has a good team mentality where tea is a staple and going out after work is a regular occurrence.

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive base salary, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting-edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Must haves (We do need the following):

  • Previous experience in a customer service role – dealing with clients via email, telephone and face to face (if possible)

Deputy Programme Manager Digital & Technology Solutions

Apprenticeships

Leeds, London, Birmingham, Manchester

Deputy Programme Leader Digital and Technology Solutions Degree Apprenticeships

Flexible Location Birmingham, Leeds, London, Manchester,

About our role: Do you have a passion for teaching, imparting knowledge, engendering new skills and behaviours, and keeping up-to-date in an ever-changing world? Do you want to support the management and delivery of outstanding industry informed teaching on our fully blended and innovative BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships?

At QA we are passionate about the positive impact of degree apprenticeships as a means of enabling engagement with Higher Education for the wider social spectrum.  We are committed to developing innovative means of teaching that support the new modes of study required by modern students. 

You will be working within a growing and expanding team where we all work, support and learn from each other in order to provide our Learners with a dedicated, exceptional level of service that we are extremely proud to be part of.     

As the Deputy Programme Leader you will be expected to support the BSc and MSc Programme Leaders in the administration and management of the programmes, liaising with clients, students and our partner institutions to ensure academic standards are maintained and we continue to improve the student experience.

About the programmes:

The BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships involve the delivery of a number of computing streams which incorporate Software Engineering, Computer Networking, Cyber Security, Big Data, Analytics and Maths, and broader areas of Computer Science.

Our programmes use a mixture of distance and face-to-face teaching and facilitation across the country using experiential and spiral methods to develop theories-in-action in a work-based learning approach that is both scholarly and professional.

Our use of skills coaches (who visit the learners in the workplace) and their liaison with you is designed to create a progressive and valuable experience for every student and their employer.

Our learners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and work for an equally wide variety of companies including some of the biggest technology companies in Europe.

Your focus: 

Supporting the day to day running of the degree apprenticeships programmes. 

As important is role-modelling your interest in inquiry and focussing into organisations to promote the professional development of our learners (their employees).  

We work as a geographically dispersed but close-knit team, sharing teaching experiences and new ideas. We challenge each other and work determinedly and efficiently, to reach ever improving teaching and learning standards and outcomes.

You will be required to attend University meetings and QA face-to-face sessions across the breadth of QA sites as the academic schedule requires.  This may require overnight stays.

Bring your experience: 

Please see the attached Job description.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you?

Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

Our benefits and values:

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Devops Trainer

Consulting

Manchester

Are you passionate about technology?

Looking for a new challenge with a company that has won Computing Magazine DevOps Excellence Awards 2017?

Sounds interesting? Please read on…

QA Ltd is the UK’s number 1 technical training provider. With over 6000 clients and operating within 80% of the FTSE 250, we are a world leader of IT training. QA Consulting, a division of QA Ltd, have the unique ability to use this world-class training to provide outstanding consultants to the largest companies in the UK. QA Consulting have an academy in Manchester where we train our consultants in market-leading technologies and we are looking to grow our training scheme.

Overview

This role is for an Academy trainer in QA Consulting who has a strong to expert knowledge in DevOps and/or Linux administration.

Desirable experience:

  • Operating systems: Linux (Ubuntu, Centos, REHL)
  • Cloud platforms: AWS, Azure, GCP
  • Configuration management: Chef, Docker, Puppet or Chef
  • Containerisation: Docker and Kubernetes
  • Scripting: Bash, Python and Ruby

This role is for someone who is passionate about learning and experimenting with the latest trends in engineering and also enjoys imparting knowledge to others.

If you like to research, learn and impart your technical skills onto others then this role is for you. You will have excellent customer facing, interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to work independently.

At QAC we look for real experts in their field who are passionate about their subject. We don’t expect everyone to come to us as specialists in training as well (although that would be nice) – we can provide that part as we are experts in learning and development.

Training courses typically follow groups of graduates who will be shaped in order to prepare them to start careers in the most exciting areas of technology in some of the biggest organisations in the UK.

 Key Responsibilities 

  • To deliver both bespoke courses in relation to DevOps and cloud computing
  • To take responsibility for developing and maintaining agreed courses
  • To maintain an up-to-date skills base through personal development and accreditation activities
  • Keep and report data on completed courses, absences, issues etc.
  • Determine course content according to objectives

 Skills and experience required 

  • Solid DevOps experience gained in a commercial environment
  • Solid Linux skills
  • Exposure to continuous integration, cloud and configuration management
  • Knowledge of modern training techniques and tools in technical subjects
  • Degree in a relevant technical field
  • Excellent organizational and time management abilities
  • Web Front end experience is advantageous but not essential
  • Outstanding communication skills and comfortable speaking to crowds

 Benefits 

  • Competitive salary
  • Contributory Pension Scheme
  • Regular social events that include technical talks and hackathons
  • Continued support in your personal development

Please apply now for immediate consideration.

Digital Learning Designer x2

Learning

Slough, Brighton, Swindon

Digital Learning Designer     

Brighton OR Slough Based    

Are you a junior instructional designer or responsible in your current role for the full lifecycle of digital story boarding projects? Are you ready for a new challenge, looking to join a vibrant, fast paced, growing organisation where we can help develop and progress your career and skills?

About our role: As Digital Learning Designer you will be responsible for designing and creating engaging and effective digital learning solutions for QA’s large clients. Working with our Account Managers, you will be involved in the complete lifecycle of a digital solution for QA’s customers: writing proposals, learning needs analysis, designing and creating creative instructional approaches and assessing the outcomes and effectiveness of the learning.

Your focus day to day:

Work closely with Account Managers and Bids teams to understand client requirements and propose digital solutions to meet their needs

Design and create engaging and effective digital solutions leveraging the best of QA’s thought leadership and digital assets

Develop subject matter expertise aligned to core capabilities and promote QA’s thought leadership on digital solutions

Bring your experience:

Relevant multimedia or instructional design qualification at degree level

Experience of developing blended learning, digital learning and mobile learning solutions

Visual design skills (Dreamweaver, Photoshop, Illustrator) and ability to storyboard

Experience working in a commercial materials development environment, preferably related to on-line and blended learning

Strong knowledge of mobile development approaches and technologies

Working knowledge of digital learning authoring tools including Captivate, Camtasia and Articulate

Understanding of different digital learning development techniques and methodologies (formal and informal)

Excellent written and communication skills (for a range of purposes and audiences); ability to write effective copy, instructional text, audio scripts/video scripts

Excellent stakeholder management skills to manage customer, account manager and product SME expectations

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

More about the Team you will be working with: Working within a team of around 8, we are lively, outgoing and extremely supportive. We are passionate about what we do and aim to provide our clients with exceptional results             

Our benefits and values: Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

We know it’s important to recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- Learning, Apprenticeships, Consulting and Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call Michaela on 01753 898671

.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Digital Marketing Skills Coach - London

Apprenticeships

London

Are you a Digital marketing professional or graduate looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you want an opportunity to for a company that truly promotes organic growth and development?

Do you want to work for a Top Track 250 company – one of the UK’s top performing private companies?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Skills coach within digital marketing, you will be managing a caseload of up to 50 learners on our Apprenticeship programme. You will be supporting learners through successful completion of their programme by providing guidance and support to them and their employers.

You will maintain regular contact with your learners and their employers to demonstrate formal progress and planning of progression for the learner.

Having previous experience in a similar role would be a bonus, but if you have not, don’t fret; as part of our commitment to you, we will be putting you through your CAVA and Coaching and Mentoring training – making you a fully qualified Skills Coach!

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise within digital marketing whilst helping and encouraging learners through their apprenticeship programme – all whilst working autonomously and managing your own time!

Your team

Based in London, you will be required to work closely with the Regional Delivery Manager and Head of Delivery. The position will require travel across multiple sites (depending on where your learners are based) so having your own transport is a must!

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive financial package + car allowance, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

You will need to hold a degree, higher education qualification or significant industry experience in the areas of Digital marketing. You would need to have technical experience of web design, social media, digital analytics and email marketing. It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. Holding an existing CAVA qualification would be ideal, however as mentioned, it is not essential.

About QA Apprenticeships

QA Apprenticeships - As the fastest growing division of QA, we are now the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services apprenticeships. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with an amazing 'Outstanding’ in all areas.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Direct Sales Executive - UK International & South Asia

Higher Education

London

Direct Sales Executive - UK International and South Asia

London

Are you an experienced sales professional who is looking for a new challenge?

Do you want to work for an Education Provider which helps thousands of students all over the world to study and learn in the UK?

Do you want to be truly rewarded for your dedication and hard work?

If so, this could be the ideal career opportunity for you!

What is the role?

As a Direct Sales Executive, you will work within the UK International and South Asia Recruitment team to support marketing strategies for the International Recruitment activities.

Using your sales experience, you will provide a first class customer service to both students and parents to ensure you build relationships, whilst offering our varied range of university partner degrees

You will be focused on targeting candidates across UK International and South Asia, working from an extensive database of leads.

You will be given extensive records to work from and manage the full sales cycle from initial candidate call, through to their enrolment and start onto one of our Higher Education degrees within our education partner sites.

Experience required?

This would be an ideal position for a highly driven and self-motivated individual who thrives in an outbound calling environment. You will need to be able to take complete ownership of your desk and manage the full B2C sales process.

A proven track record and experience in outbound new business, telesales, business development or similar is essential.

Financial Package and Benefits?

We are offering a competitive base salary and a competitive commission package. Other benefits include Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme.

Who are QA Higher Education?

QA Higher Education is a private UK Higher Education provider, currently partnering with universities, colleges and education specialists across the UK to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate level.

EAP Lecturer, Evenings and Saturdays (London)

Higher Education

London

EAP Lecturer - Undergraduate and Postgraduate Programmes

London £50 per hour, Zero Hour Contract

Evenings and weekend teaching hours available         

About our role: Due to planned growth and subsequent increased student admissions, QA Higher Education is looking for qualified, experienced and enthusiastic a EAP Lecturer on a zero hour contract basis for our London  campus. Our Focus is on delivery of high quality learning and teaching to facilitate excellent student outcomes.

Your focus:  

To plan, prepare and deliver EAP and Skills modules;

To mark and provide appropriate feedback on oral and written work;

To attend and contribute to CPD training sessions organised internally or externally; 

To provide academic support to students on EAP and Skills modules;

To adhere to and maintain academic standards and quality assurance within the EAP team;

To provide pastoral care and support to international students on our EAP programmes;

To contribute to the wider business through sharing of best practice with the wider academic community and supporting or driving business development opportunities.

Bring your experience:

You should have suitable and relative teaching experience and should hold a ELT qualification or higher degree in a relevant subject area. A teaching qualification and membership of the HEA would be advantageous.

Diploma in English Language Teaching to Adults (DELTA) or equivalent (i.e. MA in TEFL/ TESOL)

Candidates with MA in TEFL/TESOL without TEFL I qualification (e.g. CELTA or Trinity TESOL) shortlisted for interview will be required to provide evidence of 5 hours of systematic observation of lessons by a fully-qualified academic manager or teacher trainer;

Degree or equivalent; Experience of teaching English for Academic Purposes (EAP) in a university environment;

Maths and Business/Computing knowledge/teaching desirable.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training. 

More about the Team you will be working with:

The EAP team currently works across four current university partners (Roehampton, Ulster, Northumbria and Middlesex) and teaches academic writing and study skills programmes to all levels, from Foundation level 3 to Masters Level 7. The team is involved in a variety of programmes from standard pre-sessional to a rage of in-sessional courses, both assessed and unassessed. The team from all current locations (London, Birmingham and Manchester) takes an active part in an internal and external CPD programme. It works closely with the rest of the academic team, establishing the most effective student support mechanisms, and adapts the content of academic writing and study skills programmes to the relevant module/course content.

Our Company: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team.

Perhaps the most significant difference visible on campus is that traditional universities tend to be quite empty (of academic staff) as lecturers spend much less time in the office. There is a friendly and supportive atmosphere here at QAHE with typically far more team-working, promoted in part by more regular staff attendance on campus and in the staff offices.

Some potential candidates will find this, and the emphasis on teaching rather than research, very attractive. Academic staff in traditional universities of all ranks are placed under significant demand for research outputs and so have to balance a teaching load and the associated administration with their research obligations. To some this feels like an impossible burden (particularly when expectations around consultancy are added).

 

Rate of Pay: £50 inclusive of holiday pay  

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!

EAP Tutor (Presessional English - Solent University) x2

Higher Education

Southampton

Pre-Sessional EAP Lecturers

Solent University

Southampton

About the role: Due to planned growth within our business, we are seeking to enhance our faculty with two experienced English for Academic Purposes (EAP) lecturers delivering our pre-sessional programme at Solent University in Southampton. The Pre-Sessional English programme is taught in three blocks: a 15-week course; a 10-week course; or a 5-week course.

Role A: Fixed-term from w/c 22nd April to w/c 9th September 2019 (this role includes a period allocated to course design and materials development, with teaching beginning on w/c 27th May 2019)

Role B: Fixed-term from w/c 24th June to w/c 9th September 2019 (teaching begins on w/c 1st July 2019)

Your key responsibilities:  

  • To deliver up to 20 hours per week of Academic English language and study skills lessons.
  • To ensure all associated duties, including the preparation of classes, marking and timely feedback are performed to the required standard.
  • To deliver classes within the prescribed course syllabus and ensure that all aspects of the Pre-sessional English Language Programme course delivery, both teaching and teaching related, meet the stated aims and learning outcomes.
  • To provide regular progression reports for students studying on our EAP programmes.
  • To provide pastoral care and support to international students on our Pre-sessional English Language Programme.
  • To plan and manage own workload effectively whilst on the Pre-sessional English Language Programme
  • To assist in the organization, invigilation, marking and feedback for any course work or assignments as required.
  • To participate in the standardisation of assessments.
  • To ensure that all Pre-sessional English Language Programme course administration is completed accurately and in a timely manner.
  • To attend and contribute to any CPD training sessions organised internally or externally.

Please note: Tutors on the Pre-sessional English Language Programme must be available for the full duration of the course and course preparation period.

Experience and qualifications

  • Diploma in English Language Teaching to Adults (DELTA) or equivalent (i.e. MA in TEFL/ TESOL) - essential
    • Candidates with MA in TEFL/TESOL without TEFL I qualification (e.g. CELTA or Trinity TESOL) shortlisted for interview will be required to provide evidence of 5 hours of systematic observation of lessons by a fully-qualified academic manager or teacher trainer.
  • Degree or equivalent - essential
  • Experience of teaching English for Academic Purposes (EAP) in a university environment – essential
  • Experience of teaching on a Pre-sessional English Language Programme – essential
  • Experience of EAP course design and materials development – essential (Role A only)

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!

The Pre-Sessional English programme is taught in three blocks: a 15-week course; a 10-week course; or a 5-week course.

Roles vary from 13 – 21weeks, fulltime, fixed term contracts starting in either April, May OR June 

Your key responsibilities:  

  • To deliver up to 20 hours per week of Academic English language and study skills lessons.
  • To ensure all associated duties, including the preparation of classes, marking and timely feedback are performed to the required standard.
  • To deliver classes within the prescribed course syllabus and ensure that all aspects of the Pre-sessional English Language Programme course delivery, both teaching and teaching related, meet the stated aims and learning outcomes.
  • To provide regular progression reports for students studying on our EAP programmes.
  • To provide pastoral care and support to international students on our Pre-sessional English Language Programme.
  • To plan and manage own workload effectively whilst on the Pre-sessional English Language Programme
  • To assist in the organization, invigilation, marking and feedback for any course work or assignments as required.
  • To participate in the standardisation of assessments.
  • To ensure that all Pre-sessional English Language Programme course administration is completed accurately and in a timely manner.
  • To attend and contribute to any CPD training sessions organised internally or externally.

English Language ASSESSOR    

Birmingham 5 month FTC     

About our role:  Working within our QA Higher Education Business School you will have the skills, qualifications and experience to carry out English Language testing with our potential undergraduate and postgraduate students. The assessments will be carried out both face to face and online using Skype. You will also be involved with Test invigilation, proof reading and general administration i.e. typing, scanning, proofreading, filing and etc.

Your focus:  Ideally you will have either an English Language Examiner &/OR an English Language Teacher background and hold relevant qualifications as listed below. You will enjoy engaging with students, making the learners feel relaxed, ensuring their student journey is an enjoyable one no matter the assessment outcome. Our role is mainly Monday-Friday 9am-5.30pm with some evenings and up to 6 Saturdays per annum (Time off in Lieu given). With your excellent communication skills, you will be organised have good planning and delivery skills, be self-motivated, an excellent team player and an adaptable and confident manner.

Please note that some travel to our Manchester Campus will be required (expenses paid) 

Bring your experience:

Experience of English Language testing is highly preferred

Experience of teaching EL exam preparation courses, e.g. IELTS, PTE, Toefl, FCE, CAE and etc.

Experienced EFL/TESOL Teacher

Qualification in Teaching English as a Foreign Language or Teaching English to Speakers of Foreign Languages

Experience of developing testing and teaching materials

Extensive knowledge of CEFR and EFL levels

Ability to deliver English Language support classes

Understanding of English Language testing systems, e.g. IELTS, PTE, Toefl and etc., their levels and scores

Good word processing and Excel skills

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training. 

More about the Team you will be working with:  Working within our small team, you will enjoy being part of our wider campus, working with the buzz of students and academics around us. We are a growing team and business, so lots to keep us very busy with. Having an open and flexible approach is vital.

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Events and Marketing Executive - FTC

Learning

Slough

Events and Marketing Executive - 12 month FTC

Slough

Are you looking for an opportunity where you can plan, organise and deliver market leading events?

Do you want to have a real input on the direction of future events, really helping to drive our sales teams success in the process?

If so, then this is the role for you…

What is the role?

You will be responsible for the planning, organization and delivery of our brand awareness events. 

You will work closely with the internal sales stakeholders to execute effective events to maximise the generation of new prospects and relationship opportunities for our sales team. You will also be supporting digital marketing activities including social media and email.

This role is all about the quality you produce, so it’s crucial you understand your target audience and the best methods to gauge their interest.

The team and support

Joining an established team, there will be a great support structure from the people around you, who have a wealth of knowledge to tap into.

You will be reporting directly into the Marketing Manager.

Socially you can look forward to regular team events, celebratory lunches, as well as a chance to meet and work closely alongside senior members of the business.

Financial package and benefits 

We are offering a competitive base salary, private pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

What skills/experience are we looking for?

  • Qualified marketing professional – degree not essential
  • Must know or have the following marketing experience within events:
    • Experience running lead generation events where you have measured effectiveness (good or bad)
    • Worked within a sales marketing environment – B2B preferable
    • Digital Marketing experience preferred but not essential
  • An innovative and creative thinker, who is able to drive engaging lead generation events. 

Who are we?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Finance Business Partner

Consulting

London, Brighton

Finance Business Partner - London/Brighton

Are you a finance professional looking for an exciting new challenge?

Frustrated in your current role and keen to show your true worth?

If you have answered yes, then read on to find out more…

Your role

We have an exciting opportunity to join QA as a Finance Business Partner. This role offers the person a chance to develop and grow within a  thriving company. 

As an Finance Business Partner you will be responsible for the reporting, analysis and forecasting processes.

There will be a special focus on the forecasting element, as this role would suit somebody with experience of 'forward thinking' financial planning.

You will be working closely with the COO to ensure that all reports are completed in a timely and accurate manner.

This role will give the successful applicant the opportunity to truly influence the finance cycle, with continual improvements and new processes being actively encouraged. This role will also involve travel, with time split between our London and Brighton offices.

Your background

You will have a finance background with strong Excel modelling skills. Proven numeracy skills are also essential.

This role would best suit somebody who has had previous experience in a similiar role. Ideally you would be used to working to deadlines and be used to working with Senior/Director level members of business. 

It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key. It is also vital that you are self-motivated with a high attention to detail.

Your team

Based in our London or Brighton office, you will be required to work closely with various business managers, as well as with the rest of the finance team. You will also be reporting directly into the Chief Operating Officer. 

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive financial package, Private Pension as well as 25 days’ holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme. 

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

 View Detail

Graduate Data Science Trainer

Learning

UK Wide, London, Site-Based

Have you ever wanted a career in technology? Considered training other people? QA are looking for digitally curious individuals to join our Trainer team. QA will help you realise your potential and invest in you as part of a structured programme of learning and mentorship.

You will become a Data Science Trainer following an extensive 6 to 8 weeks programme in our Manchester based Training Academy.

You will have a background in mathematics and statistics and be interested in becoming a data scientist. In return, QA will outfit you with a set of technical, research and teaching skills in your new career.

You will have:

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills - be able to form a rapport quickly with people and make them feel comfortable; ability to break down complex scenarios into simpler chunks and explain them
  • A Bachelor’s Degree (ideally in a STEM-related subject)
  • Be geographically flexible – the role is London based with UK wide travelling
  • Enthusiasm for life-long learning - both for themselves and in others
  • Adaptive - be able to think on your feet when things go wrong or when removed from your comfort zone
  • Reflective - Be empirical in your practice and analyze how to improve your delivery/materials
  • Be numerate and literate to a high level

Key skills:

  • Substantive Experience in A Level Mathematics or Equivalent
  • Experience with one or more Programming Language – preferably Python or R
  • Substantive Experience with Relational Databases 

Nice to Have:

  • Professional use of Programming in Python, R, Scala
  • Professional Use of Neo4j, Hadoop
  • Substantive Experience in A Level Statistics or Equivalent

You will learn: 

  • Equivalent to Undergraduate Linear Algebra, Multivariate Calculus, Statistics,
  • Equivalent to Professional in Python, R, Scala
  • Equivalent to Professional in NoSQL Databases
  • Equivalent to Graduate-Level Data Science

Selection Process: following an initial telephone screening you will complete an aptitude test (online) and attend an assessment day.

If you were successful, you will join our Manchester based Training Academy for a 12 weeks subject based course. Following the successful completion of the course you will get additional training skills coaching and training that will take up to four weeks and could be based anywhere in the UK.

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some downtime, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 3 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Salary range:

In return, we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries please call Natalie Erukhimovich from the Recruitment team on 01753 898651.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Graduate Cloud Trainer x 3 roles

Learning

Site-Based, London, UK Wide

Have you ever wanted a career in technology? Considered training other people? QA are looking for digitally curious individuals to join our Trainer team. QA will help you realise your potential and invest in you as part of a structured programme of learning and mentorship.

You will become a Cloud Trainer following an extensive 6 to 8 weeks programme in our Manchester based Training Academy.

You may have a background in networking, automation, or Linux administration and an interest in becoming a hands-on Cloud practitioner and skills coach.  In return, QA will outfit you with a set of technical, research and teaching skills in your new career.

You will have:

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills - be able to form a rapport quickly with people and make them feel comfortable; ability to break down complex scenarios into simpler chunks and explain them
  • A Bachelor’s Degree (ideally in a STEM related subject)
  • Be geographically flexible – the role is London based with UK wide travelling
  • Enthusiasm for life-long learning - both for themselves and in others
  • Adaptive - be able to think on your feet when things go wrong or when removed from your comfort zone
  • Reflective - Be empirical in your practice and analyze how to improve your delivery/materials
  • Be numerate and literate to a high level

Key skills:

  • An appreciation of what Cloud and Devops is and why industry is adopting them
  • Some experience of Linux configuration, administration and scripting
  • Some programming experience, preferably Python or Ruby
  • Exposure to the cloud
  • Awareness of software testing
  • Understanding of Agile and Lean

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with continuous integration and release technologies
  • Use of version control using Git
  • Experience of test and quality automation
  • Process improvement and change.

You will learn: 

  • How to create and manage DevOps release pipelines
  • Certified Agile and Lean skills
  • Cloud engineering skills including certification
  • Test Automation skills including certification

 

Selection Process: following an initial telephone screening you will complete an aptitude test (online) and attend an assessment day.

If you were successful, you will join our Manchester based Training Academy for a 12 weeks subject based course. Following the successful completion of the course, you will get additional training skills coaching and training that will take up to four weeks and could be based anywhere in the UK.

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some downtime, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 3 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Salary range:

In return, we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential.

Graduate Web Development Trainer

Learning

UK Wide, London, Site-Based

Have you ever wanted a career in technology? Considered training other people? QA are looking for digitally curious individuals to join our Trainer team. QA will help you realise your potential and invest in you as part of a structured programme of learning and mentorship.

You will become a Web Developer Trainer following an extensive 6 to 8 weeks programme in our Manchester based Training Academy.

You will have a passion for the web and some evidence of these skills as well as tutoring or coaching experience.  In return, QA will outfit you with a set of technical, research and teaching skills in your new career.

You will have:

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills - be able to form a rapport quickly with people and make them feel comfortable; ability to break down complex scenarios into simpler chunks and explain them
  • A Bachelor’s Degree (ideally in a STEM-related subject)
  • Be geographically flexible – the role is London based with UK wide travelling
  • Enthusiasm for life-long learning - both for themselves and in others
  • Adaptive - be able to think on your feet when things go wrong or when removed from your comfort zone
  • Reflective - Be empirical in your practice and analyze how to improve your delivery/materials
  • Be numerate and literate to a high level

Key skills:

  • An appreciation of how the web works
  • Skills in HTML/CSS
  • Some experience in a programming language, preferably JavaScript
  • An understanding of databases – either relational or no SQL
  • An understanding of what UI/UX are

Nice to Have:

  • Experience of creating responsive, interactive web sites and applications
  • Experience in one of more UI library/frameworks (React, Angular, Vue, etc)
  • Experience in server-side programming (Java, C#, PHP, etc)
  • Experience in databases for the web (SQL, Mongo, IndexedDB, etc)
  • Experience in cloud platforms such as Amazon or Azure.

Selection Process: following an initial telephone screening you will complete an aptitude test (online) and attend an assessment day.

If you were successful, you will join our Manchester based Training Academy for a 12 weeks subject based course. Following the successful completion of the course you will get additional training skills coaching and training that will take up to four weeks and could be based anywhere in the UK.

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250.

 View Detail

Infrastructure Technician / Network Engineer Skills Coach

Apprenticeships

Reading, Slough

Are you a Systems & Networking professional or graduate looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you want to use your knowledge and expertise to help others become Systems & Networking professionals?

Would you like to work for a training provider that offers you the chance to develop your own Systems & Networking skills by undertaking certification and education?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Skills Coach, you will be managing a caseload of up to 50 learners on our Systems & Networking Apprenticeship programme. Supporting learners through successful completion of their programme by providing guidance and help to them and their employers.

Within your role, you will maintain regular contact with your learners & employers to assist with the development of those individuals and ensure they receive the best learning outcomes and customer service.

Having previous experience in a similar role would be a bonus, but if you have not, don’t fret; as part of our commitment to you, we will be putting you through Coaching and Mentoring training so that you can become a fully qualified Skills Coach!

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise within Systems & Networking to support and encourage learners through their apprenticeship programme – all whilst working autonomously and managing your own time.

Your team & Development

You will be required to work closely with the Regional Delivery Manager and Head of Delivery. The position will require travel across multiple sites (depending on where your learners are based) so having your own transport is a must!

CPD Opportunities:

 With a very large portfolio of QA Technology courses, there will be opportunities to attend and get certified in courses from:

  • Microsoft – MCP, MCSA Certifications in Windows Client/Server
  • CompTIA Network+/Security+
  • Cisco CCENT/CCNA
  • Cloud certifications such as AWS/Azure/Google
  • Security specialisation and certifications

MSc Opportunities:

  • Cyber Security
  • Information Security Management
  • Professional Practice in Computing and IT

Financial package and benefits

We are offering up to £32,000 base salary per annum (DOE), £3,600 car allowance, private pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

You will need to hold a degree or higher education qualification in Computer Systems, Information Technology, Network/Networking, Computer Architecture, Computer Communication, Computer/Network Security, Computing in Networking, Computing and Internet Technologies or Business Information Technology. Have industry experience in the areas of Systems & Networking or IT Infrastructure, with sound technical knowledge. Certifications in CompTIA Network+, Cisco CCNA, Microsoft Certified Professional – Windows 10, Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2016 are desirable. It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. Holding an existing CAVA qualification would be ideal, however as mentioned, it is not essential.

About QA

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions - Learning, Apprenticeships, Consulting and Higher Education - all of which deliver innovative and cutting-edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

 

 

 View Detail

International Assistant - UK International & South Asia, Africa & Latin America

Higher Education

London

International Assistant x2 - UK International and South Asia, Africa & Latin America

Are you looking for a career where you can apply your administrative skills to good use?

Would you enjoy a role where you are engaging with different stakeholders worldwide?

Do you want to work for an Education Provider which helps thousands of students all over the world to study and learn in the UK?

If so, this could be the ideal career opportunity for you!

What is the role?

As an International Assistant for UK International and South Asia, you will work as part of the sales team pre-assessing applications at the initial stage of the admissions process to ensure they meet QA Higher Education’s quality standards.

Using your administrative and customer relationship skills, your role is vital in liaising with our agents and prospective students in preparing a good application, with choosing the right course, assisting them throughout the application process.

You will also be assisting the international teams to ensure applications can go to offer stage quickly enough to speed up the sales process and work with the team to meet their student recruitment targets.

Conversing with existing and prospective applicants via multiple communication channels and assisting through the entire application cycle

Your skills and experience

You will be required to have previous education experience, we are looking for a positive and driven personality with the desire to learn and succeed.

What do we offer you?

  • Competitive financial package
  • In-depth coaching and mentoring
  • 25 days holiday
  • 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice
  • 3 days of additional training relevant to your role and responsibilities

What skills/experience is required?

  • Educated to a degree level - we welcome any discipline
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Proficient in Using Microsoft Office tools
  • Strong customer focus with proven problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to co-operate at all levels of the organisation and work with tight deadlines

Desirable:

  • Previously worked in an Education background

Who are QA Higher Education?

QA Higher Education is a private UK Higher Education provider, currently partnering with universities, colleges and education specialists across the UK to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate level.

Click the link to apply and start your career with QA now!

International Officer - South East Asia

Higher Education

London

International Officer Pathway for South East Asia - Birmingham/London

About the Role

We are seeking a dynamic and motivated individual to be part of our international student recruitment within the above regions. This is an opportunity to make an important contribution to a fast growing organisation with ambitious plans to become a leading provider of higher education pathways, both within the UK and internationally.

As an International Officer, you will be key in implementing our recruitment strategy to market our university partners and to support their brand positively and effectively, especially within the Pathway recruitment. You will be representing, networking and exhibiting overseas on a regular basis (up to 12 weeks of travel a year) in any of the above regions. Your main focus will be to recruit Foundation level students into all of our key partner Universities.

About Us

QA Higher Education provides a range of pathway programmes, ranging from Level 3 to Level 7 for a number of universities. The purpose built campuses provide state of the art facilities and our team of academic teaching and support staff have a real passion for all aspects of learning and development.

About The Person

Ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successfully operating in the HE sector.

Experience of working with and recruiting international students and developing overseas student recruitment channels would be an advantage.

Track record of success in sales or higher education environment.   

Excellent language skills in English a second Language will be a bonus.

Ability to build a strong understanding of the market place, and experience in international recruitment.

Goal orientated and motivated by a target based culture

Your Skills & Experience

  • Strong organisational and planning skills
  • Capable of building working relationships and networks with people from a range backgrounds and cultures
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong customer focus, committed to ensuring delivery of excellent service standards
  • Ability to work unsupervised for extended periods.

 

In return, we are offering a competitive package. If this role looks of interest to you please do not hesitate to apply!
