Internship and Employer Engagement Manager

Higher Education

London

Internship and Employer Engagement Manager  

London - QA Higher Education

Do you have a recruitment OR student placement OR business development background? Would you like to make a difference and help our undergraduate and postgraduate students gain industry experience through our internship programme?  

About the role: As Internship and Employer Engagement Manager, you will have the networking skills to develop new and existing relationships with employers and businesses to enhance our student experience by promoting QAHE and its students; you will attract meaningful employer activity on campus and also support students to obtain internships. Working with our Head of Careers, you will develop an employer engagement strategy; responsible for all aspects of employer engagement and for managing the Internship and Placement Service that supports students who undertake internships as part of their studies and also those wishing to boost their employability and gain industry-related work experience. Our role will involve attending events, client meetings, calling potential employers alongside working with the academic faculty  

Day to day:  

Develop and strengthen links with existing and new employers to attract their participation with activities on campus such as talks and workshops and to act as internship hosts in order to increase the number of opportunities available

Undertake research, market analysis and networking opportunities to identify and target potential employers to participate with

Match suitable students for particular internships by shortlisting CVs, preparing students for interviews, making offers and ensuring university regulations are met where necessary (the post holder will work in conjunction with the central Careers Services to provide employability activity)

Work with the campus Employability Officer to oversee all administrative and student-facing activity of the Internship and Placement Service

Represent the Internship and Placement Service at institution validations, academic meetings and ensure and monitor the quality of internship programmes with reference to QAA, ASET and other relevant codes of practice and apply best practice across internship programmes;

Work closely with faculty to ensure internships meet any academic requirements

Bring your experience:

As this role involves considerable lead generation and client management, the successful candidate will have excellent networking and relationship building skills, ideally with experience within higher education and/or recruitment; ideally candidates will have experience in working with businesses and/or students across a range of industries and programme disciplines, from computing/IT to luxury brands.

Your Learning & Development with QA: how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations. Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they are interested in.

QAHE benefits and values:  We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time with 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan.

To give peace of mind, we provide Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Working at QAHE: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team.

How to apply and who to contact: Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!

IT Business Analyst Trainer

Apprenticeships

London

IT Business Analyst Trainer / Tutor

Fulltime & Permanent Role - Flexible working will also be considered    

About our role: Are you a current Business Analyst who enjoys training, coaching, and facilitating learning in the workplace? Or are you a current Business Analyst Trainer looking for a new opportunity to share your knowledge and experience with our workplace experienced apprentices who are hungry to grow their skills to gain our L4 Qualification giving them career progression and further development. A rewarding role as you watch your learners grow.      

Your focus:  The role will involve a blend of teaching, practical exercises, supporting self-study activities and assessment. The programme involves a wide range of skills across Business Analysis. It is expected that the Tutor would be able to deliver majority of the classroom sessions as aligned with the BCS Diploma in Business Analysis but at busy times would involve other Tutors. As a result, the role will require close working with the Service Delivery Team and other tutors to ensure smooth handovers between sessions, consistent approaches to assessment and a shared understanding of apprentice progress

Bring your experience:

Experience of working as a Business analyst in diverse environments

Experience of working with IT/IS Change projects

Experience of working through the full cycle of Business Analysis including liaison with various stakeholders.

Experience of working with data including data reporting.

Previous experience of teaching/training different audiences (classroom or workplace)

Completed and certified in the BCS Diploma in Business Analysis

Experience with BCS Business Analysis Modules such as Requirements Engineering, Commercial Awareness, Business Analysis Practice, Systems Modelling and Business Change.

Excellent communication skills

A logical thinker and a passion to achieve

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.           

More about the Team you will be working with: Working with our delivery teams you will enhance the quality and development of our learners, providing a first class and exceptional level of service.    

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

IT Data Analyst Tutor London x3

Apprenticeships

London

IT Data Analyst Trainer / Tutor (Industry experienced candidates welcome to apply)

London   

About our role: Are you a current Data Analyst who enjoys training, coaching, and facilitating learning in the workplace? Or are you a current Data Analyst Trainer looking for a new opportunity to share your knowledge and experience with our workplace experienced apprentices who are hungry to grow their skills to gain our L4 Qualification giving them career progression and further development. A rewarding role as you watch your learners grow.      

Your focus: FULL TRAINING GIVEN ON THE DELIVERY OF HOW TO BE A SUCCESSFUL TUTOR/TRAINER GIVEN.  The role will involve a blend of teaching, practical exercises, supporting self-study activities and classroom delivery. The programme involves a wide range of skills across Data Analysis. It is expected that the Tutor would be able to deliver majority of the classroom sessions as aligned with the Diploma in Data Analysis. The programme involves a wide range of technical skills across Data Analysis and analytics, data structures, Big Data and processes and tools for data integration. It is not expected that one tutor can deliver the full breadth of the content As a result, the role will require close working with the Service Delivery Team and other tutors to ensure smooth handovers between sessions, consistent approaches to assessment and a shared understanding of apprentice progress

Bring your experience:

Experience of working with Visualising data in a variety of tools such as Excel, Tableau and PowerBI

Experience of working in a Data Analysis environment

Experience of at-least one programming language. Languages such as Python and R will be advantageous

Experience of working with data including data reporting.

Experience of databases and writing software using SQL, preferably in a corporate environment

Recognised IT qualifications covering the skill sets listed above

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.           

More about the Team you will be working with: Working with our delivery teams you will enhance the quality and development of our learners, providing a first class and exceptional level of service.    

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Discounted gym membership, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Competitive financial package + company benefits

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

IT Systems & Networking Skills Coach

Apprenticeships

London

IT Systems & Networking Skills Coach

Are you a Systems & Networking professional or graduate looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you want to use your knowledge and expertise to help others become Systems & Networking professionals?

Would you like to work for a training provider that offers you the chance to develop your own Systems & Networking skills by undertaking certification and education?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Skills Coach, you will be managing a caseload of up to 50 learners on our Systems & Networking Apprenticeship programme. Supporting learners through successful completion of their programme by providing guidance and help to them and their employers.

Within your role, you will maintain regular contact with your learners & employers to assist with the development of those individuals and ensure they receive the best learning outcomes and customer service.

Having previous experience in a similar role would be a bonus, but if you have not, don’t fret; as part of our commitment to you, we will be putting you through Coaching and Mentoring training so that you can become a fully qualified Skills Coach!

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise within Systems & Networking to support and encourage learners through their apprenticeship programme – all whilst working autonomously and managing your own time.

Your team & Development

You will be required to work closely with the Regional Delivery Manager and Head of Delivery. The position will require travel across multiple sites (depending on where your learners are based) so having your own transport is a must!

CPD Opportunities:

 With a very large portfolio of QA Technology courses, there will be opportunities to attend and get certified in courses from:

  • Microsoft – MCP, MCSA Certifications in Windows Client/Server
  • CompTIA Network+/Security+
  • Cisco CCENT/CCNA
  • Cloud certifications such as AWS/Azure/Google
  • Security specialisation and certifications

MSc Opportunities:

  • Cyber Security
  • Information Security Management
  • Professional Practice in Computing and IT

Financial package and benefits

We are offering up to £32,000 base salary per annum (DOE), £3,600 car allowance, private pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

You will need to hold a degree or higher education qualification in Computer Systems, Information Technology, Network/Networking, Computer Architecture, Computer Communication, Computer/Network Security, Computing in Networking, Computing and Internet Technologies or Business Information Technology. Have industry experience in the areas of Systems & Networking or IT Infrastructure, with sound technical knowledge. Certifications in CompTIA Network+, Cisco CCNA, Microsoft Certified Professional – Windows 10, Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2016 are desirable. It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. Holding an existing CAVA qualification would be ideal, however as mentioned, it is not essential.

About QA

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions - Learning, Apprenticeships, Consulting and Higher Education - all of which deliver innovative and cutting-edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Lean Six Sigma Trainer

Learning

London

Lean Six Sigma Trainer

London

QA Learning

Your role

As a Lean Six Sigma Trainer you will be qualified to deliver our Agile and Scrum curriculum. With excellent working knowledge of Agile and Scrum in an IT and/or business environments you will have a passion, hunger and thirst to deliver quality training to the market.

You will also be responsible for the development and management of courseware. You will have proven customer facing, interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to work independently.

Your team

You will be required to work closely with the Business Skills Development management team including regular sharing of information with colleagues. You will be reporting into the Training Delivery Manager.

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive basic salary, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

Broad and in-depth knowledge of Lean Six Sigma and Agile Project Management best practice including but not limited to, AgilePM, DSDM.

APMG Agile Project Management Foundation and Practitioner qualifications.

Ideally have a working knowledge of other methods, best practices, frameworks and standards, including Prince 2 Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Lean, DevOps.

It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a training environment. 

About Us

QA delivers market-leading learning services through four distinct business units, providing professional and IT training to private and public sector organisations, apprenticeships and higher education.  We have won numerous awards for excellence, customer service and innovation.  We are set apart by our scale, capability and customer-centric approach that delivers real business return to our customers.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Learning Administrator

Learning, Government & Defence

Cheltenham

Administrator – Cheltenham

What is the role?

You will provide comprehensive administrative support to the onsite MLS team and onsite Management to ensure we meet our current Service Level Agreements with the client. To take ownership of the weekly administration duties and to complete these in a timely & accurate manner whilst ensuring that quality standards are consistently maintained. To co-ordinate the logistics of courses running for the client ensuring all is prepared in advance of the course, including visitor & laptop passes.

What you need?

You will need to have a methodical approach and be able to prioritise your workload as it changes. You will be a great communicator who will be interacting with both internal and external stakeholders. You will have great attention to detail and must be able to present to employers

Finally you will need to be willing to undergo DV Clearance.

What you receive?

A competitive base salary dependent on experience, pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

You will get 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan,  and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

About Us

QA Learning provides the most complete range of training courses and learning services available in the UK.

QA Learning offers world-class delivery through virtual, mobile and eLearning. We are listed as the no.1 IT training company by The Learning & Performance Institute (LPI), with 350+ fully employed learning professionals and subject matter experts and 24 centres with 230 classrooms across UK.

Customer Service Representative

Learning, Government & Defence

Cheltenham

QA have an exciting new opportunity to recruit, with immediate effect, A Learning Advisor to join a team that is dynamic, fast paced and passionate about working to the highest level of customer service for one of QA’s largest clients.

The role is broad in its nature and therefore the successful candidate will be able to multitask to provide a high quality, dedicated, administrative and logistical service whilst being the first point of contact to our client. You will be passionate about representing QA in the best possible way in every aspect of your role and thrive from working with members of staff who strive to provide an excellent service.

As the Advisor, you will:

  • Provide professional advice on training courses to meet customer requirements
  • Proactively build and maintain business relationships with clients by providing prompt and accurate service
  • Research, respond and advise on queries for all bookings
  • Follow up on all client requests while keeping client informed of progress
  • Communicate and coordinate with other departments to resolve enquires
  • Carry out tasks within the agreed time-frame working to specific frequently monitored SLA’s
  • Liaising with trainers and the scheduling team to arrange logistics, timetable and materials for the programmes.
  • Providing 'on the ground' support for the duration of the programmes, liaising with various QA teams to provide excellent combined team service.

The successful candidate will ideally come from a training/business background, having worked in either an office or learning environment for a minimum of 1 year. Desirable experience includes admin, advice and guidance, customer service, recruitment or sales. Other types of experience will also be considered if the skill-set is naturally transferable.

You will be highly organised with excellent attention to detail and with the ability to multitask. You will have an impeccable and confident telephone manner and be able to work to delight our customer in each step of their journey with us. You must have strong IT/technical skills and comfortable working with systems. 

For the position you must be prepared to complete a DV level of clearance and be happy to be work in a Cheltenham based role.

In return QA will reward your hard work with a state of the art office, an open working structure with direct contact and support from your Manager, the opportunity to progress and take part in self-development training opportunities, a secure working environment, a “family feel” team and exposure to an extremely interesting client.

We understand that superior performance starts and ends with our people; passionate people who like to make a difference and most importantly love what they do. If you would like to be a part of this exciting journey then please apply now!

Learning Technologist

Apprenticeships

Swindon, London, Bristol

About our role: As a Learning Technologist you will be working directly with the Product Managers, Instructional Designers and Subject Matter Experts as part of our Learning Design team. You will proactively improve the online learning experience as part of the Apprenticeships Business Unit transformation to a digital-first blended learning delivery model. This will include the management of our VLE (Canvas) and e-portfolio platform, together with digital production capabilities.

The new digital learning programmes will be innovative and designed around the learner experience, ultimately measured by delivering better outcomes for learners and employers. You will design solutions around the specific needs of Apprenticeships, including End Point Assessment and a mastery-model for learning.  

 

Your focus: Ideally you will have a strong technical background within Education, giving you the knowledge and understanding of how the technology connects with what we want to do: making learning more effective.  Your background might be from a TEL (Technology Enhanced Learning) or a similar role within a Learning OR Education provider.                   

 

Bring your experience:

  • Excellent skills in relevant educational and digital technologies, including, for example:
    - Administration skills in a modern VLE
    - Administration skills for e-portfolio tools
    - HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript in order to improve UI and navigation
    - Content authoring tools, such as Articulate or Evolve/Adapt
    - Adobe Creative Suite or equivalent
    - Camtasia or other screen capture technology
    - Integrations and technical standards, such as TinCan API, LTI and APIs in general
  • Proven track record of supporting learning and teaching using technology, ideally in a professional or work-based education environment.
  • Experience working with VLEs and e-portfolios, with evidence of improving outcomes and learner satisfaction.
  • Experience of working in a transformation project, delivering change to the learning and teaching approach
  • Experience of implementing new systems from scratch, including strong supplier relationships.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally, you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well-received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

 

More about the Team you will be working with: Working within a geographically spread team of eight either in London, Bristol or Swindon. The team works virtually and uses collaboration tools extensively, but there will be some travel to other QA offices for critical meetings each month.

 

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

 

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some downtime, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Discounted gym membership, Cycle to work scheme

Salary range:

In return, we offer a competitive remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898675.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Lecturer / Senior Lecturer - Data Science / Artifical Intelligence

Apprenticeships

Manchester, Birmingham, London, Newcastle, Bristol, Leeds

Lecturer / Senior Lecturer, DEGREE Apprenticeships – Computer Science/ Data Science & Artificial Intelligence

Flexible location E.G. London OR Birmingham OR Leeds OR Bristol OR Manchester OR Newcastle

About our role: Do you have a passion for teaching, imparting knowledge, engendering new skills and behaviours, and keeping up-to-date in an ever-changing world? Do you want to deliver outstanding industry informed teaching on our fully blended and innovative BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships?

At QA we are passionate about the positive impact of degree apprenticeships as a means of enabling engagement with Higher Education for the wider social spectrum.  We are committed to developing innovative means of teaching that support the new modes of study required by modern students. 

You will be working within a growing and expanding team where we all work, support and learn from each other in order to provide our Learners with a dedicated, exceptional level of service that we are extremely proud to be part of.     

As a Lecturer or Senior Lecturer you will be expected to teach at undergraduate and postgraduate levels with a focus on Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, but also bringing your wider expertise in related areas (DevOps, Machine Learning, Enterprise Architectures, Cloud Computing, etc.).

About the programmes: The BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships involve the delivery of a number of computing streams which incorporate Software Engineering, Computer Networking, Cyber Security, Big Data, Analytics and Maths, and broader areas of Computer Science.

Our programmes use a mixture of distance and face-to-face teaching and facilitation across the country using experiential and spiral methods to develop theories-in-action in a work-based learning approach that is both scholarly and professional.

Our use of skills coaches (who visit the learners in the workplace) and their liaison with you is designed to create a progressive and valuable experience for every student and their employer.

Our learners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and work for an equally wide variety of companies including some of the biggest technology companies in Europe. You will also be involved setting and marking of assessments as well as the continued development of new and existing module material.

Your focus: 

You will be expected to teach at undergraduate and postgraduate levels and be able to accommodate learners integrating material from any module, into any role, in any sector.

As important is role-modelling your interest in inquiry and focussing into organisations to promote the professional development of our learners (their employees).  

We work as a geographically dispersed but close-knit team, sharing teaching experiences and new ideas. We challenge each other and work determinedly and efficiently, to reach ever improving teaching and learning standards and outcomes.

You will be required to teach and facilitate in face-to-face sessions across the breadth of QA sites as the teaching schedule requires.  This may require overnight stays.

Bring your experience: 

Please see the attached Job descriptions for Lecturer, and Senior Lecturer levels.  Appointment to roles will be dependent on existing skills, experience, qualifications, and requirements.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you?

Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

Our benefits and values:

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

You will be working within a growing and expanding team where we all work, support and learn from each other in order to provide our Learners with a dedicated, exceptional level of service that we are extremely proud to be part of.

We recognise the value of having a range of skillsets within our academic team, so whether you are an industry professional with acknowledgeable skills in teaching and learning, or an academic with close ties to industry, this role could suit you.

About the programmes:

The BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships involve the delivery of a number of computing streams which incorporate Software Engineering, Computer Networking, Cyber Security, Big Data, Analytics and Maths, and broader areas of Computer Science.

Our programmes use a mixture of distance and face-to-face teaching and facilitation across the country using experiential and spiral methods to develop theories-in-action in a work-based learning approach that is both scholarly and professional.

Our use of skills coaches (who visit the learners in the workplace) and their liaison with you is designed to create a progressive and valuable experience for every student and their employer.

Our learners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and work for an equally wide variety of companies including some of the biggest technology companies in Europe. You will also be involved setting and marking of assessments as well as the continued development of new and existing module material.

Lecturer in Computer Science & Head Of Year

Higher Education

Manchester

Lecturer in Computing & Head of Year – Permanent, FT

Manchester

About our role: As an Experienced HE Lecturer you will contribute to the progression and academic achievement of students studying the BSc Computing Technologies programme. The programme involves a wide range of technical skills across OOP, Mobile App Development, Big Data, AWS, SQL etc. It is not expected that you will be able to contribute to every module in the programme, but you will be expected to have a good breadth of skills and knowledge.

You will also be expected to contribute to widening participation activities and will play an important part in helping our Manchester campus to grow.

To be successful, you will need to be flexible and highly organised. You will also be used to working on your own initiative, without close supervision.

For the right candidate there will be opportunities for future progression in our expanding multi-campus environment.

Your focus: Experience of teaching and curriculum management in more than one of the topics listed below

Recognised IT qualifications OR substantial professional experience covering more than one of the topics listed below

Relevant postgraduate qualifications and/or professional certifications and/or membership of professional body at an appropriate level (e.g. MBCS, CITP, etc.)

PhD - desirable

HEA membership – desirable  

Lecturing experience in the HE sector and/or experience of corporate technical training

Modules include:

Web Development (using HTML 5, CSS, Java Script and PhP, SQL and MySQL)

Maths and Algorithms

Object Oriented Programming

Systems Analysis and Design

Data Modelling and SQL Language

Data Communication and Network Routing

Mobile App Design and Development (using Android Studio)

User Experience Design

Network Design and Troubleshooting

Cloud Computing

Big Data Analytics (using Apache spark using Scala)

Web Application Security (using PhP)

Cyber Security

Data Science

Designing and Developing Products for the Internet of Everything (IoE)

QA Higher Education (QAHE) works in partnership with five different UK Universities offering a range of fully accredited UK higher education programmes from foundation level through to postgraduate degrees across modern, professional campuses in London, Birmingham and Manchester.

The BSc Computing Technologies is well placed to help meet the growing demand for technology-related employment. The degree is designed to provide graduates with a broad range of competencies and skills that are relevant to the current and future job markets.  The degree will equip students with an understanding of core programming and digital technologies, together with giving them an understanding of, and an ability to apply, systems design principles and project management skills.  The degree also equips students with a strong platform in network and cyber security, together with developing skills in cloud computing, web and mobile technologies, big data analytics and user experience design.

More information about the course can be found at https://www.roehampton.ac.uk/qa/computing-technologies/

How to apply and who to contact: Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

London

Lecturer/Senior Lecturer in Marketing (Metrics & Analysis / Digital / Luxury Brand)

London, Fulltime & Permanent Opportunity (Sessional opportunities also considered)

  • Marketing Metrics and Analysis
  • Digital Campaign Management and Media
  • Luxury Brand Value
  • Luxury Brand Industry Project

 As an experienced lecturer you will to have the ability to:  

  • Plan, prepare, teach/deliver modules and support student’s learning on a range of programmes in the subjects above and some other related subject/topic areas
  • Provide guidance, support and tutorship for student groups and individuals as appropriate
  • Meet partnership and internal quality assurance processes in relation to programmes
  • Develop and grow relationships with partnership organisations
  • Carry out academic administration duties as required
  • Maintain personal and professional development in line with agreed appraisal and development programme in order to enhance personal knowledge and contribution to relevant activities. 

Bring your experience:

Doctorate or close to completion (to meet AACSB standards) - essential

Master’s degree or equivalent – essential

HE Lecturer experience in Marketing – essential

HEA Fellowship or PGCE– desirable

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time with 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

To give peace of mind, we provide Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Working at QAHE:

At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team. Perhaps the most significant difference visible on campus is that traditional universities tend to be quite empty (of academic staff) as lecturers spend much less time in the office. There is a friendly and supportive atmosphere here at QAHE with typically far more team-working, promoted in part by more regular staff attendance on campus and in the staff offices. Some potential candidates will find this, and the emphasis on teaching rather than research, very attractive. Academic staff in traditional universities of all ranks are placed under significant demand for research outputs and so have to balance a teaching load and the associated administration with their research obligations. To some this feels like an impossible burden (particularly when expectations around consultancy are added) and QAHE are keen to ensure a far more balanced workload approach across the team.

Closing Date: Opportunity open until successfully recruited, no closing date set.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

Microsoft Windows 10 Trainer

Learning

London

Are you currently an MS Windows Trainer/Coach who loves developing others, looking for a new challenge?

Or are you fed up with not getting the progression you have hard-work for?

Then read on…

Why apply?

If you’re an MS Windows Trainer/Skills Coach based in London, had enough of contracting or your permanent role is no longer challenging you. How about doing something different or working for one of the UK’s largest Education providers where you help others understand the world of Windows…then this role is perfect for you.

As a company, we have promoted a number of our Trainers/Skills Coaches into Manager positions across the business and actively encourage employees to share ideas/practices that could make our courses more effective.

What is the role?

With our support, you will deliver/coach using face to face, e-Learning or digital MS Windows courses and content to all appropriate areas within QA to likeminded people. Whether they are a highly qualified professional or a beginner looking to get into the world of MS Windows.  

Based in London, you will be delivering/coaching both public scheduled and bespoke courses for all appropriate areas of QA’s Portfolio.

How will we support you?

From day one you will be assigned a co-pilot/buddy to help get you up to speed with our processes and ensure you can help deliver our award-winning programmes.

Financial package and benefits 

We are offering a competitive base salary (dependant on experience), private pension as well as 25 days holiday. 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme.

Must haves:

  • Capability to train MOC Windows 7 and Windows 10 courses to IT professionals
  • Excellent customer facing, presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to share expertise with others
  • Ideally qualified as Microsoft Certified Trainer
  • Demonstrate sound business acumen, communication skills and intellectual curiosity
  • Patience and tolerance

Who are we?

As one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We like to help develop skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  With our HQ in London and 20 training centres nationwide, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) & ever-evolving skills solutions.

So interested? If so please apply today…

The Role?

Using a consultative sales approach (which we will train you on), you will contact UK business leaders about taking on apprentices, something which is a valuable sell into a company adding benefits to both employers and candidates alike. You will be helping an apprentice get into the workplace and better their future prospects, whilst giving the client an individual who they can develop, mould and grow into their business.

You will have your own individual target which you will be rewarded against. You will be targeted on hitting/over-achieving monthly margin targets, increasing the number of buying customers in the account base, and continuously improving NPI (customer service) ratings.

London

We are looking to recruit a Programme Administrator to support our Degree Apprenticeships Team in delivering our advanced Apprenticeship Programme.

You will be based in our office in London (Tower Hill, 2 minutes’ walk from the tube station). This new role is full-time, permanent and has plenty of growth potential.

As the Programme Administrator, you will:

  • Provide effective and efficient administrative support to all degree programmes
  • Manage registrations and student queries via email and phone
  • Support the scheduling booking system
  • Take responsibility the University registrations and Examination Board preparation
  • Support Moderation processes at the end of each term
  • Support student allocations

As the Programme Administrator, you will have:

  • Extensive administrative experience within the education sector
  • Experience of multi-tasking and delivery to agreed timescale
  • Experience of managing and prioritising complex workloads
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Excellent organisational, problem-solving and planning skills
  • Excellent literacy and numerical skills
  • Flexibility and adaptability to change

Programme Events Administrator

Cheltenham  

Your focus:

As the Programme Administrator, you will work to provide a high quality, dedicated, administrative service. Your focus will be to provide day to day support to the Programme Manager and Workstream Leads.

The role includes:

  • Adding event bookings on QA’s Booking System
  • PO raising
  • Maintaining a PO and spend tracker
  • Invoice handling and tracking, as set by Programme Manager and Workstream Leads.
  • Daily project team tasks such as minute taking, arranging stakeholder meetings and collating weekly reports
  • Travel and accommodation sourcing, booking and reporting for delivery teams.
  • Overall responsibility for the collection, storage and transportation of programme materials such as, making up goodie bags, storage of posters and banners
  • Carrying out all other ad-hoc administrative tasks as required by the programme

Bring your experience:

  • High standard of literacy and numeracy
  • Strong sense of task ownership
  • Ability to work independently and under pressure
  • Methodical and accurate with a proven ability to focus on detail
  • Proven organisational & planning skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential
  • Use initiative to identify and resolve problems or issues
  • Determine when problems should be escalated to a higher level and act promptly to make relevant parties aware

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Your role

You will maintain regular contact with your learners and their employers to demonstrate formal progress and planning of progression for the learner. You will be very hands-on in ensuring the learner completes scheduled assessments, tasks and presentations. This will be done via both face to face and online sessions.  

Your team

You will be required to work closely with the Regional Delivery Manager and Head of Delivery. The position will require travel across multiple sites (depending on where your learners are based) so having your own transport is a must!

You would need to have experience of working in a management position or a degree/masters degree in a project management specific subject.

Sales Executive

Learning

London

About our role: Are you a recent GRADUATE looking for success, development and good financial rewards OR do you have some sales experience already and looking for the next step to a rewarding and lucrative sales career? Full Training Given. Read on………….. 

Your focus:. Through our excellent Sales Academy Training and working within our knowledgeable team as Inside Sales Executive you will play a fundamental role to develop new customer relationships through a consultative sales method. Our role is a mixture of taking inbound sales calls to maximise and develop each enquiry along with following up on marketing leads and developing new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls (full training given).  Success within the role will lead to promotion and further development.      

Day to Day: 

Sourcing new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and marketing

Identifying business opportunities and provide accurate forecasting of pipeline sales

Maintain a high level of telephone calls to potential, existing and lapsed customers ensuring that we promote customer care and generate new business leads to achieve targets

Monitor discounts being offered and ensure correct pricing is being applied to all opportunities

Route larger qualified opportunities to the appropriate sales team for further development and closure

Preparing quotes and proposals for customers

Providing excellent and effective customer service at all times

Updating and maintaining the CRM using all resources available

Advise the Inside Team Manager of any cross selling opportunities

Bring your experience:

Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to build rapport with key stakeholders

Driven and ambitious individual with a strong desire to succeed

Ideally previous experience in an inside sales role within a similar business

An entrepreneurial spirit and determination

Trustworthy and honest

The ability to operate well and contribute to a strong team environment

Self motivated

A deep understanding of the need to respond quickly to requests

Good attention to detail

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.           

More about the Team you will be working with: Working within a lively and vibrant team, where we will help and support you at grow your knowledge and enjoy what you do, have fun at the same time making sure we are hitting our numbers.      

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.About our role: Are you a recent GRADUATE looking for success, development and good financial rewards OR do you have some sales experience already and looking for the next step to a rewarding and lucrative sales career? Sales Executive

Manchester

Sales Executive (Graduates Welcome to apply, full training provided) 

Central Manchester 

Working within a vibrant and successful sales team, our role is primarily a telephone-based cold calling position involving profiling of accounts, meeting generation and prospect building. Over time, the role will evolve into an account management position and depending on the success level of each sales person, an external client facing position managing a portfolio of key accounts

Our role is suitable for a recent graduate. Sales experience is very welcome, but not mandatory. We will provide you with comprehensive training at QA Sales Academy to help you on your way with a rewarding career. 

As the Sales Executive, you will:

  • Create sustainable business relationships
  • Identify business opportunities and provide accurate forecasting of pipeline sales
  • Prepare quotes and proposals for customers
  • Provide effective Customer service management
  • Maintain all relevant management information systems
  • Prospect for new customers
  • Provide support to the Sales Manager

 As the Sales Executive, you will have:

  • An entrepreneurial spirit and determination
  • Confidence and a strong sense of direction
  • Excellent communication skills
  • The ability to operate well and contribute to a strong team environment
  • Self-motivation and drive
  • Strong understanding of sales processes
  • A deep understanding of the need to respond quickly to requests
  • Good attention to detail

Sales Executive

Learning

Slough

Are you looking for your first step into the sales industry? Or have you maybe had a little bit of sales experience previously but are looking for the right company to really develop those skills within? If you are, then we want you!

You will manage a portfolio of existing spending accounts, whilst developing new business opportunities within new areas of the business to grow this further. You will be part of a dedicated and highly skilled team, who work closely to deliver great results and build long-lasting relationships. You will develop a strong understanding of the clients’ needs and opportunities, so that you can provide the best service possible.

You will be given accounts, which will be a mixture of spending accounts, previously spending but currently lapsed accounts to re-generate, and cold accounts which need some TLC to build up to become new spending accounts, selling over 1500 courses from the QA Learning portfolio!

You will sell using a consultative sales approach, which you will receive full training and mentoring on.

With a competitive basic salary depending on experience and great commission package, it’s a great opportunity to develop your career within Account Management, with fantastic set progression routes throughout the company. You really can be in control of your earnings and career prospects.

Operations Project Planner

Learning

Slough

Loud, outgoing, process focused and friendly! Does this sound like the sort of environment you would like to work in?

Then keep reading to find out more…

What is the role?

As part of our Operations team, you will be responsible for supporting our wide-ranging client base, managing our Trainers diaries effectively and internal/external venues to ensure our delegates receive our award-winning programmes.

Dealing with high volumes of email requests and calls from internal/external stakeholders, in this role you will need to be process focused with the ability to multitask and negotiate. You will be required to prioritise your ever-evolving workload as well as troubleshooting any issues using your own initiative to create logical solutions.

With this in mind you will be given support whilst you learn the role…

How will we support you?

It’s really important to make sure you have the support required to deal with this busy but challenging position, however, with a highly experienced Manager and team, we will train you to ensure you understand the role.

You will have an in-depth 1-2-1 training programme to get you up to speed in the first week as well as a dedicated mentor for the first three months.

You will be joining a team of six who like to create a loud, fun & friendly environment.

Financial package and benefits 

Competitive base salary, private pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Must haves (We do need the following):

  • Previous experience in a busy office environment
  • Processed focus and must be able to think on their feet whilst making decisions
  • Great people skills (sounds cliché but building relationships is a key part of this role)

If you’ve read the above, feel we are the company for you. Then apply to us today. Speak soon…

 View Detail

Software Development Assessor/Skills Coach - Leeds

Apprenticeships

Leeds

Software Development Assessor/Skills Coach

Coaching learners to transform their lives and careers. Top-notch, trending tech apprenticeship programmes. Flexibility and a great salary. Sound appealing? Then we’ve got the role for you.

We’re seeking tech skills coaches who love helping others learn and accomplish their goals. Join a hands-on, fulfilling role helping apprentices to grow personally and professionally.

About the role

At QA, we know that real life doesn’t happen in a textbook, so we deliver apprenticeships in a modern, blended format – in the classroom, online and in the workplace – supported by you, their skills coach.

As a skills coach, you stand on the forefront of our learner experience. You‘ll be the primary contact for your learners in tech programmes, supporting them and their employers throughout their apprenticeship to ensure they complete it successfully and on time.

You’ll enrol and guide learners through the programme, check in regularly, make sure they stay on track with their module activities and prepare them for the end-point assessment (EPA). While you won’t be involved in assessing their work, you’ll make sure they’re understanding and applying the new skills, knowledge and behaviours they’ve learned and working towards the EPA requirements.

You’ll also provide personal support and motivation to learners to ensure they get the best out of the programme.

Responsibilities

  • Enrol and set up apprentices in the programme, ensuring that it’s suitable for them, their job role, their career goals and their employer
  • Understand the “20% off-the-job learning” requirement for every apprentice and plan how they’ll achieve that time
  • Make regular contact with apprentices and employers, acting as QA’s primary point of contact and as manager of the apprentice’s journey
  • Meet with each apprentice and employer every 6-8 weeks to check on progress
  • Record detailed evidence of progress at each meeting and keep our online database/learning platform up-to-date for each learner
  • Support apprentices as they prepare for and complete their EPA

You are…

  • Experienced in coaching, training or tutoring with an interest in career development
  • Knowledgeable about or interested in tech areas (and willing to learn)
  • Passionate about supporting, guiding and teaching others
  • Caring, warm and professional in supporting coaches
  • Confident in customer-facing roles with strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Eligible to live and work in the UK and able to travel to different locations
  • Able to plan and deliver against set learning and achievement targets

What we offer

  • Generous base salary (dependent on experience)
  • Private pension
  • 25 days holiday
  • Two days paid charity work for a charity of your choice
  • Three days of paid training from your choice of 1,200+ diverse QA courses
  • Cycle to work scheme

Who are we?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We help develop skills and capabilities for everyone, from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London with 20 more training centres nationwide, QA Group comprises four fast-growing divisions – QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education – all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) and ever-evolving skills solutions.

 View Detail

Software Development Tutor - London x2

Apprenticeships

London

Do you have a passion for Software Development?

Fed up with your hands on technical role? How about teaching others for a living?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Software Development Tutor, you will be delivering training and teaching Software Development as part of the overall apprenticeship programme (Level 3 and Level 4). You will be managing the apprentice progress and will plan the teaching and mentoring to retain apprentices to achieve maximum apprentice completion.

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise within Software Development helping and encouraging learners through their apprenticeship programme. 

Your team

Based in London (Tower Hill tube station), you will be required to work closely with the Training Manager and Head of Delivery in managing the teaching and mentoring to learners in the areas of Software Development.

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive salary, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

You should have an industry-accepted certification or higher education qualification in addition to substantial industry experience in Software Development (C#/SQL, ideally Java), with extensive technical knowledge and understanding of different software. It is highly desirable that you hold a teaching qualification or hold an MCT. It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a teaching environment.

About QA Apprenticeships

QA Apprenticeships - As the fastest growing division of QA, we are now the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services apprenticeships. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with an amazing 'Outstanding’ in all areas.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

 

 View Detail

Software Development Tutor - Manchester

Apprenticeships

Manchester, Leeds

Teaching learners in-demand skills to transform their lives and careers. Top-notch, trending tech apprenticeship programmes. Flexibility, fulfilment and a great salary. Sound appealing? Then we’ve got the role for you.

We’re seeking tech skills trainers based in Manchester who love helping others learn and accomplish their goals. This is an exciting, fulfilling role helping learners to grow their skills and achieve their potential.

About the role

At QA, we know that real life doesn’t happen in a textbook, so we run our apprenticeships in a modern, blended format – in the classroom, online and in the workplace.

With our support, you’ll deliver this tech apprenticeship course content face-to-face in the classroom and through e-Learning or digital formats. You’ll teach both scheduled public and customised courses for relevant areas of QA’s tech portfolio: IT, cybersecurity or web/software development.

This role is about teaching and supporting learners to help them succeed—whether they’re qualified professionals looking to upskill, or beginners (including new grads) making the leap into tech careers.

You are…

  • Experienced in training or tutoring with an interest in career development
  • Knowledgeable about or interested in tech areas (and willing to learn)
  • Passionate about supporting/teaching others and sharing your expertise
  • Confident in customer-facing roles with strong presentation, interpersonal and communication skills
  • Eligible to live and work in the UK and able to travel to different locations
  • Able to plan and deliver against set learning and achievement targets

What we offer

  • Generous base salary (dependent on experience)
  • Private pension
  • 25 days holiday
  • Two days paid charity work for a charity of your choice
  • Three days of paid training from your choice of 1,200+ diverse QA courses
  • Subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme

Who are we?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We help develop skills and capabilities for everyone, from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London with 20 more training centres nationwide, QA Group comprises four fast-growing divisions – QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education – all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) and ever-evolving skills solutions.

Software Testing Trainer

Learning

Leeds, Birmingham, Manchester

Are you currently a Software Testing Professional who loves developing others, looking for a new challenge?

Or are you fed up of not getting the progression you have hard-work for?

Then read on…

Why apply?

If you’re an experienced Software testing professional, had enough of contracting or your permanent role is no longer challenging you. How about doing something different or working for one of the UK’s largest Education providers where you help others understand the world of Software testing…then this role is perfect for you.

What is the role?

With our support, you will deliver using face to face, e-Learning or digital Software testing courses and content to all appropriate areas within QA to likeminded people. Whether they are a highly qualified professional or a beginner looking to get into the world of Software testing.  

Based in Midlands or in the North, you will be delivering/coaching both public scheduled and bespoke courses for all appropriate areas of QA’s Skills Portfolio.

How will we support you?

From day one you will be assigned a co-pilot/buddy to help get you up to speed with our processes and ensure you can help deliver our award-winning BSD courses (including Testing & Agile).

Financial package and benefits 

We are offering a competitive salary (dependant on experience), private pension as well as 25 days holiday. 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Must haves:

  • In-depth expertise and industry experience of Testing, Agile and Test Automation
  • Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills - be able to form a rapport quickly with people and make them feel comfortable; ability to break down complex scenarios into simpler chunks and explain them

Nice to haves:

  • Ideally qualified as ISTQB and BCS Testing trainer
  • Experience in delivering training courses
  • Knowledge of ISTQB and BCS Systems testing certification schemes

Who are we?

As one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We like to help develop skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  With our HQ in London and 20 training centres nationwide, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) & ever-evolving skills solutions.

So interested? If so please apply today… 

 View Detail

SQL & BI Trainer x 3 roles

Learning

London

Your SQL knowledge it not up-to-date but you would love to upgrade it? Do you love developing others and helping them to grow?

We are offering a great and rare opportunity to upskill your SQL knowledge, to learn from the best and to become a Certified Trainer

If you have decent knowledge of SQL and would like to move into training, QA will be happy to support you on this journey

Extensive initial training up to two months including refreshing your subject matter knowledge and getting you the necessary certifications (MCT and MCSE – to name just a few!).  Every QA trainer stays up to date with the cutting edge and new technologies, so these two months will be just a start of your professional journey with us.

You will go through “Train the Trainer” sessions and will be shadowing some of our highly successful and professional trainers to get you ready to face delegates in the classroom.

Please have a look at the list of technical qualifications required:

Decent knowledge of the following:  

  • SQL Server 2008/2012 (Administration and Development)
  • Analysis Services 2008/2012
  • Integration Services 2008/2012
  • Reporting Services (BIDS 2008/2012 / Report Builder 2.0-3.0)
  • Data Warehouse Design Methodology

Please apply with your CV, we look forward to talking to you!

 View Detail

SQL Developer

Central Services

Leeds

 

About our role: As SQL Developer, you will be working with complex, high volumes of data, utilising your skills in T-SQL to perform stored procedures, complex query writing and table joins, whilst at the same time being able to develop new skills in areas such as SSIS and SSRS.

We are looking for people that have a fundamental knowledge of SQL Server / T-SQL - you should understand the differences between 'have-by’ and 'where’ clauses, know the different types of joins (left, inner, outer), be familiar with Union / UnionALL and be able to write complex stored procedures. This is an exciting opportunity to join a company with significant plans for growth and to be part of helping drive QA’s success.

Your focus: You will be responsible for work with the applications and database support team to meet the key business strategies and objectives:

 

  • To support the build and support the maintenance of the Data Warehouse
  • Work as part of the team to build and maintain the data reporting environments
  • Using SQL services to support the existing business solutions and technologies.

 

Bring your experience:

  • Microsoft SQL development, SQL applications support or a similar role
  • Building SQL Data warehouses
  • Hands on experience with SQL 2010/SQL 2012/SQL 2016
  • Data analysis and reporting
  • Creating and maintaining MS SQL DTS or SSIS packages
  • Creating support documentation.
  • Managing and maintaining SQL object database security

 

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

 

More about the Team you will be working with: You will work within a team of a dozen developers, testers and project managers in the Leeds office – all fun-loving and great to work with.     

 

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

 

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

 

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. We look forward to hearing from you!

Teaching and Learning Manager

Apprenticeships

Home-Based, Swindon, London

Teaching & Learning Manager

Are you a looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you have a passion for teaching and offering solutions on how to improve?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Teaching & Learning Manager, you will standardise and lead the quality of teaching and learning throughout the QA Apprenticeships division.

You will maintain regular contact with our tutors and skills coaches to ensure that there is a consistent standard across all of our teaching areas, as well as working with them to actively identify opportunities to improve the standard of teaching and learning for our learners.

Your team

You will be required to work closely with the Heads of Delivery for all regions across the UK, proactively working together to ensure that standards are maintained. You will also work closely with leaders from other teams such as  sales, delivery and compliance to ensure that learners successfully complete their full apprenticeship by their planned date. 

The position will involve travel across multiple sites so having your own transport is a must!

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive basic salary, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

Ideally, you will have significant industry experience in a training environment. Direct apprenticeship training experience is also preferred but not essential. 

You would need to have experience of working in a management position or a degree/masters degree in a relevant subject.

It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. 

About QA Apprenticeships

QA Apprenticeships - As the fastest growing division of QA, we are now the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services apprenticeships. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with an amazing 'Outstanding’ in all areas.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.
