Training Project Manager - 6 month contract

Learning

UK Wide, London

Read More

Training Project Manager - 6 month contract

Training Project Manager – London based with national travel.

This is a great opportunity for an experienced project manager to join us on an initial 6 month contract.

What is the role?

You will be responsible for delivery of training Projects & Programmes and Project Service focused Client engagements. Your responsibilities will include the following:

  • To provide day to day Training Project Management to teams of internal and external Trainers, Consultants, Communications, Co-ordinators and Administrators
  • To ensure Projects are defined and managed in accordance with a considered Statement of Work (SoW) and Training Plan to agreed time, cost and quality parameters
  • To engage in new opportunities, pre-sales support activities and Bids process to support business development through identification, initiation and closure of new Projects
  • To provide Communications Management supporting the creation of a communications strategy and plan as part of project initiation
  • Creation of communications collateral (in the confines of brand/internal guidelines
  • Design and document the distribution process and manage the distribution process
  • To provide Business Engagement (BE) services supporting the initiation of migration projects
  • Development of the BE process and building of the Business Champion (BC) networks
  • Development and delivery of BE collateral and ongoing networking with the BC
  • Effective control of business change and change request procedures
  • Delivery of Project Management services

What we offer?

No one wants to work for free so here’s what we give you:

A highly competitive base salary!

Must haves (We do need the following):

  • Experienced Projects Manager 5+ years
  • Training Project Management experience
  • Communications / Client engagement experience
  • Operational Management and Commercial experience helpful
  • Certified Project Management methodology ~ Prince2, APM, MSP or other
  • Client facing experience to Senior Sponsor level
  • Ability to manage multiple workstreams
  • Solution creation, project initiation, planning and budget management responsibility

What do we do?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

If you’ve read the above, feel we are the company for you. Then apply to us today. Speak soon…

Software Development Assessor/Skills Coach - Leeds

Apprenticeships

Leeds

Read More

Software Development Assessor/Skills Coach - Leeds

Software Development Assessor/Skills Coach

Coaching learners to transform their lives and careers. Top-notch, trending tech apprenticeship programmes. Flexibility and a great salary. Sound appealing? Then we’ve got the role for you.

We’re seeking tech skills coaches who love helping others learn and accomplish their goals. Join a hands-on, fulfilling role helping apprentices to grow personally and professionally.

About the role

At QA, we know that real life doesn’t happen in a textbook, so we deliver apprenticeships in a modern, blended format – in the classroom, online and in the workplace – supported by you, their skills coach.

As a skills coach, you stand on the forefront of our learner experience. You‘ll be the primary contact for your learners in tech programmes, supporting them and their employers throughout their apprenticeship to ensure they complete it successfully and on time.

You’ll enrol and guide learners through the programme, check in regularly, make sure they stay on track with their module activities and prepare them for the end-point assessment (EPA). While you won’t be involved in assessing their work, you’ll make sure they’re understanding and applying the new skills, knowledge and behaviours they’ve learned and working towards the EPA requirements.

You’ll also provide personal support and motivation to learners to ensure they get the best out of the programme.

Responsibilities

  • Enrol and set up apprentices in the programme, ensuring that it’s suitable for them, their job role, their career goals and their employer
  • Understand the “20% off-the-job learning” requirement for every apprentice and plan how they’ll achieve that time
  • Make regular contact with apprentices and employers, acting as QA’s primary point of contact and as manager of the apprentice’s journey
  • Meet with each apprentice and employer every 6-8 weeks to check on progress
  • Record detailed evidence of progress at each meeting and keep our online database/learning platform up-to-date for each learner
  • Support apprentices as they prepare for and complete their EPA

You are…

  • Experienced in coaching, training or tutoring with an interest in career development
  • Knowledgeable about or interested in tech areas (and willing to learn)
  • Passionate about supporting, guiding and teaching others
  • Caring, warm and professional in supporting coaches
  • Confident in customer-facing roles with strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Eligible to live and work in the UK and able to travel to different locations
  • Able to plan and deliver against set learning and achievement targets

What we offer

  • Generous base salary (dependent on experience)
  • Private pension
  • 25 days holiday
  • Two days paid charity work for a charity of your choice
  • Three days of paid training from your choice of 1,200+ diverse QA courses
  • Cycle to work scheme

Who are we?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We help develop skills and capabilities for everyone, from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London with 20 more training centres nationwide, QA Group comprises four fast-growing divisions – QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education – all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) and ever-evolving skills solutions.

Cisco Certified CCSI Trainer (We Sponsor Your Qualification)

Learning

London

Read More

Cisco Certified CCSI Trainer (We Sponsor Your Qualification)

Fed up with your hands on technical role? How about teaching others for a living?

Why apply?

If you've had enough of contracting or your permanent role is no longer challenging you. How about doing something different and helping others understand the technical world of Cisco CCNA/CCNP. Then this role is perfect for you.

Who are we?

As one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We like to help develop skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. With our HQ in London and 20 training centres nationwide, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) & ever-evolving skills solutions.

What is the role?

With our support and training, you will deliver face to face / e-Learning / digital training and content development for all appropriate areas within the QA family to likeminded people. Whether this is a highly qualified professional or young learners looking to get into the world of Technology.

You will be delivering both public scheduled and bespoke courses for all appropriate areas of QA’s Cisco portfolio, particularly ICND 1 &2.

How will we support you?

Experienced or not experienced, you will be assigned a co-pilot (friendly buddy but cool sounding name) to help get you up to speed. For those who are not qualified, we will help you achieve your Instructor Candidate Trainer accreditation which gives you the confidence and knowledge to teach.

Money

It is unlikely you’ll want or be able to work for free. So with that in mind, we offer a competitive financial package with benefits.

Other benefits

 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,500 to be precise), Life Assurance and cycle to work scheme.

Must have’s:

  • CCNA Qualified
  • ICND 1&2 certifications
  • Experience and knowledge equivalent to CCNP level
  • Real-world technical experience of Cisco products

Nice to have’s:

  • ICND 1 and ICND 2 version 3.0 (current certification version) 

 So interested? If so please apply.

 

 

 

Prince2 Trainer x2

Learning

London

Read More

Prince2 Trainer x2

As a Prince2 Trainer, you will be ideally be based around the London Area and be qualified to deliver our industry leading Prince2 training courses. With excellent working knowledge of Prince2 you will have a thirst to deliver quality training to the market.

As Prince2 Trainer you will have proven customer facing, interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to work independently.

You will be very hands on in ensuring the learners completes scheduled assessments, tasks and presentations. As well as face to face training delivery, you will also be expected to deliver remote sessions via online platforms as and when required.

YOUR Experience

You will need to be an AXELOS accredited Prince2 Trainer with a history of delivering Prince2 training to professionals. 

Excellent customer facing, presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to share expertise with others

Team player who can also adapt to working solo for long periods

A passion for Prince2 and the acquiring of new skills and experience

Be prepared to travel to different locations in the UK, with occasional stays away from home

 

In return, we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential. 

 

Agile Project Management Trainer

Learning

London

Read More

Agile Project Management Trainer

 

As an Agile Trainer, you will be ideally be based around the London Area and be qualified to deliver our Agile and Scrum curriculum. With excellent working knowledge of Agile and Scrum in an IT and/or business environments, you will have a passion, hunger and thirst to deliver quality training to the market.

The successful candidate will also have strong software development skills. Ideally, they would involve the Microsoft toolset including C#, .NET and Visual Studio. 

As Agile Trainer, you will also be responsible for the development and management of courseware. You will have proven customer facing, interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to work independently.

YOUR Experience

You will need to be an expert in Agile and Scrum software development with the skills and aptitude to continue to develop these skills as part of a continuous and development lifecycle.

You will also have strong software development skills. Ideally, they would involve the Microsoft toolset including C#, .NET and Visual Studio.

Excellent customer facing, presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to share expertise with others

Team player who can also adapt to working solo for long periods

A passion for Agile and Scrum and the acquiring of new skills and experience

Be prepared to travel to different locations in the UK (and sometimes abroad) with occasional stays away from home

 

In return, we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential. 

 

Agile & Scrum Trainer - Scotland

Learning

Glasgow

Read More

Agile & Scrum Trainer - Scotland

 

QA delivers market-leading learning services through four distinct business units, providing professional and IT training to private and public sector organisations, apprenticeships and higher education.  We have won numerous awards for excellence, customer service and innovation.  We are set apart by our scale, capability and customer-centric approach that delivers real business return to our customers.

 

OUR Role

As Agile & Scrum Trainer, you will be ideally be based around Glasgow Area and be qualified to deliver our Agile and Scrum curriculum. With excellent working knowledge of Agile and Scrum in an IT and/or business environments you will have a passion, hunger and thirst to deliver quality training to the market. The successful candidate will also have strong software development skills. Ideally, they would involve the Microsoft toolset including C#, .NET and Visual Studio. As an Agile and Scrum Trainer, you will also be responsible for the development and management of courseware. You will have proven customer facing, interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to work independently.

We are offering a competitive financial package + our leading company benefits. 

YOUR Experience

The successful candidate for this role will need to be an expert in Agile and Scrum software development with the skills and aptitude to continue to develop these skills as part of a continuous and development lifecycle.

The candidate will also have strong software development skills. Ideally, they would involve the Microsoft toolset including C#, .NET and Visual Studio.

Excellent customer facing, presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to share expertise with others

Team player who can also adapt to working solo for long periods

A passion for Agile and Scrum and the acquiring of new skills and experience

Be prepared to travel to different locations in the UK (and sometimes abroad) with occasional stays away from home

 

In return we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential. 

 

(Senior) Lecturer Computer Science, Software Engineering

Apprenticeships

Manchester, Birmingham, Leeds, Bristol, London, Newcastle

Read More

(Senior) Lecturer Computer Science, Software Engineering

Lecturer / Senior Lecturer, DEGREE Apprenticeships – Computer Science/ Software Engineering

Flexible location E.G. London OR Birmingham OR Leeds OR Bristol OR Manchester OR Newcastle

About our role: 

Do you have a passion for teaching, imparting knowledge, engendering new skills and behaviours, and keeping up-to-date in an ever-changing world? Do you want to deliver outstanding industry informed teaching on our fully blended and innovative BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships?

At QA we are passionate about the positive impact of degree apprenticeships as a means of enabling engagement with Higher Education for the wider social spectrum.  We are committed to developing innovative means of teaching that support the new modes of study required by modern students. 

You will be working within a growing and expanding team where we all work, support and learn from each other in order to provide our Learners with a dedicated, exceptional level of service that we are extremely proud to be part of.    

As a Lecturer or Senior Lecturer you will be expected to teach at undergraduate and postgraduate levels with a focus on Software Engineering, but also bringing your wider expertise in related areas (DevOps, Machine Learning, Data & Analytics, Enterprise Architectures, etc.).

We recognise the value of having a range of skillsets within our academic team, so whether you are an industry professional with acknowledgeable skills in teaching and learning, or an academic with close ties to industry, this role could suit you.

About the programmes:

The BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships involve the delivery of a number of computing streams which incorporate Software Engineering, Computer Networking, Cyber Security, Big Data, Analytics and Maths, and broader areas of Computer Science.

Our programmes use a mixture of distance and face-to-face teaching and facilitation across the country using experiential and spiral methods to develop theories-in-action in a work-based learning approach that is both scholarly and professional.

Our use of skills coaches (who visit the learners in the workplace) and their liaison with you is designed to create a progressive and valuable experience for every student and their employer.

Our learners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and work for an equally wide variety of companies including some of the biggest technology companies in Europe. You will also be involved setting and marking of assessments as well as the continued development of new and existing module material.

Your focus: 

You will be expected to teach at undergraduate and postgraduate levels and be able to accommodate learners integrating material from any module, into any role, in any sector.

As important is role-modelling your interest in inquiry and focussing into organisations to promote the professional development of our learners (their employees).  

We work as a geographically dispersed but close-knit team, sharing teaching experiences and new ideas. We challenge each other and work determinedly and efficiently, to reach ever improving teaching and learning standards and outcomes.

You will be required to teach and facilitate in face-to-face sessions across the breadth of QA sites as the teaching schedule requires.  This may require overnight stays.

Bring your experience: 

Please see the attached Job descriptions for Lecturer, and Senior Lecturer levels.  Appointment to roles will be dependent on existing skills, experience, qualifications, and requirements.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you?

Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

Our benefits and values:

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. 

We look forward to hearing from you!  

 

 

Digital Learning Designer x2

Learning

Brighton, Swindon, Slough

Read More

Digital Learning Designer x2

Digital Learning Designer     

Brighton OR Slough Based    

Are you a junior instructional designer or responsible in your current role for the full lifecycle of digital story boarding projects? Are you ready for a new challenge, looking to join a vibrant, fast paced, growing organisation where we can help develop and progress your career and skills?

About our role: As Digital Learning Designer you will be responsible for designing and creating engaging and effective digital learning solutions for QA’s large clients. Working with our Account Managers, you will be involved in the complete lifecycle of a digital solution for QA’s customers: writing proposals, learning needs analysis, designing and creating creative instructional approaches and assessing the outcomes and effectiveness of the learning.

Your focus day to day:

Work closely with Account Managers and Bids teams to understand client requirements and propose digital solutions to meet their needs

Design and create engaging and effective digital solutions leveraging the best of QA’s thought leadership and digital assets

Develop subject matter expertise aligned to core capabilities and promote QA’s thought leadership on digital solutions

Bring your experience:

Relevant multimedia or instructional design qualification at degree level

Experience of developing blended learning, digital learning and mobile learning solutions

Visual design skills (Dreamweaver, Photoshop, Illustrator) and ability to storyboard

Experience working in a commercial materials development environment, preferably related to on-line and blended learning

Strong knowledge of mobile development approaches and technologies

Working knowledge of digital learning authoring tools including Captivate, Camtasia and Articulate

Understanding of different digital learning development techniques and methodologies (formal and informal)

Excellent written and communication skills (for a range of purposes and audiences); ability to write effective copy, instructional text, audio scripts/video scripts

Excellent stakeholder management skills to manage customer, account manager and product SME expectations

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

More about the Team you will be working with: Working within a team of around 8, we are lively, outgoing and extremely supportive. We are passionate about what we do and aim to provide our clients with exceptional results             

Our benefits and values: Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

We know it’s important to recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- Learning, Apprenticeships, Consulting and Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call Michaela on 01753 898671

.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Lecturer / Senior Lecturer - Data Science / Artifical Intelligence

Lecturer / Senior Lecturer, DEGREE Apprenticeships – Computer Science/ Data Science & Artificial Intelligence

Flexible location E.G. London OR Birmingham OR Leeds OR Bristol OR Manchester OR Newcastle

About our role: Do you have a passion for teaching, imparting knowledge, engendering new skills and behaviours, and keeping up-to-date in an ever-changing world? Do you want to deliver outstanding industry informed teaching on our fully blended and innovative BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships?

At QA we are passionate about the positive impact of degree apprenticeships as a means of enabling engagement with Higher Education for the wider social spectrum.  We are committed to developing innovative means of teaching that support the new modes of study required by modern students. 

You will be working within a growing and expanding team where we all work, support and learn from each other in order to provide our Learners with a dedicated, exceptional level of service that we are extremely proud to be part of.     

As a Lecturer or Senior Lecturer you will be expected to teach at undergraduate and postgraduate levels with a focus on Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, but also bringing your wider expertise in related areas (DevOps, Machine Learning, Enterprise Architectures, Cloud Computing, etc.).

About the programmes: The BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships involve the delivery of a number of computing streams which incorporate Software Engineering, Computer Networking, Cyber Security, Big Data, Analytics and Maths, and broader areas of Computer Science.

Our programmes use a mixture of distance and face-to-face teaching and facilitation across the country using experiential and spiral methods to develop theories-in-action in a work-based learning approach that is both scholarly and professional.

Our use of skills coaches (who visit the learners in the workplace) and their liaison with you is designed to create a progressive and valuable experience for every student and their employer.

Our learners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and work for an equally wide variety of companies including some of the biggest technology companies in Europe. You will also be involved setting and marking of assessments as well as the continued development of new and existing module material.

Your focus: 

You will be expected to teach at undergraduate and postgraduate levels and be able to accommodate learners integrating material from any module, into any role, in any sector.

As important is role-modelling your interest in inquiry and focussing into organisations to promote the professional development of our learners (their employees).  

We work as a geographically dispersed but close-knit team, sharing teaching experiences and new ideas. We challenge each other and work determinedly and efficiently, to reach ever improving teaching and learning standards and outcomes.

You will be required to teach and facilitate in face-to-face sessions across the breadth of QA sites as the teaching schedule requires.  This may require overnight stays.

Bring your experience: 

Please see the attached Job descriptions for Lecturer, and Senior Lecturer levels.  Appointment to roles will be dependent on existing skills, experience, qualifications, and requirements.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you?

Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

Our benefits and values:

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Assistant Lecturer

Assistant Lecturer DEGREE Apprenticeships – Data Science

Flexible location E.G. London OR Birmingham OR Leeds OR Bristol OR Manchester OR Newcastle

About our role: 

Are you a current academic OR working in industry with a passion for teaching, imparting knowledge, engendering new skills and behaviours, and keeping up-to-date in an ever-changing world? Do you want to deliver outstanding industry informed teaching on our fully blended and innovative BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships?

At QA we are passionate about the positive impact of degree apprenticeships as a means of enabling engagement with Higher Education for the wider social spectrum.  We are committed to developing innovative means of teaching that support the new modes of study required by modern students. 

You will be working within a growing team where we all work, support and learn from each other in order to provide our Learners with a dedicated, exceptional level of service that we are extremely proud to be part of.    

As Assistant Lecturer you will be expected to teach on modules in areas related to Data Science, but also bringing your wider expertise in related areas (e.g. Mathematics for Computing, Big Data, AI, Cloud Computing, Enterprise Architectures, etc.).

We recognise the value of having a range of skillsets within our academic team, so whether you are an industry professional with acknowledgeable skills in teaching and learning, or an academic with close ties to industry, this role could suit you.

About the programmes:

The BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships involve the delivery of a number of computing streams which incorporate Software Engineering, Computer Networking, Cyber Security, Big Data, Analytics and Maths, and broader areas of Computer Science.

Our programmes use a mixture of distance and face-to-face teaching and facilitation across the country using experiential and spiral methods to develop theories-in-action in a work-based learning approach that is both scholarly and professional.

Our use of skills coaches (who visit the learners in the workplace) and their liaison with you is designed to create a progressive and valuable experience for every student and their employer.

Our learners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and work for an equally wide variety of companies including some of the biggest technology companies in Europe.

Your focus: 

You will be expected to teach across a number of modules on our degree apprenticeship programmes and be able to accommodate learners integrating material from any module, into any role, in any sector.

As important is role-modelling your interest in inquiry and focussing into organisations to promote the professional development of our learners (their employees).  

We work as a geographically dispersed but close-knit team, sharing teaching experiences and new ideas. We challenge each other and work determinedly and efficiently, to reach ever improving teaching and learning standards and outcomes.

You will be required to teach and facilitate in face-to-face sessions across the breadth of QA sites as the teaching schedule requires.  This may require overnight stays.

Bring your experience: 

Please see the attached Job descriptions for Assistant Lecturer.

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250.

Microsoft Windows 10 Trainer

Learning

London

Read More

Microsoft Windows 10 Trainer

Are you currently an MS Windows Trainer/Coach who loves developing others, looking for a new challenge?

Or are you fed up with not getting the progression you have hard-work for?

Then read on…

Why apply?

If you’re an MS Windows Trainer/Skills Coach based in London, had enough of contracting or your permanent role is no longer challenging you. How about doing something different or working for one of the UK’s largest Education providers where you help others understand the world of Windows…then this role is perfect for you.

As a company, we have promoted a number of our Trainers/Skills Coaches into Manager positions across the business and actively encourage employees to share ideas/practices that could make our courses more effective.

What is the role?

With our support, you will deliver/coach using face to face, e-Learning or digital MS Windows courses and content to all appropriate areas within QA to likeminded people. Whether they are a highly qualified professional or a beginner looking to get into the world of MS Windows.  

Based in London, you will be delivering/coaching both public scheduled and bespoke courses for all appropriate areas of QA’s Portfolio.

How will we support you?

From day one you will be assigned a co-pilot/buddy to help get you up to speed with our processes and ensure you can help deliver our award-winning programmes.

Financial package and benefits 

We are offering a competitive base salary (dependant on experience), private pension as well as 25 days holiday. 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme.

Must haves:

  • Capability to train MOC Windows 7 and Windows 10 courses to IT professionals
  • Excellent customer facing, presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to share expertise with others
  • Ideally qualified as Microsoft Certified Trainer
  • Demonstrate sound business acumen, communication skills and intellectual curiosity
  • Patience and tolerance

Who are we?

As one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We like to help develop skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  With our HQ in London and 20 training centres nationwide, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) & ever-evolving skills solutions.

So interested? If so please apply today…

 

 

 

Training & Resourcing Co-ordinator (15 month FTC)

Learning

Slough

Read More

Training & Resourcing Co-ordinator (15 month FTC)

Training Planning and Resourcing Coordinator - Slough - (15 month FTC)

Your role

You will be providing support to our key client through effective planning, communication and resourcing. You will be responsible for the following:

  • Managing and updating trainers schedules
  • Developing excellent working relationships with trainers
  • Updating resource schedules
  • Resourcing various roles for clients and projects
  • On boarding and testing process for new trainers
  • Managing trainer purchase orders and queries
  • Building events on internal system
  • Maintaining and updating internal database records
  • Attending regular resourcing calls

Having previous experience in a similar role would be a bonus. However, those from a relevant background with a strong passion to get into this field will also be considered. This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise in a busy environment.

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive financial package, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

Ideally you will have experience in a scheduling/planning and customer services environment. 

You would need to have proven experience of multi tasking and be able to use your own inititave.

It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key. It is also vital that you are self-motivated with a high attention to detail.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Business Analyst ASSESSOR

Apprenticeships

London

Business Analyst ASSESSOR

IT Business Analyst Assessor / Coach

Fulltime & Permanent Role (Industry candidates very welcome to apply)  

About our role: Are you a current Business Analyst who enjoys coaching, and facilitating learning in the workplace? Or are you a current Business Analyst Assessor looking for a new opportunity to coach, mentor and guide our workplace experienced apprentices who are hungry to grow their skills to gain our L4 Qualification giving them career progression and further development. A rewarding role as you watch your learners grow.      

Your focus:  Having an average caseload of around 45, you will engage with our learners to complete planned assessments in various Business Analyst subjects (Requirements Engineering, Business Process Modelling, Systems Modelling etc.) as per the qualification standard. You will also have the skills to carry out some training of the above subjects to your active learners.

Your approach, organisation, proactivity and coaching skills will help retain learners and ensure each student achieves their assigned projects and qualification in line with the targets and objectives you have agreed in the Individual Learning Plan.

Bring your experience:

Experience working as a Business Analyst delivering IT change projects.

Recognised Business Analysis qualifications such as: BCS Diploma in Business Analysis or individual certificates such as Requirements Engineering, Business Process Modelling, Systems Modelling, Commercial Awareness, UAT etc.   

Excellent communication skills

A logical thinker and a passion to achieve

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.       

More about the Team you will be working with: Working with our delivery teams you will enhance the quality and development of our learners, providing a first class and exceptional level of service.    

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

Technical Teaching Assistant

Learning, Government & Defence

UK Wide

Read More

Technical Teaching Assistant

Technical Teaching Assistant – Paid Intern Opportunity – UK wide

QA are looking for a team of individuals who have a desire to help develop the next generation of cyber and technical minds. Working up and down the UK on five day events throughout the Easter and summer holidays, these events are designed excite and inspire students aged 13 - 17 into the world of Cyber Security and Technology. Throughout the week students will work on progressive labs in combination with talks from leading experts in the Cyber field.

You will:

  • Have a passion and broad range of technical skills
  • Travel to multiple locations up and down the UK
  • Have the right to work in the UK
  • Willing to undergo an enhanced Disclosure and Barring check (DBS)

 You must:

  • Have great communication skills
  • Be approachable and continually engaging
  • Be confident in speaking to large groups
  • Be able to demonstrate working to your own initiative

Desirable but not necessary:

  • HTML Skills
  • Windows Desktop and server knowledge
  • Networking and Network infrastructure
  • IoT

If you are passionate about Cyber and Technology and the above sounds like you, then please apply today…

 

Resourcer - Apprenticeships

Apprenticeships

Manchester

Read More

Resourcer - Apprenticeships

Are you an experienced Resourcer looking for a new challenge?

Do you have a passion for customer service and high-level administration/coordination?

If so, this could be the perfect opportunity for you...

What you will be doing?

This role will be dedicated to identifying and securing the best future talent for QA Apprenticeships’ larger corporate clients. With candidate experience and fit for the apprenticeship being your priority, you will provide the best possible resourcing service for our corporate clients. Working with various internal and external stakeholders, you will report into the Corporate Resourcing Team Leader.

What you need?

You will need to have a methodical approach and be able to prioritise your workload as it changes. You will be a great communicator who will be interacting with both internal and external stakeholders. You will have good problem solving skills and experience in working in a similar environment.

What you receive?

Competitive package  including bonus and company benefits, pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

You will get 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan, and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

About Us

Formed in 2009, QA Apprenticeships is the first IT apprenticeships business rated Ofsted Outstanding. We are an award-winning provider, offering IT, developer, digital marketing, project management and business apprenticeships throughout England and Scotland. Our apprentices work with industry leaders including Atos, British Gas, BskyB and Cisco. We have won the coveted Apprenticeship Programme of the Year award for three consecutive years at The Learning Awards 2012, 2013 & 2014, and we are the leading apprenticeship partner for Microsoft, Oracle, HPE, Cisco and Association of Project Management.

Client Delivery Manager

Apprenticeships

London

Read More

Client Delivery Manager

Apprenticeship Client Delivery Manager   

London (with travel)   

Do you have operational management experience within the apprenticeship sector ideally? Are you client focused and able to inspire and lead a remote team of assessors to deliver excellent coaching to our apprenticeship learners and ensure achievement rates are inline?  

About our role:  As Client Delivery Manager you will have the experience and leadership skills to develop the capability and capacity of a Major Programme delivery team, plan resourcing and effectively manage the teaching, coaching and mentoring function within work based learning of the clients allocated, to achieve agreed KPIs.

Your focus:  You will be client focused, liaising and building strong relationships and have the ability to own and implement the delivery quality improvement plan, including conducting observations, implementation of best practice process and ensuring conformity to external body standards. Your knowledge and experience will lead the delivery of all services related to Ofsted, including Safeguarding, Prevent and IAG not forgetting our own standards around policy and procedure to ensure business compliance and excellence. Ideally our role will suit an Apprenticeship Regional Delivery Manager OR Regional Manager where you have been leading a successful team of Assessors within Work Based Learning Programmes                          

Our Role - Operational management

As an experienced operational manager you will be comfortable being demanding but supportive and have experience in managing performance; both top end performers and where the team need to improve. You are comfortable managing a large operation and take challenges in bite-sized chunks.  We expect our teams to have really high professional standards.

Managing people Experience in managing geographically-spread teams is essential as a Client Delivery Manager, where your team are nationwide and facing the challenges this brings. 

Managing Change Our culture is one of regular change to maintain our competitive edge.  As our team grows and changes, you will be comfortable dealing with ambiguous situations, difficult choices and leading your team through change programmes that continuously improve our operation.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

More about the Team you will be working with: With a team of approximately 12 skills coaches (assessors) not all within London, you will remotely manage to deliver excellent and outstanding results for our learners and national client.   

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: season ticket loan, cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Salary range: In return we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Technical Quality Manager

Technical Quality Manager                                        

QA Apprenticeships  

Home Based, Fulltime and Permanent Role   

OUR Role:

As a Technical Quality Manager, you will lead the internal quality assurance activities (IQA) across all business areas in the UK. 

You will be supporting Technical standards including but not limited to Infrastructure Technician, Network Engineer, Software Developer, Software Development Technician, Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Cyber Security Technologist and Unified Communications Technician. You should have general technical expertise to fully understand the requirements of these standards and support the IQA team in their activities.

You will line manage IQAs within the QAA Quality and Compliance team, working closely with Heads of Delivery in improving and standardising teaching, learning and assessment practices.

YOUR experience:

Experience of effective people management within an IQA environment.

Proven record of working to at least Ofsted Grade 2 standards

Previous experience of Quality Management Systems

Internal Audit experience

Must have excellent administrative skills with the ability to prioritise workloads, work methodically, accurately and effectively under pressure while maintaining a positive attitude

Logical thinker who is willing to own and solve problems

D34/V1/TAQA Leading the IQA process essential

Recognised teaching qualification essential

Detailed knowledge of Apprenticeship programmes

Knowledge of awarding organisation and Ofsted requirements

Good knowledge of Government funded Apprenticeship programmes

Flexibility in travel and willingness to stay away from home on occasions

 

About Us:

QA Apprenticeships (part of the QA Group www.qa.com) - As one of the fastest growing divisions of QA, we are now the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services apprenticeships. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with an amazing ‘Outstanding’ in all areas.

In return, we are offering a competitive package with the opportunity to grow and develop your career further. Interested?

English Language Assessor

English Language ASSESSOR    

Birmingham 5 month FTC     

About our role:  Working within our QA Higher Education Business School you will have the skills, qualifications and experience to carry out English Language testing with our potential undergraduate and postgraduate students. The assessments will be carried out both face to face and online using Skype. You will also be involved with Test invigilation, proof reading and general administration i.e. typing, scanning, proofreading, filing and etc.

Your focus:  Ideally you will have either an English Language Examiner &/OR an English Language Teacher background and hold relevant qualifications as listed below. You will enjoy engaging with students, making the learners feel relaxed, ensuring their student journey is an enjoyable one no matter the assessment outcome. Our role is mainly Monday-Friday 9am-5.30pm with some evenings and up to 6 Saturdays per annum (Time off in Lieu given). With your excellent communication skills, you will be organised have good planning and delivery skills, be self-motivated, an excellent team player and an adaptable and confident manner.

Please note that some travel to our Manchester Campus will be required (expenses paid) 

Bring your experience:

Experience of English Language testing is highly preferred

Experience of teaching EL exam preparation courses, e.g. IELTS, PTE, Toefl, FCE, CAE and etc.

Experienced EFL/TESOL Teacher

Qualification in Teaching English as a Foreign Language or Teaching English to Speakers of Foreign Languages

Experience of developing testing and teaching materials

Extensive knowledge of CEFR and EFL levels

Ability to deliver English Language support classes

Understanding of English Language testing systems, e.g. IELTS, PTE, Toefl and etc., their levels and scores

Good word processing and Excel skills

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training. 

More about the Team you will be working with:  Working within our small team, you will enjoy being part of our wider campus, working with the buzz of students and academics around us. We are a growing team and business, so lots to keep us very busy with. Having an open and flexible approach is vital.

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!  

 

Deputy Programme Manager Digital & Technology Solutions

Apprenticeships

Manchester, Birmingham, Leeds, London

Read More

Deputy Programme Manager Digital & Technology Solutions

Deputy Programme Leader Digital and Technology Solutions Degree Apprenticeships

Flexible Location Birmingham, Leeds, London, Manchester,

About our role: Do you have a passion for teaching, imparting knowledge, engendering new skills and behaviours, and keeping up-to-date in an ever-changing world? Do you want to support the management and delivery of outstanding industry informed teaching on our fully blended and innovative BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships?

At QA we are passionate about the positive impact of degree apprenticeships as a means of enabling engagement with Higher Education for the wider social spectrum.  We are committed to developing innovative means of teaching that support the new modes of study required by modern students. 

You will be working within a growing and expanding team where we all work, support and learn from each other in order to provide our Learners with a dedicated, exceptional level of service that we are extremely proud to be part of.     

As the Deputy Programme Leader you will be expected to support the BSc and MSc Programme Leaders in the administration and management of the programmes, liaising with clients, students and our partner institutions to ensure academic standards are maintained and we continue to improve the student experience.

About the programmes:

The BSc (Hons) Digital & Technology Solutions and MSc Digital and Technology Specialist Degree Apprenticeships involve the delivery of a number of computing streams which incorporate Software Engineering, Computer Networking, Cyber Security, Big Data, Analytics and Maths, and broader areas of Computer Science.

Our programmes use a mixture of distance and face-to-face teaching and facilitation across the country using experiential and spiral methods to develop theories-in-action in a work-based learning approach that is both scholarly and professional.

Our use of skills coaches (who visit the learners in the workplace) and their liaison with you is designed to create a progressive and valuable experience for every student and their employer.

Our learners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and work for an equally wide variety of companies including some of the biggest technology companies in Europe.

Your focus: 

Supporting the day to day running of the degree apprenticeships programmes. 

As important is role-modelling your interest in inquiry and focussing into organisations to promote the professional development of our learners (their employees).  

We work as a geographically dispersed but close-knit team, sharing teaching experiences and new ideas. We challenge each other and work determinedly and efficiently, to reach ever improving teaching and learning standards and outcomes.

You will be required to attend University meetings and QA face-to-face sessions across the breadth of QA sites as the academic schedule requires.  This may require overnight stays.

Bring your experience: 

Please see the attached Job description.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you?

Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

Our benefits and values:

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. 

We look forward to hearing from you!  

 

Graduate Data Science Trainer

Learning

Site-Based, London, UK Wide

Read More

Graduate Data Science Trainer

Have you ever wanted a career in technology? Considered training other people? QA are looking for digitally curious individuals to join our Trainer team. QA will help you realise your potential and invest in you as part of a structured programme of learning and mentorship.

You will become a Data Science Trainer following an extensive 6 to 8 weeks programme in our Manchester based Training Academy.

You will have a background in mathematics and statistics and be interested in becoming a data scientist. In return, QA will outfit you with a set of technical, research and teaching skills in your new career.

You will have:

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills - be able to form a rapport quickly with people and make them feel comfortable; ability to break down complex scenarios into simpler chunks and explain them
  • A Bachelor’s Degree (ideally in a STEM-related subject)
  • Be geographically flexible – the role is London based with UK wide travelling
  • Enthusiasm for life-long learning - both for themselves and in others
  • Adaptive - be able to think on your feet when things go wrong or when removed from your comfort zone
  • Reflective - Be empirical in your practice and analyze how to improve your delivery/materials
  • Be numerate and literate to a high level

Key skills:

  • Substantive Experience in A Level Mathematics or Equivalent
  • Experience with one or more Programming Language – preferably Python or R
  • Substantive Experience with Relational Databases 

Nice to Have:

  • Professional use of Programming in Python, R, Scala
  • Professional Use of Neo4j, Hadoop
  • Substantive Experience in A Level Statistics or Equivalent

You will learn: 

  • Equivalent to Undergraduate Linear Algebra, Multivariate Calculus, Statistics,
  • Equivalent to Professional in Python, R, Scala
  • Equivalent to Professional in NoSQL Databases
  • Equivalent to Graduate-Level Data Science

Selection Process: following an initial telephone screening you will complete an aptitude test (online) and attend an assessment day.

If you were successful, you will join our Manchester based Training Academy for a 12 weeks subject based course. Following the successful completion of the course you will get additional training skills coaching and training that will take up to four weeks and could be based anywhere in the UK.

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some downtime, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 3 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Salary range:

In return, we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries please call Natalie Erukhimovich from the Recruitment team on 01753 898651.

We look forward to hearing from you!  

International Officers Pathway x4

London, Birmingham

International Officers Pathway x4

International Officer Pathway - Birmingham/London

About the Role

We are seeking 4 dynamic and motivated individuals to be part of our international student recruitment within the above regions. This is an opportunity to make an important contribution to a fast growing organisation with ambitious plans to become a leading provider of higher education pathways, both within the UK and internationally.

As an International Officer, you will be key in implementing our recruitment strategy to market our university partners and to support their brand positively and effectively, especially within the Pathway recruitment. You will be representing, networking and exhibiting overseas on a regular basis (up to 12 weeks of travel a year) in any of the above regions. Your main focus will be to recruit Foundation level students into all of our key partner Universities.

About Us

QA Higher Education provides a range of pathway programmes, ranging from Level 3 to Level 7 for a number of universities. The purpose built campuses provide state of the art facilities and our team of academic teaching and support staff have a real passion for all aspects of learning and development.

About The Person

Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of successfully operating in the HE sector.

Experience of working with and recruiting international students and developing overseas student recruitment channels would be an advantage.

Track record of success in sales or higher education environment.   

Excellent language skills in English a second Language will be a bonus.

Ability to build a strong understanding of the market place, and experience in international recruitment.

Goal orientated and motivated by a target based culture

Your Skills & Experience

  • Strong organisational and planning skills
  • Capable of building working relationships and networks with people from a range backgrounds and cultures
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong customer focus, committed to ensuring delivery of excellent service standards
  • Ability to work unsupervised for extended periods.

 

In return, we are offering a competitive package. If this role looks of interest to you please do not hesitate to apply!

IT Systems & Networking Skills Coach

Apprenticeships

London

Read More

IT Systems & Networking Skills Coach

IT Systems & Networking Skills Coach

Are you a Systems & Networking professional or graduate looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you want to use your knowledge and expertise to help others become Systems & Networking professionals?

Would you like to work for a training provider that offers you the chance to develop your own Systems & Networking skills by undertaking certification and education?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Skills Coach, you will be managing a caseload of up to 50 learners on our Systems & Networking Apprenticeship programme. Supporting learners through successful completion of their programme by providing guidance and help to them and their employers.

Within your role, you will maintain regular contact with your learners & employers to assist with the development of those individuals and ensure they receive the best learning outcomes and customer service.

Having previous experience in a similar role would be a bonus, but if you have not, don’t fret; as part of our commitment to you, we will be putting you through Coaching and Mentoring training so that you can become a fully qualified Skills Coach!

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise within Systems & Networking to support and encourage learners through their apprenticeship programme – all whilst working autonomously and managing your own time.

Your team & Development

You will be required to work closely with the Regional Delivery Manager and Head of Delivery. The position will require travel across multiple sites (depending on where your learners are based) so having your own transport is a must!

CPD Opportunities:

 With a very large portfolio of QA Technology courses, there will be opportunities to attend and get certified in courses from:

  • Microsoft – MCP, MCSA Certifications in Windows Client/Server
  • CompTIA Network+/Security+
  • Cisco CCENT/CCNA
  • Cloud certifications such as AWS/Azure/Google
  • Security specialisation and certifications

MSc Opportunities:

  • Cyber Security
  • Information Security Management
  • Professional Practice in Computing and IT

Financial package and benefits

We are offering up to £32,000 base salary per annum (DOE), £3,600 car allowance, private pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

You will need to hold a degree or higher education qualification in Computer Systems, Information Technology, Network/Networking, Computer Architecture, Computer Communication, Computer/Network Security, Computing in Networking, Computing and Internet Technologies or Business Information Technology. Have industry experience in the areas of Systems & Networking or IT Infrastructure, with sound technical knowledge. Certifications in CompTIA Network+, Cisco CCNA, Microsoft Certified Professional – Windows 10, Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2016 are desirable. It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. Holding an existing CAVA qualification would be ideal, however as mentioned, it is not essential.

About QA

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions - Learning, Apprenticeships, Consulting and Higher Education - all of which deliver innovative and cutting-edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Digital Marketing Skills Coach - London

Are you a Digital marketing professional or graduate looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you want an opportunity to for a company that truly promotes organic growth and development?

Do you want to work for a Top Track 250 company – one of the UK’s top performing private companies?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Skills coach within digital marketing, you will be managing a caseload of up to 50 learners on our Apprenticeship programme. You will be supporting learners through successful completion of their programme by providing guidance and support to them and their employers.

You will maintain regular contact with your learners and their employers to demonstrate formal progress and planning of progression for the learner.

Having previous experience in a similar role would be a bonus, but if you have not, don’t fret; as part of our commitment to you, we will be putting you through your CAVA and Coaching and Mentoring training – making you a fully qualified Skills Coach!

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise within digital marketing whilst helping and encouraging learners through their apprenticeship programme – all whilst working autonomously and managing your own time!

Your team

Based in London, you will be required to work closely with the Regional Delivery Manager and Head of Delivery. The position will require travel across multiple sites (depending on where your learners are based) so having your own transport is a must!

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive financial package + car allowance, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

You will need to hold a degree, higher education qualification or significant industry experience in the areas of Digital marketing. You would need to have technical experience of web design, social media, digital analytics and email marketing. It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. Holding an existing CAVA qualification would be ideal, however as mentioned, it is not essential.

About QA Apprenticeships

QA Apprenticeships - As the fastest growing division of QA, we are now the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services apprenticeships. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with an amazing 'Outstanding’ in all areas.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Business Development Executive QA Consulting x2

Consulting

Brighton
