Business Development Executive QA Consulting x2

Business Development Executive – QA Consulting

Are you a driven sales person, ready for a new challenge in a consultative new business role where you own your relationships and clients, building excellent long term relationships in a rewarding and technical sales environment.   

About our role?

As new business professional you will advise/consult across multiple divisions to offer large scale solutions using QAC’s very own Academy and experienced consultants.

You will be responsible for managing the end to end sales cycle, from lead generation, client meetings, proposal writing, commercial negotiation and onboarding of new business. This may also include defining go to market strategy for a new vertical market. Once the client has been on boarded and consultant’s deployed, you will manage the ongoing relationship, and grow the account accordingly. You will be measured against achievement of targets based on gross profit generated by billing consultants.

Team & Office

If that wasn’t enough, this brand new office has a pool table, table tennis and meetings rooms for you to conduct meetings with potential clients.

About us - QA Consulting?

As the fastest growing division of QA, (three times the size they were at the start of the year to be precise) QAC provides Consulting Services to a range of commercial, financial and Government organisations across the UK. With capabilities ranging from core programming to configuration, DevOps to Data, integration to implementation QAC support a wide range of customer business transformation initiatives.

Financial package and benefits 

We understand that as an experienced sales professional you are not easy to prise away from the success you have built, therefore we are offering a competitive salary + excellent commission, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

Sounds interesting? 

I look forward to hearing from you. 

Software Testing Trainer

Learning

Manchester, Birmingham, Leeds

Read More

Software Testing Trainer

Are you currently a Software Testing Professional who loves developing others, looking for a new challenge?

Or are you fed up of not getting the progression you have hard-work for?

Then read on…

Why apply?

If you’re an experienced Software testing professional, had enough of contracting or your permanent role is no longer challenging you. How about doing something different or working for one of the UK’s largest Education providers where you help others understand the world of Software testing…then this role is perfect for you.

What is the role?

With our support, you will deliver using face to face, e-Learning or digital Software testing courses and content to all appropriate areas within QA to likeminded people. Whether they are a highly qualified professional or a beginner looking to get into the world of Software testing.  

Based in Midlands or in the North, you will be delivering/coaching both public scheduled and bespoke courses for all appropriate areas of QA’s Skills Portfolio.

How will we support you?

From day one you will be assigned a co-pilot/buddy to help get you up to speed with our processes and ensure you can help deliver our award-winning BSD courses (including Testing & Agile).

Financial package and benefits 

We are offering a competitive salary (dependant on experience), private pension as well as 25 days holiday. 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Must haves:

  • In-depth expertise and industry experience of Testing, Agile and Test Automation
  • Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills - be able to form a rapport quickly with people and make them feel comfortable; ability to break down complex scenarios into simpler chunks and explain them

Nice to haves:

  • Ideally qualified as ISTQB and BCS Testing trainer
  • Experience in delivering training courses
  • Knowledge of ISTQB and BCS Systems testing certification schemes

Who are we?

As one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We like to help develop skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  With our HQ in London and 20 training centres nationwide, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) & ever-evolving skills solutions.

So interested? If so please apply today… 

EAP Tutor (Presessional English) x 3

Higher Education

London

Read More

EAP Tutor (Presessional English) x 3

Pre-Sessional EAP Lecturers (5 x Fulltime Fixed Term Contracts)

London  

About the role: Due to planned growth within our business, we are seeking to enhance our faculty with experienced English for Academic Purposes (EAP) lecturers delivering our pre-sessional programme. The Pre-Sessional English programme is taught in three blocks: a 15-week course; a 10-week course; or a 5-week course.

Roles vary from 13 – 21weeks, fulltime, fixed term contracts starting in either April, May OR June 

Your key responsibilities:  

  • To deliver up to 20 hours per week of Academic English language and study skills lessons.
  • To ensure all associated duties, including the preparation of classes, marking and timely feedback are performed to the required standard.
  • To deliver classes within the prescribed course syllabus and ensure that all aspects of the Pre-sessional English Language Programme course delivery, both teaching and teaching related, meet the stated aims and learning outcomes.
  • To provide regular progression reports for students studying on our EAP programmes.
  • To provide pastoral care and support to international students on our Pre-sessional English Language Programme.
  • To plan and manage own workload effectively whilst on the Pre-sessional English Language Programme
  • To assist in the organization, invigilation, marking and feedback for any course work or assignments as required.
  • To participate in the standardisation of assessments.
  • To ensure that all Pre-sessional English Language Programme course administration is completed accurately and in a timely manner.
  • To attend and contribute to any CPD training sessions organised internally or externally.

Please note: Tutors on the Pre-sessional English Language Programme must be available for the full duration of the course and course preparation period.

Experience and qualifications

  • Diploma in English Language Teaching to Adults (DELTA) or equivalent (i.e. MA in TEFL/ TESOL) - essential
    • Candidates with MA in TEFL/TESOL without TEFL I qualification (e.g. CELTA or Trinity TESOL) shortlisted for interview will be required to provide evidence of 5 hours of systematic observation of lessons by a fully-qualified academic manager or teacher trainer.
  • Degree or equivalent - essential
  • Experience of teaching English for Academic Purposes (EAP) in a university environment – essential
  • Experience of teaching on a Pre-sessional English Language Programme – essential
  • Experience of EAP course design and materials development – essential (Role A only)

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!

EAP Tutor (Presessional English - Solent University) x2

Pre-Sessional EAP Lecturers

Solent University

Southampton

About the role: Due to planned growth within our business, we are seeking to enhance our faculty with two experienced English for Academic Purposes (EAP) lecturers delivering our pre-sessional programme at Solent University in Southampton. The Pre-Sessional English programme is taught in three blocks: a 15-week course; a 10-week course; or a 5-week course.

Role A: Fixed-term from w/c 22nd April to w/c 9th September 2019 (this role includes a period allocated to course design and materials development, with teaching beginning on w/c 27th May 2019)

Role B: Fixed-term from w/c 24th June to w/c 9th September 2019 (teaching begins on w/c 1st July 2019)

Your key responsibilities:  

  • To deliver up to 20 hours per week of Academic English language and study skills lessons.
  • To ensure all associated duties, including the preparation of classes, marking and timely feedback are performed to the required standard.
  • To deliver classes within the prescribed course syllabus and ensure that all aspects of the Pre-sessional English Language Programme course delivery, both teaching and teaching related, meet the stated aims and learning outcomes.
  • To provide regular progression reports for students studying on our EAP programmes.
  • To provide pastoral care and support to international students on our Pre-sessional English Language Programme.
  • To plan and manage own workload effectively whilst on the Pre-sessional English Language Programme
  • To assist in the organization, invigilation, marking and feedback for any course work or assignments as required.
  • To participate in the standardisation of assessments.
  • To ensure that all Pre-sessional English Language Programme course administration is completed accurately and in a timely manner.
  • To attend and contribute to any CPD training sessions organised internally or externally.

Please note: Tutors on the Pre-sessional English Language Programme must be available for the full duration of the course and course preparation period.

Experience and qualifications

  • Diploma in English Language Teaching to Adults (DELTA) or equivalent (i.e. MA in TEFL/ TESOL) - essential
    • Candidates with MA in TEFL/TESOL without TEFL I qualification (e.g. CELTA or Trinity TESOL) shortlisted for interview will be required to provide evidence of 5 hours of systematic observation of lessons by a fully-qualified academic manager or teacher trainer.
  • Degree or equivalent - essential
  • Experience of teaching English for Academic Purposes (EAP) in a university environment – essential
  • Experience of teaching on a Pre-sessional English Language Programme – essential
  • Experience of EAP course design and materials development – essential (Role A only)

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Digital Marketing Skills Coach - Reading, Slough

Digital Marketing Skills Coach – Reading, Slough

Are you a Digital marketing professional or graduate looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you want an opportunity to work for a company that truly promotes organic growth and development?

Do you want to work for a Top Track 250 company – one of the UK’s top performing private companies?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Skills coach within digital marketing, you will be managing a caseload of up to 50 learners on our Apprenticeship programme. You will be supporting learners through successful completion of their programme by providing guidance and support to them and their employers.

You will maintain regular contact with your learners and their employers to demonstrate formal progress and planning of progression for the learner.

Having previous experience in a similar role would be a bonus, but if you have not, don’t fret; as part of our commitment to you, we will be putting you through your CAVA and Coaching and Mentoring training – making you a fully qualified Skills Coach!

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise within digital marketing whilst helping and encouraging learners through their apprenticeship programme – all whilst working autonomously and managing your own time!

Your team

Based in Reading or in Slough, you will be required to work closely with the Regional Delivery Manager and Head of Delivery. The position will require travel across multiple sites (depending on where your learners are based) so having your own transport is a must!

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive financial package + car allowance, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

You will need to hold a degree, higher education qualification or significant industry experience in the areas of Digital marketing. You would need to have technical experience of web design, social media, digital analytics and email marketing. It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. Holding an existing CAVA qualification would be ideal, however as mentioned, it is not essential.

About QA Apprenticeships

QA Apprenticeships - As the fastest growing division of QA, we are now the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services apprenticeships. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with an amazing 'Outstanding’ in all areas.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

 

Admissions and Assessments Officer

Higher Education

London

Read More

Admissions and Assessments Officer

QA Higher Education offers a range of courses through our partnership with various universities across the country. We offer globally recognised, fully accredited British degrees at Bachelor’s and Master’s levels, as well as a range of other courses and qualifications and over 90% of graduates are in employment or pursuing further studies within six months of graduating. This is one of the highest employment / further study rates in the UK.

You will work as a member of the Admissions Team taking responsibility for:

  • Processing applications of within a defined entry criteria
  • Assessing all applications and recommending the next steps required
  • Achieving a positive applicant experience
  • Ensuring all applications are processed within the agreed KPI’s and to the highest standard
  • Taking ownership and responsibility for processes and outcomes

As the Admission Officer, you will:

  • Review incoming applications, validate applicants’ academic records and/or professional experience
  • Ensure admissions procedures are in place and maintained in accordance with the QA and partner Universities' guidelines and procedures and in compliance with partner Universities’ Accreditation and UKVI regulations
  • Conduct admissions interviews where required
  • Ensure the CRM system is consistently updated and information is detailed and accurate and that appropriate student data is recorded and maintained in compliance with partner Universities’ accrediting bodies and UKVI regulations.
  • Provide clarifications to student’s queries in a professional manner.
  • Work closely with enrolment team to ensure required documentation is received in order to process applications within set deadlines.
  • Communicate admissions decisions to applicants
  • Provide statistical data on incoming students to the leadership team
  • Manage, monitor and ensure accurate and up to date audit trails for all CAS applications
  • Develop and maintain up to date knowledge of all programmes available
  • Keep up to date with UKVI Tier 4 policy

As the Admission Officer, you will have:

  • Education to Degree Level
  • Ability to speak a foreign language would be an advantage
  • Proven track record of successfully operating in the education sector in a similar role
  • Experience of working with International Students
  • Experience of working in a customer-focused environment
  • Understanding of the application process and higher education admission

Sounds interesting? Please apply with your CV, we look forward to talking to you.

Conversion Officer CIS & Central Asia

Conversion Officer - CIS & Central Asia

Are you looking for a career where building relationships and good customer service are key?

Would you enjoy a role where you are engaging with students worldwide?

Do you want to work for an Education Provider which helps thousands of students all over the world to study and learn in the UK?

If so, this could be the ideal career opportunity for you!

What is the role?

As a Conversion Officer for CIS & Central Asia, you will proactively engage with students and promote QA Higher Education and our range of degree programmes.

Using your sales and customer relationship skills, your role is vital in helping prospective students with choosing the right course, assisting them throughout the application process and ultimately ensuring they enrol on their chosen course.

You will also be working with warm leads received online, at events or walk-ins at one of our campuses. Converting inbound leads from marketing activity and reporting sales data, whilst managing and monitoring student application pipeline within established.

Conversing with existing and prospective applicants via multiple communication channels and assisting through the entire application cycle

Your skills and experience

You do not need to have previous education experience, although this is desirable, we are looking for a positive and driven personality with the desire to learn and succeed.

What do we offer you?

  • Competitive financial package
  • In-depth coaching and mentoring
  • 25 days holiday
  • 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice
  • 3 days of additional training relevant to your role and responsibilities

 

What skills/experience is required?

  • Educated to a degree level - we welcome any discipline
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong customer focus with proven problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to co-operate at all levels of the organisation and work with tight deadlines

 Desirable:

  • Fluent in Russian
  • SEO or marketing or recruitment experience

Who are QA Higher Education?

QA Higher Education is a private UK Higher Education provider, currently partnering with universities, colleges and education specialists across the UK to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate level.

Administrator

Learning

Swindon

Read More

Administrator

Join the QA Team in Swindon as a Partner Solutions Coordinator

What is the role?

To provide high quality, administration and logistical support within the Partner Solutions team. The primary function of the Partner Solutions Coordinator is to be a first point of contact for our customer first stage queries, dealing with those queries and escalating where necessary.

  • Obtain and provide quotes for various training needs in accordance with client specific rates and standard QA rates
  • Research, respond and advise on queries for suppliers courses
  • Establish and manage relationships with all suppliers and ensure that the relevant systems are kept up to date
  • Confirm bookings on booking system (including raising and issuing Purchase orders) and process via agreed timescales
  • Confirm with suppliers bookings received
  • Ensure Suppliers are aware of QA standard payment terms and work with our Finance team to ensure that courses requiring prepayment are managed effectively
  • Work with sales team to confirm bookings in a timely manner
  • Follow up with suppliers for delegate joining instructions
  • Process all cancellations and transfers
  • Logistical arrangements for onsite training (co-ordinating between booker and supplier)
  • Escalate matters where appropriate but aim to develop sufficient awareness of QA and the client in order to work

What we offer?

No one wants to work for free so here’s what we give you:

A highly competitive base salary dependent on experience, pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

We offer 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan, and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

What do we do?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Must haves (We do need the following):

  • High standard of numeracy and literacy
  • Ability to work alone or part of a team
  • Methodical and accurate approach to tasks
  • Customer focused
  • Good communication skills written, face to face and written
  • Ability to multi - task and prioritise workload

If you’ve read the above, feel we are the company for you. Then apply to us today. Speak soon…

Compliance Administrator

Compliance Officer – Based in Slough -

Do you have good attention to detail?

Do you have previous administration experience?

Well this could be the ideal role for you

What is the role?

Working in the compliance team, you will be responsible for the below

  • Review learner paperwork and ensuring it is compliant using our internal validation check lists
  • Accurately record any issues and communicate these to our internal customers for correction
  • Input data onto our internal system to ensure our learner records are accurately recorded
  • Managing your own time to achieve and exceed daily targets
  • Work as part of a team to achieve team targets which will support the business goal of processing all learner paperwork within our internal SLAs
  • Liaise with our internal customers to offer excellent customer service
  • Use the internal training provided to build a strong knowledge base that you can share with colleagues and internal customers
  • Report issues and themes to your line manager to help improve the feedback we give to our internal customers
  • Contribute to improving internal processes and protocols through monthly one2ones and ad hoc team meetings
  • Support with ad hoc administration requirements including data cleanse; file creation; archiving; etc.

What YOU get?

We are offering a competitive base salary (dependant on experience), Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

You will receive specific industry training which will help you to build a strong understanding of the FE Sector, specifically Apprenticeships and the eligibility requirements that are required.

What YOU need?

You need to be driven and self-motivated. You must be able to accurately follow clear instructions and have excellent communication skills both verbally and orally. Good organisation and attention to detail is a must. If you feel like you have all these qualities then make sure you apply today!!

About QA

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting-edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Recruitment Advisor

Passionate about helping others launch successful careers? Are you caring and customer-oriented, committed to making a real difference by supporting learners and keen to join a growing team in a role with OTE earning potential?

What is the role?

We’re looking for an Advisor, based in our Slough office, to help manage our pool of candidates and get them placed into exciting, career-changing apprenticeship programmes. Reporting into the Engagement Manager, you’ll be the first point of contact for candidates and parents and will provide support with engagement, events, marketing efforts, administration and data reporting as our strategies and processes constantly streamline and evolve.

You will play a key role in engaging potential apprenticeship learners, screening the candidate, informing them about QA as a business and getting them apprenticeship ready! You will work closely with the Engagement Manager to deliver a smooth pre-apprenticeship process and deliver a great level of customer service. You will be the first point of contact an apprentice will have with the business, so your role is essential in the candidate experience!

This is an ideal position for someone with previous experience in early recruitment or an HR role, and would suit someone looking to re-launch their career after a break.

EAP Lecturer, Evenings and Saturdays (London)

Higher Education

London

Read More

EAP Lecturer, Evenings and Saturdays (London)

EAP Lecturer - Undergraduate and Postgraduate Programmes

London £50 per hour, Zero Hour Contract

Evenings and weekend teaching hours available         

About our role: Due to planned growth and subsequent increased student admissions, QA Higher Education is looking for qualified, experienced and enthusiastic a EAP Lecturer on a zero hour contract basis for our London  campus. Our Focus is on delivery of high quality learning and teaching to facilitate excellent student outcomes.

Your focus:  

To plan, prepare and deliver EAP and Skills modules;

To mark and provide appropriate feedback on oral and written work;

To attend and contribute to CPD training sessions organised internally or externally; 

To provide academic support to students on EAP and Skills modules;

To adhere to and maintain academic standards and quality assurance within the EAP team;

To provide pastoral care and support to international students on our EAP programmes;

To contribute to the wider business through sharing of best practice with the wider academic community and supporting or driving business development opportunities.

Bring your experience:

You should have suitable and relative teaching experience and should hold a ELT qualification or higher degree in a relevant subject area. A teaching qualification and membership of the HEA would be advantageous.

Diploma in English Language Teaching to Adults (DELTA) or equivalent (i.e. MA in TEFL/ TESOL)

Candidates with MA in TEFL/TESOL without TEFL I qualification (e.g. CELTA or Trinity TESOL) shortlisted for interview will be required to provide evidence of 5 hours of systematic observation of lessons by a fully-qualified academic manager or teacher trainer;

Degree or equivalent; Experience of teaching English for Academic Purposes (EAP) in a university environment;

Maths and Business/Computing knowledge/teaching desirable.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training. 

More about the Team you will be working with:

The EAP team currently works across four current university partners (Roehampton, Ulster, Northumbria and Middlesex) and teaches academic writing and study skills programmes to all levels, from Foundation level 3 to Masters Level 7. The team is involved in a variety of programmes from standard pre-sessional to a rage of in-sessional courses, both assessed and unassessed. The team from all current locations (London, Birmingham and Manchester) takes an active part in an internal and external CPD programme. It works closely with the rest of the academic team, establishing the most effective student support mechanisms, and adapts the content of academic writing and study skills programmes to the relevant module/course content.

Our Company: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team.

Perhaps the most significant difference visible on campus is that traditional universities tend to be quite empty (of academic staff) as lecturers spend much less time in the office. There is a friendly and supportive atmosphere here at QAHE with typically far more team-working, promoted in part by more regular staff attendance on campus and in the staff offices.

Some potential candidates will find this, and the emphasis on teaching rather than research, very attractive. Academic staff in traditional universities of all ranks are placed under significant demand for research outputs and so have to balance a teaching load and the associated administration with their research obligations. To some this feels like an impossible burden (particularly when expectations around consultancy are added).

 

Rate of Pay: £50 inclusive of holiday pay  

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!  

 

  

 

Agile trainer Flexible working considered - T/B

Glasgow, London

Read More

Agile trainer Flexible working considered - T/B

Agile trainer – Flexible working considered

Teaching learners hireable skills to transform their lives and careers. Top-notch, in-demand Agile course content. Flexibility, fulfilment and a great salary. Sound appealing? Then we’ve got the role for you.

We’re seeking Agile trainers based in London, Glasgow, Leeds and Birmingham who love helping others learn and accomplish their goals. This is an exciting, fulfilling role helping learners to grow their skills and achieve their potential.

This could be a perfect career if you are a current Agile trainer or an Agile pro working in HR, project management, software development, software testing, business analysis or service delivery management and looking to upskill. We’ll provide thorough delivery training to get you ready to share your expertise with others.

About the role

At QA, we know that real life doesn’t happen in a textbook, so we deliver our courses in a modern, hands-on format. With our support, you’ll deliver exciting Agile course content face-to-face in the classroom and through e-Learning or digital formats. You’ll teach both scheduled public and customised Agile courses from QA’s famous tech course portfolio.

This role is about teaching and supporting learners to help them succeed – whether they’re qualified professionals looking to take their skills to the next level or beginners making the leap into tech careers.

You are…

  • Experienced in Agile in one or more of these environments: human resources, project management, software development, software testing, business analysis or service delivery management (mandatory)
  • Experienced in training or tutoring with an interest in career development (delivery training provided if needed)
  • Passionate about supporting/teaching others and sharing your expertise
  • Confident in customer-facing roles with strong presentation, interpersonal and communication skills
  • Eligible to live and work in the UK and able to travel to different locations (?)
  • Able to plan and deliver against set learning and achievement targets

What we offer

  • Generous base salary (dependent on experience)
  • Private pension
  • 25 days holiday
  • Two days paid charity work for a charity of your choice
  • Three days of paid training from your choice of 1,200+ diverse QA courses
  • Subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme

Who are we?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We help develop skills and capabilities for everyone, from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London with 20 more training centres nationwide, QA Group comprises four fast-growing divisions – QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education – all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) and ever-evolving skills solutions.

 

 

New Business Development Manager

Apprenticeships

Bristol

Read More

New Business Development Manager

The Role?

Recruiters, Account Managers, BD Managers, Sales Executives... we want YOU! If you're based IN BRISTOL and are looking for the next step in your career PLEASE RESPOND TODAY.

Based in the Bristol office, you will play a key role in the whole sales cycle for apprentices, from bringing on new clients, building lasting relationships and account managing, to sourcing and placing apprentices within the workplace, you will play a crucial role within the team.

Using a consultative sales approach (which we will train you on), you will contact UK business leaders about taking on apprentices, something which is a valuable sell into a company adding benefits to both employers and candidates alike. You will be helping an apprentice get into the workplace and better their future prospects, whilst giving the client an individual who they can develop, mould and grow into their business.

You will have your own individual target which you will be rewarded against. You will be targeted on hitting/over-achieving monthly margin targets, increasing the number of buying customers in the account base, and continuously improving NPI (customer service) ratings.

The ideal candidate will have entrepreneurial spirit and determination, confidence and a proven track record in account management.

Financial Package and Benefits?

We understand that as an experienced sales professional you are not easy to prise away from the success you have built, therefore we are offering a competitive opportunity including a competitive commission package. Other benefits include Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

If you are interested in moving your career forward, please click apply

Finance Business Partner

Consulting

Brighton, London

Read More

Finance Business Partner

Finance Business Partner - London/Brighton

Are you a finance professional looking for an exciting new challenge?

Frustrated in your current role and keen to show your true worth?

If you have answered yes, then read on to find out more…

Your role

We have an exciting opportunity to join QA as a Finance Business Partner. This role offers the person a chance to develop and grow within a  thriving company. 

As an Finance Business Partner you will be responsible for the reporting, analysis and forecasting processes.

There will be a special focus on the forecasting element, as this role would suit somebody with experience of 'forward thinking' financial planning.

You will be working closely with the COO to ensure that all reports are completed in a timely and accurate manner.

This role will give the successful applicant the opportunity to truly influence the finance cycle, with continual improvements and new processes being actively encouraged. This role will also involve travel, with time split between our London and Brighton offices.

Your background

You will have a finance background with strong Excel modelling skills. Proven numeracy skills are also essential.

This role would best suit somebody who has had previous experience in a similiar role. Ideally you would be used to working to deadlines and be used to working with Senior/Director level members of business. 

It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key. It is also vital that you are self-motivated with a high attention to detail.

Your team

Based in our London or Brighton office, you will be required to work closely with various business managers, as well as with the rest of the finance team. You will also be reporting directly into the Chief Operating Officer. 

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive financial package, Private Pension as well as 25 days’ holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme. 

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Infrastructure Technician / Network Engineer Skills Coach

Apprenticeships

Reading, Slough

Read More

Infrastructure Technician / Network Engineer Skills Coach

Are you a Systems & Networking professional or graduate looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you want to use your knowledge and expertise to help others become Systems & Networking professionals?

Would you like to work for a training provider that offers you the chance to develop your own Systems & Networking skills by undertaking certification and education?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Skills Coach, you will be managing a caseload of up to 50 learners on our Systems & Networking Apprenticeship programme. Supporting learners through successful completion of their programme by providing guidance and help to them and their employers.

Within your role, you will maintain regular contact with your learners & employers to assist with the development of those individuals and ensure they receive the best learning outcomes and customer service.

Having previous experience in a similar role would be a bonus, but if you have not, don’t fret; as part of our commitment to you, we will be putting you through Coaching and Mentoring training so that you can become a fully qualified Skills Coach!

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise within Systems & Networking to support and encourage learners through their apprenticeship programme – all whilst working autonomously and managing your own time.

Your team & Development

You will be required to work closely with the Regional Delivery Manager and Head of Delivery. The position will require travel across multiple sites (depending on where your learners are based) so having your own transport is a must!

CPD Opportunities:

 With a very large portfolio of QA Technology courses, there will be opportunities to attend and get certified in courses from:

  • Microsoft – MCP, MCSA Certifications in Windows Client/Server
  • CompTIA Network+/Security+
  • Cisco CCENT/CCNA
  • Cloud certifications such as AWS/Azure/Google
  • Security specialisation and certifications

MSc Opportunities:

  • Cyber Security
  • Information Security Management
  • Professional Practice in Computing and IT

Financial package and benefits

We are offering up to £32,000 base salary per annum (DOE), £3,600 car allowance, private pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

You will need to hold a degree or higher education qualification in Computer Systems, Information Technology, Network/Networking, Computer Architecture, Computer Communication, Computer/Network Security, Computing in Networking, Computing and Internet Technologies or Business Information Technology. Have industry experience in the areas of Systems & Networking or IT Infrastructure, with sound technical knowledge. Certifications in CompTIA Network+, Cisco CCNA, Microsoft Certified Professional – Windows 10, Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2016 are desirable. It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. Holding an existing CAVA qualification would be ideal, however as mentioned, it is not essential.

About QA

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders.  Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions - Learning, Apprenticeships, Consulting and Higher Education - all of which deliver innovative and cutting-edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Software Development Tutor - Manchester

Teaching learners in-demand skills to transform their lives and careers. Top-notch, trending tech apprenticeship programmes. Flexibility, fulfilment and a great salary. Sound appealing? Then we’ve got the role for you.

We’re seeking tech skills trainers based in Manchester who love helping others learn and accomplish their goals. This is an exciting, fulfilling role helping learners to grow their skills and achieve their potential.

About the role

At QA, we know that real life doesn’t happen in a textbook, so we run our apprenticeships in a modern, blended format – in the classroom, online and in the workplace.

With our support, you’ll deliver this tech apprenticeship course content face-to-face in the classroom and through e-Learning or digital formats. You’ll teach both scheduled public and customised courses for relevant areas of QA’s tech portfolio: IT, cybersecurity or web/software development.

This role is about teaching and supporting learners to help them succeed—whether they’re qualified professionals looking to upskill, or beginners (including new grads) making the leap into tech careers.

You are…

  • Experienced in training or tutoring with an interest in career development
  • Knowledgeable about or interested in tech areas (and willing to learn)
  • Passionate about supporting/teaching others and sharing your expertise
  • Confident in customer-facing roles with strong presentation, interpersonal and communication skills
  • Eligible to live and work in the UK and able to travel to different locations
  • Able to plan and deliver against set learning and achievement targets

What we offer

  • Generous base salary (dependent on experience)
  • Private pension
  • 25 days holiday
  • Two days paid charity work for a charity of your choice
  • Three days of paid training from your choice of 1,200+ diverse QA courses
  • Subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme

Who are we?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We help develop skills and capabilities for everyone, from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London with 20 more training centres nationwide, QA Group comprises four fast-growing divisions – QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education – all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) and ever-evolving skills solutions.

Courseware Graphic Design Team Lead

Graphic Design and Courseware Team Lead

Slough

Are you a current Graph Designer OR Instructional Designer looking for a new challenge, leading a small team within a fast past, challenging and fun environment?     

About our role: As a training company we constantly update and change our Courseware Manuals to ensure our delegates receive high quality, error free, eye catching (both online and offline) training material. Leading a team of three, you will have the ability to ensure the creation, design and production of all courseware is delivered in a timely, well formatted style to the QA branded guidelines. Often the documents are technical and complex, the turnover time tight with a high volume of workload. Whilst the day is busy, having an enjoyable workplace with a company you can grow and develop with is important to us.

Experience of using Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, illustrator, PowerPoint, MS office suite essential          

Your Day to Day:

Lead and direct a busy team of three

Complete production of allocated manuals and pre-course reading work within timescales.

Ensure the team are producing high quality, error free, ready to print course manuals from supplied, technically verified content in line with branding and style guidelines

To interact with the content provider on issues and enquiries arising from files or data supplied

To provide staff with electronic copies of course files or data as requested

To handle enquiries relating to the status of allocated workload

To provide creative design as and when required

To maintain publishing schedule of allocated workload using Excel

Check technical content through plagiarism tool

To support the team with general day to day queries 

Bring your experience:

Experience of creating, designing and producing high quality documents

Experience of graphic design

Expert in Word [including macros]

Intermediate in PowerPoint/Excel

Expert in InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator

Proofreading

Scrupulous approach to detailed work

Familiarity with the production process for books and documents

Proven track record in document design

Strong written language skills

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

Our benefits and values: Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

We know it’s important to recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- Learning, Apprenticeships, Consulting and Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call Michaela on 01753 898671

We look forward to hearing from you!  

Lecturer in Marketing (inc. Metrics/Analysis, Digital and Luxury Brand)

Higher Education

London

Read More

Lecturer in Marketing (inc. Metrics/Analysis, Digital and Luxury Brand)

Lecturer/Senior Lecturer in Marketing (Metrics & Analysis / Digital / Luxury Brand)

London, Fulltime & Permanent Opportunity (Sessional opportunities also considered)

Vacancy open until successfully recruited, no closing date set.

About the role: We are looking for a Lecturer/Senior Lecturer in Marketing who can teach the following modules:

  • Marketing Metrics and Analysis
  • Digital Campaign Management and Media
  • Luxury Brand Value
  • Luxury Brand Industry Project

 As an experienced lecturer you will to have the ability to:  

  • Plan, prepare, teach/deliver modules and support student’s learning on a range of programmes in the subjects above and some other related subject/topic areas
  • Provide guidance, support and tutorship for student groups and individuals as appropriate
  • Meet partnership and internal quality assurance processes in relation to programmes
  • Develop and grow relationships with partnership organisations
  • Carry out academic administration duties as required
  • Maintain personal and professional development in line with agreed appraisal and development programme in order to enhance personal knowledge and contribution to relevant activities. 

Bring your experience:

Doctorate or close to completion (to meet AACSB standards) - essential

Master’s degree or equivalent – essential

HE Lecturer experience in Marketing – essential

HEA Fellowship or PGCE– desirable

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations. Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they are interested in.

QAHE benefits and values:

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time with 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

To give peace of mind, we provide Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Working at QAHE:

At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team. Perhaps the most significant difference visible on campus is that traditional universities tend to be quite empty (of academic staff) as lecturers spend much less time in the office. There is a friendly and supportive atmosphere here at QAHE with typically far more team-working, promoted in part by more regular staff attendance on campus and in the staff offices. Some potential candidates will find this, and the emphasis on teaching rather than research, very attractive. Academic staff in traditional universities of all ranks are placed under significant demand for research outputs and so have to balance a teaching load and the associated administration with their research obligations. To some this feels like an impossible burden (particularly when expectations around consultancy are added) and QAHE are keen to ensure a far more balanced workload approach across the team.

Closing Date: Opportunity open until successfully recruited, no closing date set.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

 

Account Manager x3

Learning, Government & Defence

Cheltenham

Account Manager x3

A truly exciting opportunity based in Cheltenham.

 

You will be part of a successful, highly driven and professional learning organisation. Based on site within one of QA’s largest managed learning services customers, you will perform a high quality business development role where you will maintain and develop relationships by building on the existing relationships and by exposing new business opportunities. You will be focused on a key customer for QA and in addition to supporting with their learning requirements you will also have a strong emphasis on relationship building, customer service and revenue generation.

Key Responsibilites

• Creating sustainable business relationships
• Identifying business opportunities and provide accurate forecasting of sales pipeline
• Preparing high quality quotes and proposals for customers
• Proactive follow up on new business opportunities with client’s with a consultative and informative approach
• Effective Customer service management
• Maintaining all relevant management information systems
• Prospecting for new customers and stakeholders
• Proactively seeks ways to engage with clients such as informal catch ups, polling interest on new products, attending exhibitions and seminars
• Proactively promotes the QA service and products within the client using forums such as in-house social media tools
• Support Marketing activity as required such as attendance at exhibitions, manning stands, creating product information handouts.
• Offer guidance to the QA Account management team on dealing with customer queries, where required.
• Ensures delivery of excellent customer service through fast and accurate processing of requirements, communication and coordinating with other departments to resolve enquiries.
• Maintains excellent knowledge of QA learning products and provides professional advice on suitable training courses to meet delegate requirements.
• Supports Learning Consultants with attending client meetings, preparing quotes and advising clients on larger scale projects.
• Proactively seek opportunity to advise customers in a face to face environment and maintaining excellent relationships.
• Providing support to the Customer Engagement Manager
• Research, Liaise and negotiate with key third party providers

Skills & Abilities

 • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Outlook)
• An entrepreneurial spirit and determination
• Confidence and a strong sense of direction
• Excellent communication skills and telephone manner
• The ability to operate well and contribute to a strong team environment
• Strong understanding of sales processes
• Methodical and accurate with a proven ability to focus on detail
• Highly Self-motivated with initiative and drive.
• Proven organisational & planning skills.
• Clear and effective communication and negotiation skills are a must.
• Uses initiative in identifying and resolving complex problems and assignments.
• Determines when problems should be escalated to a senior member of the team
• Able to act promptly to make relevant parties aware of issues
• Displays a flare for seeking out new opportunities to improve the service and increase revenues/margins

Benefits

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, and we try to ensure that everyone has the opportunity to take advantage of our huge and varied range of learning and development options, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.
We also know that many people like to “give back” and so we offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose.  And if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250.  This is over and above the charitable activities that we encourage through our annual QA fundraising drives – you can get involved with this as much or as little as you like.  We see it as a great way to foster team building too.
We all need to take time out to recharge our batteries from time to time and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.
It’s important, too, to plan for the future and ensure we are able to maintain the lifestyle we have worked so hard to achieve, once we retire from the hurly burly and slow down to enjoy our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 5% of your basic salary.
Then there are two of our core benefit offerings, not the most exciting, but we consider it important to ensure everyone has the peace of mind provided by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.
And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices:
• Season ticket loan
• Discounted gym membership
• Cycle to work scheme
 
An attracticve salary and bonus is on offer for this very exciting role
 
QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.
At QA, we are proud to help people and businesses transform their performance through learning; we offer a complete range of business and IT training. With training centres throughout the UK, QA delivers an exceptionally broad training curriculum to meet the needs of individuals and corporate businesses. Our award-winning teams of learning professionals are amongst the best in the world, each with extensive experience and a proven track record of delivering the skills that transform performance and ensure lasting benefits.

Learning Technologist

Apprenticeships

Bristol, London, Swindon

Read More

Learning Technologist

About our role: As a Learning Technologist you will be working directly with the Product Managers, Instructional Designers and Subject Matter Experts as part of our Learning Design team. You will proactively improve the online learning experience as part of the Apprenticeships Business Unit transformation to a digital-first blended learning delivery model. This will include the management of our VLE (Canvas) and e-portfolio platform, together with digital production capabilities.

The new digital learning programmes will be innovative and designed around the learner experience, ultimately measured by delivering better outcomes for learners and employers. You will design solutions around the specific needs of Apprenticeships, including End Point Assessment and a mastery-model for learning.  

 

Your focus: Ideally you will have a strong technical background within Education, giving you the knowledge and understanding of how the technology connects with what we want to do: making learning more effective.  Your background might be from a TEL (Technology Enhanced Learning) or a similar role within a Learning OR Education provider.                   

 

Bring your experience:

  • Excellent skills in relevant educational and digital technologies, including, for example:
    - Administration skills in a modern VLE
    - Administration skills for e-portfolio tools
    - HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript in order to improve UI and navigation
    - Content authoring tools, such as Articulate or Evolve/Adapt
    - Adobe Creative Suite or equivalent
    - Camtasia or other screen capture technology
    - Integrations and technical standards, such as TinCan API, LTI and APIs in general
  • Proven track record of supporting learning and teaching using technology, ideally in a professional or work-based education environment.
  • Experience working with VLEs and e-portfolios, with evidence of improving outcomes and learner satisfaction.
  • Experience of working in a transformation project, delivering change to the learning and teaching approach
  • Experience of implementing new systems from scratch, including strong supplier relationships.

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally, you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well-received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

 

More about the Team you will be working with: Working within a geographically spread team of eight either in London, Bristol or Swindon. The team works virtually and uses collaboration tools extensively, but there will be some travel to other QA offices for critical meetings each month.

 

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

 

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some downtime, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Discounted gym membership, Cycle to work scheme

Salary range:

In return, we offer a competitive remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential.

Direct Sales Executive - UK International & South Asia

Direct Sales Executive - UK International and South Asia

London

Are you an experienced sales professional who is looking for a new challenge?

Do you want to work for an Education Provider which helps thousands of students all over the world to study and learn in the UK?

Do you want to be truly rewarded for your dedication and hard work?

If so, this could be the ideal career opportunity for you!

What is the role?

As a Direct Sales Executive, you will work within the UK International and South Asia Recruitment team to support marketing strategies for the International Recruitment activities.

Using your sales experience, you will provide a first class customer service to both students and parents to ensure you build relationships, whilst offering our varied range of university partner degrees

You will be focused on targeting candidates across UK International and South Asia, working from an extensive database of leads.

You will be given extensive records to work from and manage the full sales cycle from initial candidate call, through to their enrolment and start onto one of our Higher Education degrees within our education partner sites.

Experience required?

This would be an ideal position for a highly driven and self-motivated individual who thrives in an outbound calling environment. You will need to be able to take complete ownership of your desk and manage the full B2C sales process.

A proven track record and experience in outbound new business, telesales, business development or similar is essential.

Financial Package and Benefits?

We are offering a competitive base salary and a competitive commission package. Other benefits include Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme.

Who are QA Higher Education?

QA Higher Education is a private UK Higher Education provider, currently partnering with universities, colleges and education specialists across the UK to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate level.

Conversion Officer - UK International and South Asia

Conversion Officer - UK International and South Asia

Are you looking for a career where building relationships and good customer service are key?

Would you enjoy a role where you are engaging with students worldwide?

Do you want to work for an Education Provider which helps thousands of students all over the world to study and learn in the UK?

If so, this could be the ideal career opportunity for you!

What is the role?

As a Conversion Officer for UK International and South Asia, you will proactively engage with students and promote QA Higher Education and our range of degree programmes.

Using your sales and customer relationship skills, your role is vital in helping prospective students with choosing the right course, assisting them throughout the application process and ultimately ensuring they enrol on their chosen course.

You will also be working with warm leads received online, at events or walk-ins at one of our campuses. Converting inbound leads from marketing activity and reporting sales data, whilst managing and monitoring student application pipeline within established.

Conversing with existing and prospective applicants via multiple communication channels and assisting through the entire application cycle

Your skills and experience

You do not need to have previous education experience, although this is desirable, we are looking for a positive and driven personality with the desire to learn and succeed.

What do we offer you?

  • Competitive financial package
  • In-depth coaching and mentoring
  • 25 days holiday
  • 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice
  • 3 days of additional training relevant to your role and responsibilities

What skills/experience is required?

  • Educated to a degree level - we welcome any discipline
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Strong customer focus with proven problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to co-operate at all levels of the organisation and work with tight deadlines

Desirable:

  • SEO or marketing or recruitment experience

Who are QA Higher Education?

QA Higher Education is a private UK Higher Education provider, currently partnering with universities, colleges and education specialists across the UK to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate level.
