International Assistant - UK International & South Asia, Africa & Latin America

International Assistant x2 - UK International and South Asia, Africa & Latin America

Are you looking for a career where you can apply your administrative skills to good use?

Would you enjoy a role where you are engaging with different stakeholders worldwide?

Do you want to work for an Education Provider which helps thousands of students all over the world to study and learn in the UK?

If so, this could be the ideal career opportunity for you!

What is the role?

As an International Assistant for UK International and South Asia, you will work as part of the sales team pre-assessing applications at the initial stage of the admissions process to ensure they meet QA Higher Education’s quality standards.

Using your administrative and customer relationship skills, your role is vital in liaising with our agents and prospective students in preparing a good application, with choosing the right course, assisting them throughout the application process.

You will also be assisting the international teams to ensure applications can go to offer stage quickly enough to speed up the sales process and work with the team to meet their student recruitment targets.

Conversing with existing and prospective applicants via multiple communication channels and assisting through the entire application cycle

Your skills and experience

You will be required to have previous education experience, we are looking for a positive and driven personality with the desire to learn and succeed.

What do we offer you?

  • Competitive financial package
  • In-depth coaching and mentoring
  • 25 days holiday
  • 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice
  • 3 days of additional training relevant to your role and responsibilities

What skills/experience is required?

  • Educated to a degree level - we welcome any discipline
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Proficient in Using Microsoft Office tools
  • Strong customer focus with proven problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to co-operate at all levels of the organisation and work with tight deadlines

Desirable:

  • Previously worked in an Education background

Who are QA Higher Education?

QA Higher Education is a private UK Higher Education provider, currently partnering with universities, colleges and education specialists across the UK to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate level.

Click the link to apply and start your career with QA now!

Digital Marketing Tutor/Assessor

Apprenticeships

Glasgow

Read More

Digital Marketing Tutor/Assessor

Digital Marketing Tutor / Assessor: Glasgow

Are you a Digital marketing professional or graduate looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you want an opportunity to work for a company that truly promotes organic growth and development?

Do you want to work for a Top Track 250 company – one of the UK’s top performing private companies?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Tutor / Assessor within Digital Marketing, you will be managing a caseload of learners on our Apprenticeship programme and teaching in classroom around two weeks per month. You will be supporting learners through successful completion of their programme by providing guidance and support to them and their employers.

You will maintain regular contact with your learners and their employers to demonstrate formal progress and planning of progression for the learner.

Having previous experience in a similar role would be a bonus, but if you have not, don’t fret; as part of our commitment to you, we will be putting you through your CAVA and Coaching and Mentoring training – making you a fully qualified Skills Coach!

This is a unique and exciting opportunity to truly use your knowledge and expertise within digital marketing whilst helping and encouraging learners through their apprenticeship programme – all whilst working autonomously and managing your own time!

Your team

Based in either Glasgow or Edinburgh areas, you will be required to work closely with the Regional Delivery Manager and Head of Delivery. The position will require travel across multiple sites (depending on where your learners are based) so having your own transport is a must!

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive financial package + car allowance, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

You will need to hold a degree, higher education qualification or significant industry experience in the areas of Digital marketing. You would need to have technical experience of web design, social media, analytics and email marketing. It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. Holding an existing CAVA qualification would be ideal, however as mentioned, it is not essential.

About QA Apprenticeships

QA Apprenticeships - As the fastest growing division of QA, we are now the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services apprenticeships. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with an amazing 'Outstanding’ in all areas.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Lecturer in Computer Science & Head Of Year

Higher Education

Manchester

Read More

Lecturer in Computer Science & Head Of Year

Lecturer in Computing & Head of Year – Permanent, FT

Manchester

About our role: As an Experienced HE Lecturer you will contribute to the progression and academic achievement of students studying the BSc Computing Technologies programme. The programme involves a wide range of technical skills across OOP, Mobile App Development, Big Data, AWS, SQL etc. It is not expected that you will be able to contribute to every module in the programme, but you will be expected to have a good breadth of skills and knowledge.

You will also be expected to contribute to widening participation activities and will play an important part in helping our Manchester campus to grow.

To be successful, you will need to be flexible and highly organised. You will also be used to working on your own initiative, without close supervision.

For the right candidate there will be opportunities for future progression in our expanding multi-campus environment.

Your focus: Experience of teaching and curriculum management in more than one of the topics listed below

Recognised IT qualifications OR substantial professional experience covering more than one of the topics listed below

Relevant postgraduate qualifications and/or professional certifications and/or membership of professional body at an appropriate level (e.g. MBCS, CITP, etc.)

PhD - desirable

HEA membership – desirable  

Lecturing experience in the HE sector and/or experience of corporate technical training

Modules include:

Web Development (using HTML 5, CSS, Java Script and PhP, SQL and MySQL)

Maths and Algorithms

Object Oriented Programming

Systems Analysis and Design

Data Modelling and SQL Language

Data Communication and Network Routing

Mobile App Design and Development (using Android Studio)

User Experience Design

Network Design and Troubleshooting

Cloud Computing

Big Data Analytics (using Apache spark using Scala)

Web Application Security (using PhP)

Cyber Security

Data Science

Designing and Developing Products for the Internet of Everything (IoE)

QA Higher Education (QAHE) works in partnership with five different UK Universities offering a range of fully accredited UK higher education programmes from foundation level through to postgraduate degrees across modern, professional campuses in London, Birmingham and Manchester.

The BSc Computing Technologies is well placed to help meet the growing demand for technology-related employment. The degree is designed to provide graduates with a broad range of competencies and skills that are relevant to the current and future job markets.  The degree will equip students with an understanding of core programming and digital technologies, together with giving them an understanding of, and an ability to apply, systems design principles and project management skills.  The degree also equips students with a strong platform in network and cyber security, together with developing skills in cloud computing, web and mobile technologies, big data analytics and user experience design.

More information about the course can be found at https://www.roehampton.ac.uk/qa/computing-technologies/

How to apply and who to contact: Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!  

Internship and Employer Engagement Manager

Higher Education

London

Read More

Internship and Employer Engagement Manager

Internship and Employer Engagement Manager  

London - QA Higher Education

Do you have a recruitment OR student placement OR business development background? Would you like to make a difference and help our undergraduate and postgraduate students gain industry experience through our internship programme?  

About the role: As Internship and Employer Engagement Manager, you will have the networking skills to develop new and existing relationships with employers and businesses to enhance our student experience by promoting QAHE and its students; you will attract meaningful employer activity on campus and also support students to obtain internships. Working with our Head of Careers, you will develop an employer engagement strategy; responsible for all aspects of employer engagement and for managing the Internship and Placement Service that supports students who undertake internships as part of their studies and also those wishing to boost their employability and gain industry-related work experience. Our role will involve attending events, client meetings, calling potential employers alongside working with the academic faculty  

Day to day:  

Develop and strengthen links with existing and new employers to attract their participation with activities on campus such as talks and workshops and to act as internship hosts in order to increase the number of opportunities available

Undertake research, market analysis and networking opportunities to identify and target potential employers to participate with

Match suitable students for particular internships by shortlisting CVs, preparing students for interviews, making offers and ensuring university regulations are met where necessary (the post holder will work in conjunction with the central Careers Services to provide employability activity)

Work with the campus Employability Officer to oversee all administrative and student-facing activity of the Internship and Placement Service

Represent the Internship and Placement Service at institution validations, academic meetings and ensure and monitor the quality of internship programmes with reference to QAA, ASET and other relevant codes of practice and apply best practice across internship programmes;

Work closely with faculty to ensure internships meet any academic requirements

Bring your experience:

As this role involves considerable lead generation and client management, the successful candidate will have excellent networking and relationship building skills, ideally with experience within higher education and/or recruitment; ideally candidates will have experience in working with businesses and/or students across a range of industries and programme disciplines, from computing/IT to luxury brands.

Your Learning & Development with QA: how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations. Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they are interested in.

QAHE benefits and values:  We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time with 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan.

To give peace of mind, we provide Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Working at QAHE: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team.

How to apply and who to contact: Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Conversion Officer - South East Asia

Higher Education

London

Read More

Conversion Officer - South East Asia

Conversion Officer – London

What YOU will do?

The role will be primarily working with warm leads; enquiries received online, at events, or walk-ins in at one of our campuses. Using your sales and customer relationship skills, your role is vital in helping students pick the right course, assisting them through the application process and ultimately ensuring they successfully enrol on their chosen course.

  • To support International Assistant, International Officer (s) and Regional Manager in exceeding sales targets
  • Maintain and manage effective business pipeline ensuring daily KPI’s are delivered effectively
  • To provide first class customer service to our students, agents/representative and partners
  • Use honest and truthful promotion and advertising when recruiting for QA Higher Education and its partner institutions
  • Engage with offer holders through multiple communication channels; actively guide applicants through the entire application cycle; consult students on how to meet outstanding conditions, i.e. interviews, outstanding docs, English tests
  • Maintain accurate and up to date data on Management of Students Administration (MOSA)
  • Run and maintain weekly/monthly Management Information pipeline reports
  • Advising on payment methods (by card, BACS, on campus or loan letters) chasing and taking outstanding payments; responding to student’s concerns and understanding competition from other institutions
  • Looking after Confirmation of Acceptance to Study (CAS) requests, chasing documents outstanding in a timely manner, arranging visa appointments
  • Checking compliance of bank statements, loan letters and other financial evidences for visa application purposes
  • Provide individual guidance to students on credibility interviews and visa applications via Skype, telephone and email correspondence
  • Conduct credibility interviews ensuring student is adequately able to answer common questions asked by Entry Clearance Officer (ECO).

What YOU get?

A competitive base salary, pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

We offer 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan, discounted gym membership and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

What YOU need?

You need to be driven and self-motivated. Excellent communication skills both verbally and orally are required. You must have experience in a sales role. Good organisation and attention to detail is a must. A degree is a must. If you feel like you have all these qualities then make sure you apply today!!

About QA Higher Education

QA Higher Education is a private UK Higher Education provider, currently partnering with universities, colleges and education specialists across the UK to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate level.

Teaching and Learning Manager

Apprenticeships

Swindon, London, Home-Based

Read More

Teaching and Learning Manager

Teaching & Learning Manager

Are you a looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you have a passion for teaching and offering solutions on how to improve?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a Teaching & Learning Manager, you will standardise and lead the quality of teaching and learning throughout the QA Apprenticeships division.

You will maintain regular contact with our tutors and skills coaches to ensure that there is a consistent standard across all of our teaching areas, as well as working with them to actively identify opportunities to improve the standard of teaching and learning for our learners.

Your team

You will be required to work closely with the Heads of Delivery for all regions across the UK, proactively working together to ensure that standards are maintained. You will also work closely with leaders from other teams such as  sales, delivery and compliance to ensure that learners successfully complete their full apprenticeship by their planned date. 

The position will involve travel across multiple sites so having your own transport is a must!

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive basic salary, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

Ideally, you will have significant industry experience in a training environment. Direct apprenticeship training experience is also preferred but not essential. 

You would need to have experience of working in a management position or a degree/masters degree in a relevant subject.

It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a coaching/mentoring environment. 

About QA Apprenticeships

QA Apprenticeships - As the fastest growing division of QA, we are now the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services apprenticeships. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with an amazing 'Outstanding’ in all areas.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Account Manager

Apprenticeships

Glasgow

Read More

Account Manager

The Role?

Recruiters, Account Managers, BD Managers, Sales Executives... we want YOU! If you're based IN GLASGOW and are looking for the next step in your career PLEASE RESPOND TODAY.

Based in the Glasgow office, you will play a key role in the whole sales cycle for apprentices, from bringing on new clients, building lasting relationships and account managing, to sourcing and placing apprentices within the workplace, you will play a crucial role within the team.

Using a consultative sales approach (which we will train you on), you will contact UK business leaders about taking on apprentices, something which is a valuable sell into a company adding benefits to both employers and candidates alike. You will be helping an apprentice get into the workplace and better their future prospects, whilst giving the client an individual who they can develop, mould and grow into their business.

You will have your own individual target which you will be rewarded against. You will be targeted on hitting/over-achieving monthly margin targets, increasing the number of buying customers in the account base, and continuously improving NPI (customer service) ratings.

The ideal candidate will have entrepreneurial spirit and determination, confidence and a proven track record in account management.

Financial Package and Benefits?

We understand that as an experienced sales professional you are not easy to prise away from the success you have built, therefore we are offering a competitive opportunity including a competitive commission package. Other benefits include Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

If you are interested in moving your career forward, please click apply

Careers and Employability Officer x2

Higher Education

London

Read More

Careers and Employability Officer x2

Careers & Employability Officer    

London - QA Higher Education

Are you a highly organised administrator working within an educational careers service OR working within graduate recruitment? Do you fancy a new challenge in a fast paced, evolving Higher Education Business School where you can make a difference to our undergraduate and postgraduate students - helping them shape their future career?   

About the role:  As our Careers & Employability Officer you will be the first point of contact for our student enquiries to the Careers Service signposting students to suitable information resources and to ensure that the Service and employability activities are resourced effectively.  You will also be responsible for developing links between external organisations and QAHE, in order to promote and support the Careers Service, Advance Practice Internship Programme and the planning and delivery of alumni activities.

Day to day:  

Act as an initial point of contact and provide first line support for all enquiries to the Careers Service - whether in person, by telephone or email - from students, alumni, employers and faculty

Help students to access and make the best use of careers resources, using effective listening and questioning skills in order to accurately diagnose each student’s need

Analyse and interpret student data, producing monthly reports for the Head of Careers

Where appropriate, encourage students to attend specific workshops or a 1:1 appointment with a Careers Advisor based on their careers/employability requirement, managing the booking system to ensure workshops and appointments are resourced effectively

Actively develop knowledge of current careers and employability information and contribute to the updating and production of printed and online resources, under the guidance of the Head of Careers and Employability

Participate in and deliver student activities the Service offers such as workshops and induction events that are relevant to the scope of this role and the promotion of the Service to the student population and faculty members

Develop links with external employers and extend the numbers of employers who have active relationships with QAHE in order to support and develop work related opportunities for students

Publicise and promote the opportunities available to students and staff in relation to employers and employability inc voluntary, work experience, graduate jobs etc.

Work alongside the Internship and Placement Manager to support the provision of internships by undertaking student-facing tasks and other research activities to develop the internship offering

Bring your experience:

Candidates will be highly organised with strong administration skills and ideally have experience of working in a higher education setting in a Careers and Employability Service or within graduate recruitment.

Your Learning & Development with QA: how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations. Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they are interested in.

QAHE benefits and values:  We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time with 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan.

To give peace of mind, we provide Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Working at QAHE: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team.

How to apply and who to contact: Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Events and Marketing Executive - FTC

Learning

Slough

Read More

Events and Marketing Executive - FTC

Events and Marketing Executive - 12 month FTC

Slough

Are you looking for an opportunity where you can plan, organise and deliver market leading events?

Do you want to have a real input on the direction of future events, really helping to drive our sales teams success in the process?

If so, then this is the role for you…

What is the role?

You will be responsible for the planning, organization and delivery of our brand awareness events. 

You will work closely with the internal sales stakeholders to execute effective events to maximise the generation of new prospects and relationship opportunities for our sales team. You will also be supporting digital marketing activities including social media and email.

This role is all about the quality you produce, so it’s crucial you understand your target audience and the best methods to gauge their interest.

The team and support

Joining an established team, there will be a great support structure from the people around you, who have a wealth of knowledge to tap into.

You will be reporting directly into the Marketing Manager.

Socially you can look forward to regular team events, celebratory lunches, as well as a chance to meet and work closely alongside senior members of the business.

Financial package and benefits 

We are offering a competitive base salary, private pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

What skills/experience are we looking for?

  • Qualified marketing professional – degree not essential
  • Must know or have the following marketing experience within events:
    • Experience running lead generation events where you have measured effectiveness (good or bad)
    • Worked within a sales marketing environment – B2B preferable
    • Digital Marketing experience preferred but not essential
  • An innovative and creative thinker, who is able to drive engaging lead generation events. 

Who are we?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

If you have read the above and feel this is the right role for you, then please apply by clicking on the link.

IT Data Analyst Tutor London x3

Apprenticeships

London

Read More

IT Data Analyst Tutor London x3

IT Data Analyst Trainer / Tutor (Industry experienced candidates welcome to apply)

London   

About our role: Are you a current Data Analyst who enjoys training, coaching, and facilitating learning in the workplace? Or are you a current Data Analyst Trainer looking for a new opportunity to share your knowledge and experience with our workplace experienced apprentices who are hungry to grow their skills to gain our L4 Qualification giving them career progression and further development. A rewarding role as you watch your learners grow.      

Your focus: FULL TRAINING GIVEN ON THE DELIVERY OF HOW TO BE A SUCCESSFUL TUTOR/TRAINER GIVEN.  The role will involve a blend of teaching, practical exercises, supporting self-study activities and classroom delivery. The programme involves a wide range of skills across Data Analysis. It is expected that the Tutor would be able to deliver majority of the classroom sessions as aligned with the Diploma in Data Analysis. The programme involves a wide range of technical skills across Data Analysis and analytics, data structures, Big Data and processes and tools for data integration. It is not expected that one tutor can deliver the full breadth of the content As a result, the role will require close working with the Service Delivery Team and other tutors to ensure smooth handovers between sessions, consistent approaches to assessment and a shared understanding of apprentice progress

Bring your experience:

Experience of working with Visualising data in a variety of tools such as Excel, Tableau and PowerBI

Experience of working in a Data Analysis environment

Experience of at-least one programming language. Languages such as Python and R will be advantageous

Experience of working with data including data reporting.

Experience of databases and writing software using SQL, preferably in a corporate environment

Recognised IT qualifications covering the skill sets listed above

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.           

More about the Team you will be working with: Working with our delivery teams you will enhance the quality and development of our learners, providing a first class and exceptional level of service.    

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Discounted gym membership, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Competitive financial package + company benefits

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!  

Account Manager, Government Services

Learning

London

Read More

Account Manager, Government Services

A truly exciting opportunity based in London.

You will be part of a successful, highly driven and professional learning organisation. Based in London working within Government services, you will perform a high quality business development role where you will maintain and develop relationships by building on the existing relationships and by exposing new business opportunities. You will be focused on a key customer for QA and in addition to supporting with their learning requirements you will also have a strong emphasis on relationship building, customer service and revenue generation.

Key Responsibilites

• Creating sustainable business relationships
• Identifying business opportunities and provide accurate forecasting of sales pipeline
• Preparing high quality quotes and proposals for customers
• Proactive follow up on new business opportunities with client’s with a consultative and informative approach
• Effective Customer service management
• Maintaining all relevant management information systems
• Prospecting for new customers and stakeholders
• Proactively seeks ways to engage with clients such as informal catch ups, polling interest on new products, attending exhibitions and seminars
• Proactively promotes the QA service and products within the client using forums such as in-house social media tools
• Support Marketing activity as required such as attendance at exhibitions, manning stands, creating product information handouts.
•• Ensures delivery of excellent customer service through fast and accurate processing of requirements, communication and coordinating with other departments to resolve enquiries.
• Maintains excellent knowledge of QA learning products and provides professional advice on suitable training courses to meet delegate requirements.
• Proactively seek opportunity to advise customers in a face to face environment and maintaining excellent relationships.
• Providing support to the Client Director


• Skills & Abilities

  An entrepreneurial spirit and determination
• Confidence and a strong sense of direction
• Excellent communication skills and telephone manner
• The ability to operate well and contribute to a strong team environment
• Strong understanding of sales processes
• Methodical and accurate with a proven ability to focus on detail
• Highly Self-motivated with initiative and drive.
• Proven organisational & planning skills.
• Clear and effective communication and negotiation skills are a must.
• Uses initiative in identifying and resolving complex problems and assignments.
• Experience in working in Government services a real advantage
• Able to act promptly to make relevant parties aware of issues
• Displays a flare for seeking out new opportunities to improve the service and increase revenues/margins

 

Benefits

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, and we try to ensure that everyone has the opportunity to take advantage of our huge and varied range of learning and development options, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.
We also know that many people like to “give back” and so we offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose.  And if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250.  This is over and above the charitable activities that we encourage through our annual QA fundraising drives – you can get involved with this as much or as little as you like.  We see it as a great way to foster team building too.
We all need to take time out to recharge our batteries from time to time and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.
It’s important, too, to plan for the future and ensure we are able to maintain the lifestyle we have worked so hard to achieve, once we retire from the hurly burly and slow down to enjoy our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 5% of your basic salary.
Then there are two of our core benefit offerings, not the most exciting, but we consider it important to ensure everyone has the peace of mind provided by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.
And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices:
• Season ticket loan
• Discounted gym membership
• Cycle to work scheme
 
An attracticve salary and bonus is on offer for this very exciting role
 
QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.
At QA, we are proud to help people and businesses transform their performance through learning; we offer a complete range of business and IT training. With training centres throughout the UK, QA delivers an exceptionally broad training curriculum to meet the needs of individuals and corporate businesses. Our award-winning teams of learning professionals are amongst the best in the world, each with extensive experience and a proven track record of delivering the skills that transform performance and ensure lasting benefits.

Associate Dean (NUL) / Head of Department

Higher Education

London

Read More

Associate Dean (NUL) / Head of Department

Associate Dean and Head of Department (NUL)

London   

About our role: As Associate Dean and Head of Department your prime role is to provide strong academic leadership. The role requires that as Associate Dean, the role holder will have significant responsibility and accountability for the management of the academic partnership with our partner university. This includes working closely with the Dean of Faculty, maintaining a constructive and positive relationship with the university, building strong external communication lines, resolving academic related issues that may arise in conjunction with the partner and ensuring adherence to the regulations and procedures of the relevant partner university along with QAHE faculty and boards. As head of a department, you will lead, manage and develop a department of staff to ensure it achieves the highest possible standards of excellence in all its activities, supported by the Dean of Faculty, and by colleagues from within the department, faculty, and central services.

Your focus:  You will be able to demonstrate excellent student outcomes, retention and achievement and have the ability to set best practice.

Bring your experience:

  •  Doctorate (or close to completion) as role includes teaching on AACSB approved Northumbria University programmes for which this requirement is essential
  • Postgraduate qualification, preferably in subjects to be taught, is essential
  • Expertise in subject area in one or more of the following areas Business and Management / Finance / IT is essential
  • Successful record of leadership and programme management in at least one of the academic areas within the Faculty is essential
  • Experience of effective people management including the management of diverse groups of professional staff is essential
  • Experience of improving and developing learning and teaching practice is essential
  • Successful track record of developing and sustaining a high quality student experience is essential
  • Successful track record of improving and sustaining student outcomes is essential
  • Track record of programme development and validation is desirable
  • Relevant teaching qualification, HEA fellowship or significant teaching experience with a commitment to achieving the required Professional Standards for teaching is essential
  • Experience of working as a member of a senior team in a large and complex organisation is desirable
  • Experience of managing strategic planning issues in HE is desirable
  • Experience of building close relationships with key internal and external parties, particularly with university partners is desirable

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations. Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they are interested in.

QAHE benefits and values:

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time with 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 4% of your basic salary.

To give peace of mind, we provide Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Working at QAHE: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team. Perhaps the most significant difference visible on campus is that traditional universities tend to be quite empty (of academic staff) as lecturers spend much less time in the office. There is a friendly and supportive atmosphere here at QAHE with typically far more team-working, promoted in part by more regular staff attendance on campus and in the staff offices. Some potential candidates will find this, and the emphasis on teaching rather than research, very attractive. Academic staff in traditional universities of all ranks are placed under significant demand for research outputs and so have to balance a teaching load and the associated administration with their research obligations. To some this feels like a burden (particularly when expectations around consultancy are added) and QAHE are keen to ensure a far more balanced workload approach across the team.

Closing Date: No closing date set, open until role filled

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link (where you will find the full role profile), please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly.

 

We look forward to hearing from you! 

Programme Administrator - Degree Apprenticeships

Apprenticeships

London

Read More

Programme Administrator - Degree Apprenticeships

We are looking to recruit a Programme Administrator to support our Degree Apprenticeships Team in delivering our advanced Apprenticeship Programme.

You will be based in our office in London (Tower Hill, 2 minutes’ walk from the tube station). This new role is full-time, permanent and has plenty of growth potential.

As the Programme Administrator, you will:

  • Provide effective and efficient administrative support to all degree programmes
  • Manage registrations and student queries via email and phone
  • Support the scheduling booking system
  • Take responsibility the University registrations and Examination Board preparation
  • Support Moderation processes at the end of each term
  • Support student allocations

As the Programme Administrator, you will have:

  • Extensive administrative experience within the education sector
  • Experience of multi-tasking and delivery to agreed timescale
  • Experience of managing and prioritising complex workloads
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Excellent organisational, problem-solving and planning skills
  • Excellent literacy and numerical skills
  • Flexibility and adaptability to change

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive base salary, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

What do we do?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting-edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Sounds interesting? Please apply with your CV, we look forward to talking to you.

Customer Service Administrator

Focus on training

Peterborough

Read More

Customer Service Administrator

Customer Service Administrator – Based in Peterborough

What is the role?

To process customer’s orders and handle customer queries both via telephone and email. To carry out schedule updates on Focus website and liaise with suppliers. To invoice customer orders and solve any customer or supplier queries.

  • Provide advice and assistance to customers
  • Manage invoicing process and payment
  • Liaise with customers in regards to their orders and record details of enquiries, comments and complaints within the CRM system
  • Take payments by credit card over the phone
  • Process bookings with all Training Providers including setting up bookings on providers systems where necessary
  • Liaise with suppliers for schedule updates and process orders and maintain excellent relationships with them
  • Liaise with wider company accounting teams
  • Support the Sales Executive(s) in the achievement of monthly sales targets
  • Assist in the arrangement of in-house courses
  • Assist in maintaining accurate and complete course data on company website including editing products descriptions
  • Adhere to all Company policies, including, but not limited to Health and Safety policy, IT User policy and Anti–Bribery policy.
  • Any additional tasks that you are assigned by your line manager or a senior member of staff

Financial package and benefits

A competitive base salary (dependent on experience), pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

We offer 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan,  and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

Skills & Experience Required

  • Highly organised and reliable
  • Positive personality
  • Driven to succeed
  • Ability to prioritise and work independently as well as under pressure
  • Good IT skills, especially MS Excel and Word
  • Accurate accounting ability essential
  • Strong English written and verbal skills will be an advantage
  • Ability to learn a new area and systems quickly
  • Previous experience working in a small and successful office serving customer bookings will be an advantage

About US

FOCUS is part of QA Ltd. Focus on Training is a leading provider of training courses and best practice skills development in the UK and internationally.

Computing Skills Tutor (Academic Community of Excellence Team)

Higher Education

London

Read More

Computing Skills Tutor (Academic Community of Excellence Team)

Computing Skills Tutor (Academic Community of Excellence Team)

London

About our role: Due to planned growth within our HE Business School, we are seeking to enhance our faculty with experienced Computing Tutors within our Academic Community of Excellence Team (ACE) for our undergraduate and potentially post-graduate students.

Your focus:  

Plan, prepare, teach/deliver computing skills support sessions for small groups and on a one-to-one basis to guide student’s learning on a range of programmes and related computing areas

Develop and deliver computing-related workshops

Guide students in computer labs to demonstrate the working of software programmes

Support students in running computer network simulators

Support students in using MS Office tools, such as word, ppt, excel, etc.

Support students with problem-solving/algorithm design

Create and develop learner (self-study) materials to enhance student understanding and success

Provide pastoral care and support (as a Personal Tutor)

Provide and deliver a student-centred approach

Provide guidance, support and tutorship for student groups and individuals as appropriate.

Maintain personal and professional development in line with agreed appraisal and development programme in order to enhance personal knowledge and contribution to relevant activities. 

Bring your experience:

MSc Computer Science or related degree in computing and software engineering

  • Practical Knowledge of programming languages (at least two or more of the following programming languages: Java, C++, Visual Basic, HTML5, CSS, Java script, PHP, SQL, Mobile Development using Android studio);
  • Knowledge of computer networks and network security (use of simulators, for example, GNS3, Wireshark, Packet tracer);
  • Knowledge of algorithm design and pseudo code;
  • Lab-demonstrator experience would be preferred
  • HEA status or demonstrate teaching experience with a commitment to achieving the required Professional Standards for teaching.
  • Flexibility and willingness to work under pressure and excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.          

More about the Team you will be working with:  The ACE team supports learners with their academic writing, presentation and study skills.  With the new team member on board who specialises in computing, the team aims to expand and provide computing skills support. The current team are TEFL Q professionals who, under the guidance of Head of ACE, work closely with both academic and support teams, establishing the most effective ways of providing student support mechanisms. The ACE team works with learners across four current locations (London Rosebery Avenue and Middlesex Street, Birmingham and Manchester) and four current university partners (Roehampton, Ulster, Northumbria and Middlesex).

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: At QAHE you will be surrounded by staff who love teaching and prioritise the student experience. We specialise in teaching as our main focus and ensuring a good experience for the learner is the number one priority for the team.

Perhaps the most significant difference visible on campus is that traditional universities tend to be quite empty (of academic staff) as lecturers spend much less time in the office. There is a friendly and supportive atmosphere here at QAHE with typically far more team-working, promoted in part by more regular staff attendance on campus and in the staff offices.

Some potential candidates will find this, and the emphasis on teaching rather than research, very attractive. Academic staff in traditional universities of all ranks are placed under significant demand for research outputs and so have to balance a teaching load and the associated administration with their research obligations. To some this feels like an impossible burden (particularly when expectations around consultancy are added).

The management hierarchy at QAHE (year heads, deputy course managers and so on) creates opportunities for course management and career progression at QAHE and these types of responsibilities are genuinely devolved in a way that is typically uncommon in other HEIs.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the link below, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898675.

We look forward to hearing from you!  

 

IT Business Analyst Trainer

Apprenticeships

London

Read More

IT Business Analyst Trainer

IT Business Analyst Trainer / Tutor

Fulltime & Permanent Role - Flexible working will also be considered    

About our role: Are you a current Business Analyst who enjoys training, coaching, and facilitating learning in the workplace? Or are you a current Business Analyst Trainer looking for a new opportunity to share your knowledge and experience with our workplace experienced apprentices who are hungry to grow their skills to gain our L4 Qualification giving them career progression and further development. A rewarding role as you watch your learners grow.      

Your focus:  The role will involve a blend of teaching, practical exercises, supporting self-study activities and assessment. The programme involves a wide range of skills across Business Analysis. It is expected that the Tutor would be able to deliver majority of the classroom sessions as aligned with the BCS Diploma in Business Analysis but at busy times would involve other Tutors. As a result, the role will require close working with the Service Delivery Team and other tutors to ensure smooth handovers between sessions, consistent approaches to assessment and a shared understanding of apprentice progress

Bring your experience:

Experience of working as a Business analyst in diverse environments

Experience of working with IT/IS Change projects

Experience of working through the full cycle of Business Analysis including liaison with various stakeholders.

Experience of working with data including data reporting.

Previous experience of teaching/training different audiences (classroom or workplace)

Completed and certified in the BCS Diploma in Business Analysis

Experience with BCS Business Analysis Modules such as Requirements Engineering, Commercial Awareness, Business Analysis Practice, Systems Modelling and Business Change.

Excellent communication skills

A logical thinker and a passion to achieve

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.           

More about the Team you will be working with: Working with our delivery teams you will enhance the quality and development of our learners, providing a first class and exceptional level of service.    

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!  

QAA Account Manager

Apprenticeships

Birmingham

Read More

QAA Account Manager

Recruiters, Account Managers, BD Managers, Sales Executives... we want YOU! If you're based IN BIRMINGHAM and are looking for the next step in your career PLEASE RESPOND TODAY.

Based in the Birmingham office, you will play a key role in the whole sales cycle for apprentices, from bringing on new clients, building lasting relationships and account managing, to sourcing and placing apprentices within the workplace, you will play a crucial role within the team.

Using a consultative sales approach (which we will train you on), you will contact UK business leaders about taking on apprentices, something which is a valuable sell into a company adding benefits to both employers and candidates alike. You will be helping an apprentice get into the workplace and better their future prospects, whilst giving the client an individual who they can develop, mould and grow into their business.

You will have your own individual target which you will be rewarded against. You will be targeted on hitting/over-achieving monthly margin targets, increasing the number of buying customers in the account base, and continuously improving NPI (customer service) ratings.

The ideal candidate will have entrepreneurial spirit and determination, confidence and a proven track record in account management.

Financial Package and Benefits?

We understand that as an experienced sales professional you are not easy to prise away from the success you have built, therefore we are offering a competitive opportunity including a competitive commission package. Other benefits include Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

If you are interested in moving your career forward, please click apply

Learning Administrator

Learning, Government & Defence

Cheltenham

Read More

Learning Administrator

Administrator – Cheltenham

What is the role?

You will provide comprehensive administrative support to the onsite MLS team and onsite Management to ensure we meet our current Service Level Agreements with the client. To take ownership of the weekly administration duties and to complete these in a timely & accurate manner whilst ensuring that quality standards are consistently maintained. To co-ordinate the logistics of courses running for the client ensuring all is prepared in advance of the course, including visitor & laptop passes.

What you need?

You will need to have a methodical approach and be able to prioritise your workload as it changes. You will be a great communicator who will be interacting with both internal and external stakeholders. You will have great attention to detail and must be able to present to employers

Finally you will need to be willing to undergo DV Clearance.

What you receive?

A competitive base salary dependent on experience, pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

You will get 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan,  and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

About Us

QA Learning provides the most complete range of training courses and learning services available in the UK.

QA Learning offers world-class delivery through virtual, mobile and eLearning. We are listed as the no.1 IT training company by The Learning & Performance Institute (LPI), with 350+ fully employed learning professionals and subject matter experts and 24 centres with 230 classrooms across UK.

Customer Coordinator

Learning

Swindon

Read More

Customer Coordinator

What is the Role?

To provide high quality, dedicated, administration and logistical support for our managed learning service clients. The primary function of the Learning Coordinator is to be the first point of contact for all external learning requests, as well as provide local administrative activity for the client’s specific learning programmes and training events.

  • Provide professional advice on training courses to meet customer requirements
  • Research, respond to and advise on queries for all bookings
  • Follow up on all client requests while keeping the client informed of progress
  • Communicate and coordinate with other departments to resolve enquires
  • Build and maintain internal QA relationships
  • Build and maintain business relationships with clients by providing prompt and accurate service
  • Carry out tasks within the agreed time-frame
  • Foresee possible delays or complications and plan strategies to avoid or minimise them
  • Escalate matters where appropriate but aim to develop sufficient awareness of QA , the client and the MLS role in order to work independently

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive base salary (dependant on experience), Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

What do we do?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting, and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Must haves (We do need the following):

  • Previous experience in a customer service role – dealing with clients via email, telephone and face to face (if possible) – preferably Business to Business
  • Experience using internal CRM’s and IT systems
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office – Word/Excel etc. at beginner level or above
  • Great people skills (sounds cliché but building relationships is a key part of this role)
  • Competent in writing emails/correspondence

If you’ve read the above, feel we are the company for you. Then apply to us today. Speak soon…

Customer Service Administrator - Virtual Support

Coordinator – Virtual Learning

Are you fed up with your current role? Want to get more involved with customers? Great, then this role is for you…

What is the role?

As part of our Virtual Learning Team, you will be responsible for supporting our wide-ranging client base, managing our ‘Attend from Anywhere’ and Virtual on-line courses.

Dealing with our delegates/learners via email, telephone and WebEx, you will help support customers who cannot physically attend our courses but can virtually.

In this role, you will not only need good people skills but the ability to help from technical perspective running connectivity tests to ensure our customers have the right setup to attend our live online training (don’t worry we will give you the tools and know-how).

As part of the job, you will need to be able to work shifts when required to help support clients which can be 7:30am to 4 pm or 10 am to 7 pm. So if finishing early or later to beat the mad commuter rush interests you, then please read on...

How will we support you?

It’s really important to make sure you have the support required to do this role, which is why you will have a dedicated experienced team member train you on a daily basis until you are comfortable as well as your manager – Natalie. Natalie has been with QA for 2.5 years so has a wealth of experience to help guide you.

You will be joining a team of three in an environment that is relaxed, sociable and has a good team mentality where tea is a staple and going out after work is a regular occurrence.

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive base salary, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice (which we actively encourage), 3 days of additional training which does not need to be relevant to your role from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), and cycle to work scheme.

What do we do?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting-edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Must haves (We do need the following):

  • Previous experience in a customer service role – dealing with clients via email, telephone and face to face (if possible)
  • Experience using Microsoft Office – Word etc.
  • Great people skills (sounds cliché but building relationships is a key part of this role)

Nice to have

  • Previous experience using WebEx

Programme Events Administrator

Programme Events Administrator

Cheltenham  

Your focus:

As the Programme Administrator, you will work to provide a high quality, dedicated, administrative service. Your focus will be to provide day to day support to the Programme Manager and Workstream Leads.

The role includes:

  • Adding event bookings on QA’s Booking System
  • PO raising
  • Maintaining a PO and spend tracker
  • Invoice handling and tracking, as set by Programme Manager and Workstream Leads.
  • Daily project team tasks such as minute taking, arranging stakeholder meetings and collating weekly reports
  • Travel and accommodation sourcing, booking and reporting for delivery teams.
  • Overall responsibility for the collection, storage and transportation of programme materials such as, making up goodie bags, storage of posters and banners
  • Carrying out all other ad-hoc administrative tasks as required by the programme

Bring your experience:

  • High standard of literacy and numeracy
  • Strong sense of task ownership
  • Ability to work independently and under pressure
  • Methodical and accurate with a proven ability to focus on detail
  • Proven organisational & planning skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential
  • Use initiative to identify and resolve problems or issues
  • Determine when problems should be escalated to a higher level and act promptly to make relevant parties aware

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Salary range: In return we offer an excellent remuneration package with company benefits and development opportunities to enable you to reach your full potential.

How to apply and who to contact:

Using the apply link, please submit your details and we will be back in touch shortly. Should you have any queries and wish to speak with us please call the recruitment team on 01753 898671.

We look forward to hearing from you!  

Customer Service Representative

Learning, Government & Defence

Cheltenham

Read More

Customer Service Representative

QA have an exciting new opportunity to recruit, with immediate effect, A Learning Advisor to join a team that is dynamic, fast paced and passionate about working to the highest level of customer service for one of QA’s largest clients.

The role is broad in its nature and therefore the successful candidate will be able to multitask to provide a high quality, dedicated, administrative and logistical service whilst being the first point of contact to our client. You will be passionate about representing QA in the best possible way in every aspect of your role and thrive from working with members of staff who strive to provide an excellent service.

As the Advisor, you will:

  • Provide professional advice on training courses to meet customer requirements
  • Proactively build and maintain business relationships with clients by providing prompt and accurate service
  • Research, respond and advise on queries for all bookings
  • Follow up on all client requests while keeping client informed of progress
  • Communicate and coordinate with other departments to resolve enquires
  • Carry out tasks within the agreed time-frame working to specific frequently monitored SLA’s
  • Liaising with trainers and the scheduling team to arrange logistics, timetable and materials for the programmes.
  • Providing 'on the ground' support for the duration of the programmes, liaising with various QA teams to provide excellent combined team service.

The successful candidate will ideally come from a training/business background, having worked in either an office or learning environment for a minimum of 1 year. Desirable experience includes admin, advice and guidance, customer service, recruitment or sales. Other types of experience will also be considered if the skill-set is naturally transferable.

You will be highly organised with excellent attention to detail and with the ability to multitask. You will have an impeccable and confident telephone manner and be able to work to delight our customer in each step of their journey with us. You must have strong IT/technical skills and comfortable working with systems. 

For the position you must be prepared to complete a DV level of clearance and be happy to be work in a Cheltenham based role.

In return QA will reward your hard work with a state of the art office, an open working structure with direct contact and support from your Manager, the opportunity to progress and take part in self-development training opportunities, a secure working environment, a “family feel” team and exposure to an extremely interesting client.

We understand that superior performance starts and ends with our people; passionate people who like to make a difference and most importantly love what they do. If you would like to be a part of this exciting journey then please apply now!

Administrator

Administrator

Partner Solutions Administrator

Join the QA Team in Swindon as a Partner Solutions Coordinator

What is the role?

To provide high quality, administration and logistical support within the Partner Solutions team. The primary function of the Partner Solutions Coordinator is to be a first point of contact for our customer first stage queries, dealing with those queries and escalating where necessary.

  • Obtain and provide quotes for various training needs in accordance with client specific rates and standard QA rates
  • Research, respond and advise on queries for suppliers courses
  • Establish and manage relationships with all suppliers and ensure that the relevant systems are kept up to date
  • Confirm bookings on booking system (including raising and issuing Purchase orders) and process via agreed timescales
  • Confirm with suppliers bookings received
  • Ensure Suppliers are aware of QA standard payment terms and work with our Finance team to ensure that courses requiring prepayment are managed effectively
  • Work with sales team to confirm bookings in a timely manner
  • Follow up with suppliers for delegate joining instructions
  • Process all cancellations and transfers
  • Logistical arrangements for onsite training (co-ordinating between booker and supplier)
  • Escalate matters where appropriate but aim to develop sufficient awareness of QA and the client in order to work

What we offer?

No one wants to work for free so here’s what we give you:

A highly competitive base salary dependent on experience, pension scheme, 25 days of annual leave plus 2 days of paid charity leave!

We offer 3 days of training and over 1,200 courses to pick from, season ticket loan, and cycle to scheme are part of the package too. If that’s not enough we have dress down Fridays!

What do we do?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquarters in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.

Must haves (We do need the following):

  • High standard of numeracy and literacy
  • Ability to work alone or part of a team
  • Methodical and accurate approach to tasks
  • Customer focused
  • Good communication skills written, face to face and written
  • Ability to multi - task and prioritise workload

If you’ve read the above, feel we are the company for you. Then apply to us today. Speak soon…
