QA Apprenticeships

Home Based, Fulltime and Permanent Role   

OUR Role:

As a qualified IQA, you will be part of our team which ensure that quality standards are set and monitored in accordance with assessment, regulatory and funding requirements. You will work with the Quality Manager and Core IQA team to ensure timely feedback to Skills Coaches in relation to learner End Point Assessment readiness, in accordance with the IQA strategy.

Your interpersonal skills will allow you to work effectively with the all teams including sales, delivery and compliance to ensure that learners successfully complete their full apprenticeship by their planned achievement date

YOUR responsibilities:

Experience of working as an IQA quality checking non technical programmes within Apprenticeships

Proven record of working to at least Ofsted Grade 2 standards

Previous experience of Quality Management Systems

Internal Audit experience

Must have excellent administrative skills with the ability to prioritise workloads, work methodically, accurately and effectively under pressure while maintaining a positive attitude

Logical thinker who is willing to own and solve problems

Recognised teaching qualification essential

Detailed knowledge of Apprenticeship programmes

Knowledge of awarding organisation and Ofsted requirements

Good knowledge of Government funded Apprenticeship programmes

Flexibility in travel and willingness to stay away from home on occasions

Sales Executive

Learning

London

Read More

Sales Executive

About our role: Are you a recent GRADUATE looking for success, development and good financial rewards OR do you have some sales experience already and looking for the next step to a rewarding and lucrative sales career? Full Training Given. Read on………….. 

Your focus:. Through our excellent Sales Academy Training and working within our knowledgeable team as Inside Sales Executive you will play a fundamental role to develop new customer relationships through a consultative sales method. Our role is a mixture of taking inbound sales calls to maximise and develop each enquiry along with following up on marketing leads and developing new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls (full training given).  Success within the role will lead to promotion and further development.      

Day to Day: 

Sourcing new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and marketing

Identifying business opportunities and provide accurate forecasting of pipeline sales

Maintain a high level of telephone calls to potential, existing and lapsed customers ensuring that we promote customer care and generate new business leads to achieve targets

Monitor discounts being offered and ensure correct pricing is being applied to all opportunities

Route larger qualified opportunities to the appropriate sales team for further development and closure

Preparing quotes and proposals for customers

Providing excellent and effective customer service at all times

Updating and maintaining the CRM using all resources available

Advise the Inside Team Manager of any cross selling opportunities

Bring your experience:

Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to build rapport with key stakeholders

Driven and ambitious individual with a strong desire to succeed

Ideally previous experience in an inside sales role within a similar business

An entrepreneurial spirit and determination

Trustworthy and honest

The ability to operate well and contribute to a strong team environment

Self motivated

A deep understanding of the need to respond quickly to requests

Good attention to detail

Your Learning & Development with QA, how can we support you? Naturally you will have a comprehensive Induction Programme organised and you will be introduced to various internal teams and stakeholders. You will attend our well received Company Orientation Programme and of course complete our mandatory e-learning training.  Being a training and education provider, your continuous Learning and Development is of huge importance to us and as an individual contributor, we can agree a suitable Pathway to achieve your goals and aspirations.           

More about the Team you will be working with: Working within a lively and vibrant team, where we will help and support you at grow your knowledge and enjoy what you do, have fun at the same time making sure we are hitting our numbers.      

Our benefits and values:

Learning is not just a service we provide, it’s a way of life at QA, so everyone is eligible for 3 Training Days every year, to focus on subjects they’re interested in.

We offer 2 paid Charity Days each year to support your chosen charity in whatever way you choose AND if you get involved in charity fundraising, QA will also double any sponsorship money raised, up to £250. 

Recharge your batteries and enjoy some down time, so we provide a fairly generous 25 days’ holiday per annum (rising to 28 days after 5 years) – with the option to buy more if you wish.

It’s important, too, to plan for the future and our later years, so we offer a defined contribution pension plan and will match your contributions up to a maximum of 3% of your basic salary.

Giving peace of mind we provide by Life Assurance (4x your basic salary) and Permanent Health Insurance (after a qualifying period) in the event that ill health, or worse, disrupts our plans.

And finally, a few fringe benefits to assist with travel and lifestyle choices: Season ticket loan, Cycle to work scheme

Our Company: QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK, developing skills and capabilities for everyone from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London, but with a nationwide network of state-of-the-art training centres, QA Group is comprised of four fast-growing divisions- QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education- all of which deliver innovative and cutting edge skills solutions to UK organisations.About our role: Are you a recent GRADUATE looking for success, development and good financial rewards OR do you have some sales experience already and looking for the next step to a rewarding and lucrative sales career? Full Training Given. Read on………….. 
Your focus:. Our role is a mixture of taking inbound sales calls to maximise and develop each enquiry along with following up on marketing leads and developing new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls (full training given).  Success within the role will lead to promotion and further development.

Technical IT Networking Trainer x2

Teaching learners in-demand skills to transform their lives and careers. Top-notch, trending tech apprenticeship programmes. Flexibility, fulfilment and a great salary. Sound appealing? Then we’ve got the role for you.

We’re seeking IT Networking Trainer based in London who loves helping others learn and accomplish their goals. This is an exciting, fulfilling role helping learners to grow their skills and achieve their potential.

About the role

At QA, we know that real life doesn’t happen in a textbook, so we run our apprenticeships in a modern, blended format – in the classroom, online and in the workplace.

With our support, you’ll deliver this tech apprenticeship course content face-to-face in the classroom and through e-Learning or digital formats. You’ll teach both scheduled public and customised courses for relevant areas of QA’s tech portfolio: IT, cybersecurity or web/software development.

This role is about teaching and supporting learners to help them succeed—whether they’re qualified professionals looking to upskill, or beginners (including new grads) making the leap into tech careers.

You are…

  • Experienced in training or tutoring with an interest in career development
  • Knowledgeable about or interested in tech areas (and willing to learn)
  • Passionate about supporting/teaching others and sharing your expertise
  • Confident in customer-facing roles with strong presentation, interpersonal and communication skills
  • Eligible to live and work in the UK and able to travel to different locations
  • Able to plan and deliver against set learning and achievement targets

What we offer

  • Competitive salary (dependent on experience)
  • Private pension
  • 25 days holiday (28 after 5 years of service)
  • Two days paid charity work for a charity of your choice
  • Three days of paid training from your choice of 1,500+ diverse QA courses

Who are we?

QA is one of the largest learning services organisations in the UK. We help develop skills and capabilities for everyone, from apprentices to business leaders. Headquartered in London with 20 more training centres nationwide, QA Group comprises four fast-growing divisions – QA Learning, QA Apprenticeships, QA Consulting and QA Higher Education – all of which deliver innovative, award-winning (2016 Top 20 IT Training Companies List) and ever-evolving skills solutions.

Lean Six Sigma Trainer

Lean Six Sigma Trainer

London

QA Learning

Your role

As a Lean Six Sigma Trainer you will be qualified to deliver our Agile and Scrum curriculum. With excellent working knowledge of Agile and Scrum in an IT and/or business environments you will have a passion, hunger and thirst to deliver quality training to the market.

You will also be responsible for the development and management of courseware. You will have proven customer facing, interpersonal and communication skills, along with the ability to work independently.

Your team

You will be required to work closely with the Business Skills Development management team including regular sharing of information with colleagues. You will be reporting into the Training Delivery Manager.

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive basic salary, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise) and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

Broad and in-depth knowledge of Lean Six Sigma and Agile Project Management best practice including but not limited to, AgilePM, DSDM.

APMG Agile Project Management Foundation and Practitioner qualifications.

Ideally have a working knowledge of other methods, best practices, frameworks and standards, including Prince 2 Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Lean, DevOps.

It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key, with a desire to work in a training environment. 

About Us

QA delivers market-leading learning services through four distinct business units, providing professional and IT training to private and public sector organisations, apprenticeships and higher education.  We have won numerous awards for excellence, customer service and innovation.  We are set apart by our scale, capability and customer-centric approach that delivers real business return to our customers.

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Training Consultant - Digital Skills

Training Consultant - Digital Skills

Are you a trainer looking for an exciting new challenge?

Do you have a passion for digital and innovative technology?

If you have answered yes then read on to find out more…

Your role

As a trainer you will be delivering scheduled courses, particularly those focussed on digital learning skills, to L&D professionals within both the public and private sector. You will be supporting learners by providing regular assessment and feedback.

As well as delivering, you will also have the opportunity to contribute towards the ongoing development of the TAP academy and programmes. You will get the chance to research new developments within the field and have your ideas heard. 

You will be very hands on in ensuring the learners completes scheduled assessments, tasks and presentations. As well as face to face training delivery, there will also be a requirement for occasional international travel to work with our overseas clients. 

Your team

The successful candidate will be working for the the Training Foundation, which is a part of QA. 

Based in our TAP Centre in Coventry, you will be reporting directly into the Director of Training. It is vital that you are comfortable working as a remote member of a small team, as this role will involve delivery on a UK and an International basis. 

Financial package and benefits

We are offering a competitive base salary, Private Pension as well as 25 days holiday, 2 days paid Charity work each year for a charity of your choice, 3 days of additional training from our very own course selection (1,200 to be precise), subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme.

Your background

Ideally you will already be a TAP accredited trainer. However, we can offer an extensive unique training programme to give you the qualifications required to deliver even if you are not currently TAP accredited. 

You will have experience of delivering in the digital world - and be able to provide real life examples of how you have used innovation and technology to inspire in a classroom environment. 

You would ideally be an experienced trainer who is used to training and working independently. 

It is a given with the nature of the role that excellent communication is key. Somebody with a genuine interest and desire around their trainer experience would also be preferred. 

If you think you have what it takes and have the relevant experience, skills and qualifications please get in touch.

Senior Lecturer

Senior Lecturer

Senior Lecturer – Chartered Management Degree Apprenticeship    

London OR Leeds OR Birmingham OR Manchester based 

Are you interested in management and learning research and it's use in innovative teaching, and less concerned with being research active (other than around how managers learn)? Are you a committed facilitator, as well as knowledgeable about, at least, two functional areas of management across sectors? 

Then join our fast growing degree apprenticeship team.  We are challenging, demanding and supportive with 100% staff retention. Consider us if you are wanting to implement our vision of stunningly high quality leadership and management degree apprenticeships.

QA’s Degree Apprenticeship is a highly innovative work-based programme, which has expanded rapidly since its launch in 2015, with strong retention and outcomes for apprentices. Our degree apprentices work for clients including FTSE100 businesses, central government departments, wider public sector organisations and small technology companies. The Apprenticeship division is part of QA, the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services training and education. Our multi-award winning programmes have been awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with  ‘Outstanding’ in all areas.

OUR Role:

Our Leadership & Management Degree Programme blends online learning, face-to-face workshops and on-the-job experience to transform apprentices into highly-valued graduate professionals. Apprentices gain a degree without financial pressures, unlike attending University.  

As Senior Lecturer, you will have the knowledge and ability to lead blended learning modules within the Chartered Management Degree Apprenticeship. You may have a speciality e.g. strategy, or finance or marketing or operations management. 

You will have a passion for, and opinions about, world class business education and professional management accreditations. Excellent communication and engagement skills are a must.

YOUR experience:

A Masters degree – preferably in business or PhD

Substantial teaching and learning experience, including work based learning and a specialist subject area

Previous experience developing module content including assignments and continuous improvement of module content at undergraduate and postgraduate level

Previous experience moderating assignments

A teaching qualification or a desire to obtain one

Experience outside of education in a business sector(s)

The skill and habits of someone who can role model continual learning and inquiry to improve productivity

An interest in, and updated knowledge of the impact of technology on business

Daily ways of working that include skills that enhance efficiency

Stakeholder management to deal with the new challenges of degree apprenticeships

Evidence of managing students within university rules and regulation 

Not required but desirable

Previous experience of managing modules

Previous experience of managing more junior lecturers/tutors

A specialism in operations management / marketing or finance for managers

Assistant Lecturer / Lecturer

Apprenticeships

Manchester, Birmingham, Leeds, London

Read More

Assistant Lecturer / Lecturer

Assistant Lecturer – Chartered Manager Degree Apprenticeship

London OR Birmingham OR Leeds OR Manchester based 

QA’s Chartered Manager Degree Apprenticeship (CMDA) is a pedagogically innovative, work-based programme that has expanded rapidly since its recent launch. Our degree apprentices work for varied clients including FTSE100 businesses, central government departments, wider public sector organisations and small technology companies. The Apprenticeship division is part of QA, the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services training and education. Our multi-award winning programmes were awarded the highest possible grade by Ofsted with ‘Outstanding’ in all areas.

OUR Role:

As an Assistant Lecturer, you will enjoy being responsible for the progress and academic achievement of degree apprentices on the Chartered Manager Degree Apprenticeship (CMDA).   The programme involves all aspects of Leading and Managing, allowing our learners to achieve a BSc (Hons) Degree in Professional Management. The role involves teaching and learning on innovative CMDA modules. They are innovative as they involve experiential learning, spiral learning, creating digital, future-proofed organisations, deep personalisation and the development of theories-in-action; all to approach work-based learning in a scholarly, professional and considered way. You will also be involved in the development of module material, liaison with coaches who visit the learners in the workplace and the marking of assessments; all to create a progressive and valuable experience for every student and their employer.

You will be expected to teach at least across two functional areas and to be able to accommodate learners integrating material from any module, into any role, into any sector. The role requires working with Senior Lecturers, who are Module Leaders, and the Associate Dean in charge of Degree Apprenticeships in Managing and Leading. We work as a close-knit, well-managed team, sharing teaching experiences and new ideas. We challenge each other and work determinedly and efficiently, to reach ever improving teaching and learning standards and outcomes.

Having a passion for teaching, imparting knowledge and engendering new skills and behaviours, keeping up to date in an ever-changing world, and importantly role-modelling your interest in inquiring into organisations to promote the professional development of managers, are all needed for this varied role.  

YOUR experience:

A Masters degree – preferably in business*

Previous experience in Higher Education at undergraduate level and/or above

Teaching and learning experience, including work based learning and a specialist subject area**

A teaching qualification or a desire to obtain one

Experience outside of education in a business sector(s)

The skill and habits of someone who can role model continual learning and inquiry

An interest in, and updated knowledge of the impact of technology on business

Daily ways of working that include skills that enhance efficiency

Evidence of managing students within university rules and regulations or operating in a similar, quality led environment

 

* Candidates with teaching and learning experience without a Masters degree will be considered

**Candidates wanting to enter teaching and learning at Higher Education level for the first time will be considered, if they have a Masters degree

 

Programme Leader Senior Leader Degree Apprenticeship MBA

Apprenticeships

UK Wide

Read More

Programme Leader Senior Leader Degree Apprenticeship MBA

Programme Leader – Senior Leader Level 7 Degree Apprenticeship

London  

QA’s Degree Apprenticeships are a pedagogically innovative, work-based programmes that have expanded rapidly since their launch in 2015. QA is adding the new Level 7 Senior Leader Degree Apprenticeship to our portfolio of programmes.  As a result, we are seeking to employ an experienced Programme Leader to provide strong leadership and ensure that the programmes are reflective both of the latest developments in the subject area and teaching and learning innovation aligned to employer needs. The candidate must also have experience in managing the detail of Level 7 programmes and evidence high levels of stakeholder and customer satisfaction.

Our degree apprentices work for varied clients including FTSE100 businesses, central government departments, wider public sector organisations and small technology companies. The Apprenticeship division is part of QA, the UK’s leading provider of IT and business services training and education. Our multi-award winning programmes received the highest possible grade by Ofsted, with ‘Outstanding’ in all areas.

OUR Role:

As Programme Leader you will be responsible for the academic management and development the portfolio of Programmes that have been designed to meet the Senior Leader Degree Apprenticeship Standards. We are looking for an individual who can display strong aptitude for people management to lead our team of lecturers, alongside having a rigorous approach to quality of teaching, learning and assessment. You will be responsible for managing this work-based blended learning programme for both the Senior Leader Degree Apprenticeships alongside spending up to a maximum of 50% on module leadership and teaching. As our Degree Apprenticeships are delivered as collaborative provision, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining excellent working relationships with the appropriate University partners.  QA’s Degree Apprenticeship programmes are a collaboration between the QA Apprenticeship and QA Higher Education divisions. You will be employed in QA Higher Education and should expect to work closely with QA Apprenticeship colleagues.  This approach provides an opportunity to integrate the strengths of great client intelligence and apprenticeship support with that of academic excellence, developed with our university partners and through interaction with the academe including the latest scholarship on management education.  We believe that the desire to challenge each other and the sharing of experiences and ideas, creates an environment that improves our learning standards and outcomes.

Having a passion for teaching, imparting knowledge and engendering new skills and behaviours, keeping up to date in an ever-changing world, and importantly role-modelling your interest in inquiring into organisations to promote the professional development of our degree apprentices, are all needed for this varied, evolving role.  

YOUR experience:

Programme management and line management experience essentialand holding a PhD in Management or Leadership

HEA qualifications – preferred  

Lecturing experience; more than one subject area within the specialisms of Management and/or Leadership

Experience of delivering, working within, or contributing to Degree Apprenticeships would be an advantage. Equally, any blended learning or work-based programme experience would be welcome.

Submit your CV

001

Account Director Solutions

Are you successful, strategic, consultative sales person looking for an exciting, fast paced role within a growing and vibrant company?

Within this role you will have strategic responsibility for a large contract with a well-known Systems Integrator, working with their customers to support IT Contracted Services and deployment projects. Although part of our learning organisation, the learning and support solutions are bespoke to this contract.

This is a senior role, it is challenging but hugely rewarding. It will fit someone with a real passion for developing new business, be an advisor for our SI and their clients and be involved in the development of new, innovative ideas for the delivery of high quality services.

Read More

Read more about Lucy Client Relationship Director QAL

004

"Work hard and be nice to people"

Hi Im Lucy. Ive been with QA for over three years now and love it! When I joined QA was already a big player in the market and seemed to be the best fit for me in terms of culture and prospects.

QA isa great place to work aseveryoneis so supportive. Ive made some great friends here and its lovely to see them succeed within the organisation too.

Outside of work I enjoy lots of exercise including running, cycling, gym work and walking Ziggy (my dog). Probably my greatest achievement is beating my peers at the JP Morgan charity run last year (I have to retain my title this year!).

Meet our people

IWD 2017: Introducing the women rocking the tech industry

001

Introducing the women rocking the tech industry

It was recently uncovered that nearly 50% of a sample of female tech professionals, within public and private sector organisations, were actively discouraged from working in tech by those close to them.

This video aims to dispel the perception that tech is just for men, with a message from women who work in tech within the UK. Hear from a hairdresser, turned tech apprentice, a mum of three cyber security expert, a tech consultant, a teenager software developer, and the Queen of tech Dame Stephanie Shirley.

Who we are and what we do

Our business areas

001

Our Business Areas

Within QA we have four key business areas. Here you'll learn more about what each of them do.

Read more about Michael MuleSoft Technical Lead - Consulting

Consulting

QA is a leading provider of Consulting Services to commercial and financial organisations and Government departments.

We operate a set of unique customer enablement programmes in which we provide industry leading capability in prominent Digital, Middleware, SaaS and Big Data technologies. We excel in recruiting, training and supplying our own specialist consultants, and we also operate an Academy that offers expertise across many leading technologies, enabling scalability and stability of customers delivery teams for Graduates. Our training pathway provides a solid development foundation focusing on market leading technologies.

Click to view our latest vacancies in Consultancy Visit the Consultancy website

001

Learning

Our Learning division is the UKs leading business and IT training company. We have been committed to learning excellence for over 30 years, offering over 1500 training courses, certifications and seminars, including official courses from professional bodies and leading vendors like Microsoft. We also run bespoke courses and training solutions to businesses of all sizes, including a full Managed Learning Service (MLS).

Our client base numbers over 6000, including 80% of the FTSE 250. We deliver over half a million delegate days of training every year and we constantly challenge ourselves to keep the same high quality every single day.

We have 20 learning centres and many other partner locations spread across the UK, providing a convenient choice of training destinations. Using the latest technology, we also provide the option to Attend from Anywhere on a wide range of courses, so you can learn without having to leave home or the office.

Click to view our latest vacancies in Learning Visit the Learning website Read more about Anoop Junior Scheduler - QA Learning
Read more about Matt Account Manager Apprenticeships

Apprenticeships

Formed in 2009, our Apprenticeships division is the first IT apprenticeships business rated Ofsted Outstanding. We are an award-winning provider, offering IT, developer, digital marketing, project management and business apprenticeships throughout England and Scotland.

Our Apprentices work with industry leaders including Atos, British Gas, BskyB and Cisco. We have won the coveted Apprenticeship Programme of the Year award for three consecutive years at The Learning Awards 2012, 2013 & 2014, and we are the leading apprenticeship partner for Microsoft, Oracle, HPE, Cisco and Association of Project Management.

Click to view our latest vacancies in Apprenticeships Visit the Apprenticeships website
Read more about Ihar Head of Learning Resources, Higher Education

Higher Education

Developing aspiring professionals in an increasingly competitive global environment QA Higher Education delivers over 60 industry-focused programmes to 3,000 culturally and internationally diverse students. Our aim is to widen access to higher education and provide a fulfilling, challenging and intellectually stimulating experience to best prepare students for their career and progression.

We work we work closely with forward-thinking university partners to recruit, market and deliver a range of programmes from foundation level, to undergraduate and postgraduate degrees.

Our portfolio of programmes offered at our centrally located campuses and learning centres are taught by a mixture of QA Higher Education and University staff resulting in accomplished graduates who are motivated and highly employable.

Click to view our latest vacancies in Higher Education Visit the Higher Education website

001

University partners

Ulster University

Our portfolio includes Ulster Universitys branch campuses located in central London and Birmingham. Delivered in fully-equipped, professional learning environments we offer undergraduate and postgraduate degrees in Business and Computing.

Northumbria University

Higher Education works in partnership with Northumbria University to offer full-time and part-time industry-focused Business, Computing, IT, Digital and Project Management courses in central London. In addition, we offer a number of pathway programmes at the main campus in central Newcastle.

University of Roehampton

Higher Education partners with the University of Roehampton to deliver undergraduate Computing and Business programmes in centres in London, Birmingham and Manchester. In addition, we partner with the university to deliver international pathway programmes, taught at Roehamptons main campus in London.

Middlesex University

In partnership with Middlesex University, Higher Education offers Business undergraduate programmes with a Healthcare and Accounting specialisms at our centres in London Holborn, Birmingham and Manchester.

Solent University

Higher Education works in partnership with Solent University to deliver a Pre-Sessional English course and an International Foundation programme with subject-specific pathways at the Universitys main campus in Southampton.

You can find out more about the different courses and locations on theHigher Education website.
